Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mel3412
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. The staff was attentive and helpful. The entire hotel was clean and fresh. We enjoyed the indoor pool as well as the outdoor, both are kept up nicely. The location is perfect and the free breakfast was the best I ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel well placed for local amenities and access to attractions”
Reviews.Author: SCAN60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on a part of International Drive which is a pleasant avenue replete with mature trees and a wide range of places to eat, drink and shop are in easy walking distance. It is well served by public transportation and has good road access so travelling to and from the area’s many attractions and shopping venues is easy. International Drive is in between the Disney and Universal complexes, so is well placed for those intending to visit both. It is also only a short way (walkable) from the huge Orange County Convention Centre. On entry to the foyer, you are greeted by a huge covered atrium surrounding which are the room walkways. Above the ground floor level there are seven floors of rooms. Public spaces and most rooms are non-smoking, but there are a few smoking rooms available. There is WiFi throughout, available at a fee. Self-parking is complimentary and there is valet parking at a fee. The atrium has many tables and chairs where one can meet and/or relax in a very pleasant environment. Rooms on the top floor (only) have a tiny balcony just large enough to step out onto. There is a bar, two swimming pools (one inside, one outside) and a fitness centre. A complimentary breakfast buffet, with some cooked-to-order items, is provided, and this has a far broader section than is typical for many US hotels. Standard is fairly good. And for two hours early each evening, complementary beverages, including alcohol, are available to all guests (alcohol subject, of course to the legal age limit of 21). There is a small (and expensive) shop offering confectionery, soft drinks and trinkets etc., and a vehicle rental counter. The hotel has International Drive to the front and the very busy Interstate 4 to the rear. External traffic noise from both does penetrate guest rooms. This may disturb some people. And my room on the second floor was, I guess, close to the lift (elevator) plant and an annoying intermittent low hum was a disturbance. We stayed here on two occasions recently, each stay for two nights. Reception staff were pleasant enough but there was, perhaps, just a little less of a feeling of welcome than in some other hotels. Nevertheless, a problem with our reservation on the second occasion was resolved well enough despite the hotel being almost fully booked. The rooms themselves are large and comprise two parts with a door in between. The first part is a parlour area with comfortable lounge furnishings, a desk, and a “wet bar” with a small sink, coffee maker, fridge, microwave, etc. The main bathroom is accessed from this room. I understand that, as an option, one may choose a room where the parlour is instead arranged for business/conference meetings with a large table and several chairs. I also understand that there are both “presidential suites” (with two bedrooms and two bathrooms) and accessible rooms available. The second room is the bedroom which also has a washbasin and vanity unit. There are two types of bedroom; those with one king bed are slightly smaller than those with two queens, but the overall space in either is more than enough. There are TVs and telephones in both rooms. The bed was very comfortable and everything worked as it should. The hotel and rooms are air-conditioned throughout. In all, this is, for those with the necessary budget, a good place to stay, ideally located, but with the matter (an issue for some, perhaps) of the traffic noise. The complimentary breakfast and evening drinks provided go some way to justifying the cost, as does the room environment. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: born2sail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on International Drive this March. We were in town for a swim meet and the hotel was just a 5 minute walk from the YMCA pool so this was very convenient for us. There was no shuttle from the Sanford airport so we had to rent a car but the hotel was easy to find and it offered free self parking so it was not a problem. Breakfast was served from around 6:30 to 9:30 or 10 so there was reasonable time to eat and the food was always stocked and available. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful, in fact more so than most hotels we have stayed at. Our room was on the 4th floor in a corner area and it was really quiet and the beds quite comfortable. The air conditioning unit at this hotel was so quiet we barely noticed it and this is very rare in most hotels. The only small issue we had was that one day during our stay housekeeping came rather late while we were dressing to go out for dinner. We opted to forgo the room cleaning that day and just swap our dirty towels for clean ones so it was not really a problem. This hotel is on the trolley line which makes it easy to get around and it also offers free transportation to Disney though the times are somewhat limited. Overall this was a very good stay we would definately return and recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good”
Reviews.Author: bwhfhb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for about a week, and found the hotel pretty good. The location is excellent, and the construction of the suites assures good sleep quality and very little noise. The breakfast buffet was pretty good too, and most of the staff was nice. There was however one thing that annoyed me about this hotel,and that was the staff in the souvenir store. One of their employees was very rude in general, and there was an incident where I was suddenly asked out of nowhere if I was pregnant (I am average built, never been pregnant and to be honest I found this question to be rude). Other than that a good hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great happy hour, lobby, breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Renebean319
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It was in a great location, rooms were nice etc but there was one downfall. Roaches in the lobby and two in my room towards the end of my stay. Would I stay there again? Yes but take care of that problem before it gets out of control.

Reviews.Title: “Great base and breakfast too!!”
Reviews.Author: Lil61
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three years ago and decided to return 6th March 2012 as we really liked the location, size of suites and the fact that full breakfast is included - very unusual in Florida! Plus there is a complimentary managers drinks reception every evening from 17:30 to 19:30 in which you can have various drinks and nibbles free. Great if you just get back from theme parks or shopping and want to chill out. The staff here are great and very helpful and the suites are very spacious and well equipped with a fridge and microwave in a kitchen/lounge area plus huge beds as are the norm over there. All was kept spotless and when we had a minor drip from the ceiling in the bathroom on our last evening maintenance came and fixed very efficiently and speedily - even offering to pay for our dinner that evening or a free dessert when we explained we were already heading out somewhere else and they told us to contact them on our return that night and they would sort something out by way of an apology for the inconvenience. Talk about "going the extra mile" they were great!! The only downside was the traffic noise from I 4 due to our room situation but we were exhausted when we went to bed so it didn't really bother us too much. Will definitely return if going to Orlando in future.

Reviews.Title: “another great holiday”
Reviews.Author: FrankW16
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel several times before and as usual had a great holiday. The rooms are of a very generous size with both bedroom and lounge. Our room overlooked I4 which can be a little noisy if you have the patio doors open, but definitely not noticable with the doors closed and if you look passed the interstate you can see the firework displays of both Magic Kingdom and EPCOT in the evening. Its nice that there are complementary drinks in the evening, a nice treat if we where back in time, and the complementary breakfast is more than adequate with plenty of choice. The staff are faultless and nothing is too much trouble, it was my birthday on the day we arrived and a lovely surprise was a cake in our room. The bar and breakfast staff are quick to remember our likes and dislikes and certainly give service with a smile. The hotel is in an exellent location, plenty of restaurants and shops within an easy walk and not too far to the parks. Am already looking forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: isabellouise
Reviews.Content: I booked a family 6 week holiday from Dec 2011 through to Jan 2012! We originally booked a villa which was not as advertised when we arrived. So we found this wonderful hotel and enjoyed our 5 week stay at this hotel. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, all helpful and friendly, the location was great for us, yes we did have a car but also used the free theme park shuttles, which again were great and the service good. With our small daughter it was easy to walk out at night and have dinner as there was lots right on our doorstep. We did have a small problem with a leak in our room and the staff were great at moving us to a new room, again great service. We would come back to this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad (Disney Cruise Layover)”
Reviews.Author: UPRR_engineer
Reviews.Content: Wasnt the greatest place we ever stayed, but it wasnt a bad place to sleep the night before we headed for the Disney Dream. Breakfast was pretty good in the morning. Wasnt that impressed with Orlando, dont think we'll be going to Disneyland anytime soon and i wouldnt suggest anyone stay here if they are going to the parks. Didnt feel like i was on vacation really, it just worked for what we had going on! Hope that helps you decide! Anyone who raves about this place must not have stayed at somewhere super nice.

Reviews.Title: “long long time ago”
Reviews.Author: YCYMRO
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel in 1997. It seems that nothing has changed in that the rooms were spacious, secure and the breakfasts were fantastic and fun, with plenty of choice. Whilst I appreciate that any review now would be rather obsolete I can vouch for the location which is ideal as long as you have a car. Transfer to any of the Disney parks, Universal Studios, or Sea World is easy and convenient. This comined with the other reviews sound like a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay Close to Universal!!”
Reviews.Author: ChattyCathy56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for 2 nights while going to Universal in February. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a moderately priced hotel that gives you alot of amenities and a wonderful location close to restaurants, etc. We have stayed at 5 star resorts in the past and felt more comfortable and at home here. The suite (2 rooms) was very spacious and clean. The atrium area was beautiful and the complimentary breakfast was fantastic. In the evening we walked to the restaurants. Especially enjoyed Bahama Breeze (across the street) and the Olive Garden (right next door).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Orlando area hotel - close to lots of things”
Reviews.Author: baileyno6
Reviews.Content: We picked this Embassy (we like Embassy Suite Hotels) because of its location. We were generally happy with it though the shuttle to the Disney property is pretty limited in its schedule. The hotel could make guests more aware of the ameneties along International Drive and the Trolley that can take you to them (we had to figure it our for ourselves). A nice hotel with dependable Embassy Suites' features.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Manhattan44
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel is ok.....nothing plush about it. Rooms are kinda small. It was clean and had super nice employees. However, the location was absolutely fabulous. There were so many places you could walk to. International Drive is a great place to stay. And the free breakfast was one of the best I have had at a freebie hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Clean Rooms, Slow Elevators.”
Reviews.Author: HiltonHotelFan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several of Embassy's Properties in Orlando before and they have all disappointed me. This one on the other hand was fantasticl! Beds were very comfortable and blackout curtains were great! Location is not that bad either. PROS: Spotless Friendly Staff Business Center Workout Room and Pool Free Breakfast Big Rooms -- Kingbed AND Couchbed Full Wetbar! (Not typical in your Embassy Suites) CONS: SLOW ELEVATORS! (at least their glass!) Small Bathroom I do recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area as it is only about 30 minutes from Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location!”
Reviews.Author: luthgicap
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel early December 2011 and had a great stay! Rooms were large and comfortable if slightly dated. The curtains closing problem mentioned by other reviewers can be overcome by moving furniture but really is an issue which needs to be attended to by the management. Breakfast was great and the nightly happy hour was another bonus with unlimited drinks, although there were a few one evening who took the hotels hospitality too far!! Location is fantastic and we enjoyed great food at Bahama Breeze, Millers Ale House and Olive Garden without walking any more than a few hundred yards! This was a priority for us as December nightfall is before 6pm. Loads of other great restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “30th Birthday Party”
Reviews.Author: Psychometrician
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter and all our family (8 plus a baby) to Embassy Suites to celebrate her 30th. We rented two suites. Arrived at 4 for hot tub time (not very hot) and integrated it with the manager's reception by ordering drinks in plastic cups and transferring them to fun plastic themed goblets. The ladies wore black dresses with pearls to dinner and guys dressed up, too. Ordered Outback specials and sent one person to pick them up so we could eat in the hotel's beautiful atrium. We set up and decorated tables in the atruium with black table cloths, pearls, pink and black balloons and red petals. After dinner we cleaned up any messes and went to downtown Orlando on Church Street to the Dessert Lady and the younger crowd went to Ceviche's and a rooftop club at the Amway Center. The next morning we met for the complementary breakfast at 9:30 and some pool time for the baby before checking out. The Embassy Suites was wonderfully accommodating. Comments from the guests included, "this is a kick-butt birthday party!" and "it is so much fun to come into a big city." Another amazing time at the Embassy Suites which is far and away our favorite hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites - Superb Location & Benefits”
Reviews.Author: thetravellingpotters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on International Drive over Christmas and New Year and have nothing to fault about the place. Upon arrival we were made to feel welcome and immediately given the keys to our room, which we found to be much better than anticipated. In the bedroom area there were two very comfortable double beds, with washbasin facilities and a large flat screen tv. Our bathroom was clean with shower/bath options. The living space had a pull down sofa bed, firm and comfortable, with table, large flat screen tv and coffee making facilities and a fridge. Over the course of the first few days of the holiday we had a couple of nags about the A/C in our room which we could not operate properly, which the maintenance team replaced and fixed within 1/2 hour. Housekeeping are only too pleased to provide more pillows and bedding - just ask. Both the bellmen/valet guys are also only too pleased to help with any query or question no matter how big or small, again just ask and you'll be met with a smile and super fast service. Breakfast is very acceptable and included in the price of the stay, queue to the left of the grill for express breakfast (sausage, bacon, chips, scrambled egg and pancakes) or use the center line for omelettes cooked to order. There is also cereal, porridge, pastries, coffe and tea etc. The fish eye grill has a good menu not bad value for money and an option if you don't fancy eating out. There is a small shop that has drinks, painkillers, sun cream etc as well. There is a lovely indoor pool and hot tub and spa - take your room key, but extra towels are provided to get you back to your room (there are no changing facilities). The hotel also uses an independant travel company that provides free shuttle service to the Universal and Disney Parks, with varied drop off and pick up times that suit fine. If you want to go to Sea World simply ask for a FREE day pass to use the i-Ride that runs the length of International Drive and has multiple stops every few hundred yards. We will definitely be returning to Orlando and be more than happy to use Embassy Suites again in the next year or so and will check rates direct next time and maybe book fights separately. It's not a 5 star hotel, but has very good facilities, very clean, has great staff and offers everything else we needed for our fun and full on two weeks family holiday in Orlando! We would 100% recommend this hotel to all travellers. Please check other reviews of the thme parks and excursions!! Hotel School Mark B+

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, but don't be misled....”
Reviews.Author: Greenmemonica
Reviews.Content: We chose Embassy Suites Hotel in Orlando because of the good experiences we've had with Embassy Suites in the past. However, we chose this particular hotel because of the advertised scheduled free shuttle to Disney and Universal attractions. Because we had the opportunity to use the free shuttles at previous Embassy Suites we had stayed at, we made the mistake of assuming that this one would run just like the other ones we had used. Every hour on the hour. Wrong. There were two trips to Disney in the morning--8:30ish and 10:30ish. That's it. They will pick you up from Disney, but only at 5:15 pm, 8:15 pm and maybe 10:00ish? The Universal shuttles were even more scarce. We were really disappointed when we realized the free shuttle was different than other experiences at Embassy Suites. I should have called and looked into it before we left. Be careful. We tried the shuttle one day--it only drops off at Epcot--which was another big mistake, because we had a heck of a time getting to Downtown Disney, which was our destination. It was really more trouble than it was worth, and didn't work for us at all. It took us two ours to get to Downtown Disney with the tangled web of Disney Transportation. Take a cab and pay the $30. It will save you a lot of time and confusion. Also, the online brochure advertises a steam room. Don't be misled. I had a bit of a cold and was looking forward to a steam, but it seems they don't have one. No one at the front desk seemed to know. The men at the front door who greet you are fantastic, but one of the females who answered the phone was very unprofessional, and was laughing so hard she could hardly speak. The free breakfast is great, but the complimentary happy hour is pretty sad. The room was fine, but the furniture and carpet was pretty worn. Couldn't hear anyone in the rooms next to us, which was nice. The location is fantastic. Great locations all within walking distance. Nice outdoor pool and sauna. Would recommend this hotel to others, but with above cautions. Probably wouldn't stay there again. Lots and lots of other hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: jennyjames7483
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 1 week.We normally stay in luxury 5* hotels but since we were going to be out at the parks most days we thought this hotel would be o.k. My expectations we quite low and to be honest I was amazed. The staff we really helpful, the quite breakfast was great, they didn't charge us for wifi since we were on holiday. And to top it all off I went to reception to ask about a weather forecast and Zachary printed off the weeks for us. We went to parks for the day and came back to find a card from Zachary to say sorry the sineshine state was not very sunny at the moment but please enjoy so complimentary coffees on us. He had left a pack of coffee and hot chocolate with some Christmas sweets in our room for us. He also removed 3 movie charges from our room. The hotel itself is ok,no light in the sauna, gym very basic, cracked tiles in bathroom. But none of this mattered really as for us it was the staff that made this hotel 5/5. Thank you Zachary ! we will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...needs to work on their housekeeping and breakfast service”
Reviews.Author: Smith022272
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've actually been disappointed with an embassy suites. We paid for 6 guests in our room and only had 4 pillow 4 towels etc. we have had to call down to the front desk after every day of house keeping in order to get the proper amount of the needed amenities. Not to mention is took an hour with engineering in order to local Channels on the TV so we could watch the NFL playoff game. Breakfast is very good if you don't mind standing in line for 20 minutes to get any of the hot items...even the express items that are pre made. Today every table was either taken or was filled with dirty dishes. We noticed that for nearly an hour not a single table got bussed by the staff and people were having to stack plates and trays all over the place just to sit... The piles were still there an hour after breakfast was done. Overall the hotel is great but the service was on par with a $69 / day budget in. Next time well try the Hyatt Place across the street I'm sad to say :(

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but don't turn up late”
Reviews.Author: andrewb113
Reviews.Content: 1st night we arrived very late and the only room left was next to reception and the lift ,very noisy and we hardly slept . After that we were moved and enjoyed the rest of our holiday.nice hotel good breakfast and very central location

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed in this hotel for the past 2 summers and found it perfect! The location is ideal; close to the parks and all the restaurants. The staff are very friendly and cannot do enough for you. The hotel itself is clean and very comfortable with excellent sized rooms. The breakfast is fantastic with so much choice and the managers reception (2hours of free drinks) every evening is a great touch after a hectic day walking around the parks! The free shuttle to and from the parks is ideal for those who don't want to drive. The only one down side is that we wish the pool was bigger, but having said that it is never too crowded and you often find yourself having the pool to yourself during the day. I would highly recommend this hotel - we will definately be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Warmth of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived until the day we checked out, everyone worked to ensure our stay was the best! In addition to the great hospitality, there are plenty of things to do, all within walking distance. I would definitely recommend your property to anyone traveling to the Orlando area for the level of hospitality alone!

Reviews.Title: “Good option for visiting Disney/Universal.”
Reviews.Author: Googin
Reviews.Content: First: I just read a recent review here on Tripadvisor that gave this property 1 out of 5 stars and complained about almost everything - ignore it. It sounds like they just got unlucky. It happens, and frequent travelers should know that. That kind of unreasonable and picky traveler should just stay at more exclusive, luxury-style hotels. Centrally located hotel on Int'l Drive, this property works no matter where you're headed in Orlando. It's not the fanciest Embassy Suites I've been to, but it worked well for us. Service at the front desk was good, and most staff we encountered throughout were helpful. The restaurant has very good, if slow service, but the food is hit or miss. Complimentary breakfast very nice with lots of options. Great gym and indoor pool. Also an outdoor pool - it's not the nicest atmosphere being surrounded by a wall next to the parking lot, but it's just fine. Rooms are a little worn, but to be expected in such a tourist-centric location. It is nice to have the separate living space with pull-out couch. The gift shop actually has some decent items. You do have to pay for internet service unless you're a premier Hilton Honors guest, but that's not uncommon in hotels close to the theme parks. Perfect place? Nope (very few hotels are.) Good spot for value? Absolutely. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it... No complaints”
Reviews.Author: shelleynelson
Reviews.Content: Great staff, nice pool area. Breakfast with made to order eggs and omlets. Shuttle to Epcot, universal. Two morning drop off times, two evening pick up times that worked very well. Enjoyed the room set up and comfortable bed. Would most definitely return again. Many restaurants and mini golf within short walking distance... Fabulous location on international drive. There is a subway close by too for less expensive food options. Pointe Orlando is dwalkable distance but maybe three quarters of a mile away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: clay304399
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a night whilst visiting Orlando, and was not disappointed. Hotel is part of the Hilton chain. We arrived at 2 pm and was able to check in although official check in was 4 pm. Staff were friendly and accommodating. We were on the sixth floor reached by elevator. The room is divided into a bedroom and sitting room. Bedroom was large with nice view,plasma tv,iron and ironing board. Plenty of storage units and a vanity sink. Bed was very comfortable. Sitting room had a desk with 3 chairs and sofa. Plasma tv with game control. Fridge,microwave and coffee maker. Bathroom was average size with vanity sink wc and bath shower. I chose this hotel due to its location for restaurants and bars and was not disappointed. Great stay, don't even look at the other hotels on I drive north where it is starting to look run down!

Reviews.Title: “we went back again”
Reviews.Author: josie137
Reviews.Content: travelling were myself,husband and 2 teenage daughters,we went from 4th December/18th December.....there was no other Hotel considered when choosing our holiday for 2011,in the heart of i-drive,plenty of restaurants and shops close by and also the Pointe shopping center,shuttles provided by the Hotel were excellent,got us to the parks for opening and for Seaworld there was complimentry i-ride passes that lasted for 24hours....the breakfast as usual was a great start to the day and i must give a shout out to Carmen,even on the busiest mornings she kept smiling and always had a lovely "good morning" for everyone,yes some mornings there was a queue but hey,it's a great spread for free!and a good start for the day,the reception staff were very friendly,especially Zach and Robert,(Robert i'm still looking into the Aran business lol)..Zach very kindly posted a birthday card for me which i was worrying over not getting back to my sister,the valet guys outside,Dee,Marc and Yousen,were the most friendly helpful guys you could wish to meet,everyday whatever one of the guys was on, there was always a joke or some helpful hint and a genuine interest in your day..another lovely person we met was Julie,she cleaned our room a few times and whenever we met her around the hotel she always said hello and asked if we were having a nice holiday......the bedrooms are a great size,with a vanity area which was handy for our daughters,..the living area has a wet bar and is stocked each day with teabags and coffee, a pullout sofa is available and flat screen tvs' are in each room..the bathroom is on the small size but adequate,..the new pool area is really nice and after a long day at the parks it was great to use the jacuazzi....on the cooler nights the indoor pool is a bonus......the restaurant attached to the hotel is the Fish Eye Grill..the staff in there were great(hi Lennox) and the food is lovely......all in all a great holiday,yes the furniture could do with a steam clean..but with thousands of visitors going through this hotel some things will look a bit dated...the staff and location are excellent,will we be back..YES...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: DanC-in-USA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the usual Embassy Suites formula and is very good for family trips to Orlando. It is well situated on International Drive and is near a number of good resturants. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle to the theme parks but operates on a restricted timetable. The complimentary breakfast is good and hearty andof the standard that the Embassy Suites is well known for. The complimentary Manager's Reception (aka "Happy Hour!) is a great way to finish a day at the theme parks. Staff were very friendly. Rooms were clean and tidy and spacious. Beds were very comfortable. There were a couple of minor cons. 1) The internet in the business centre was terribly slow. It took me 30 minutes to download some google driving directions and to "check-in" for our flights. Very frustrating. 2) Housekeeping left us a minor surprise every day. One day, they never left enough bath towels, another, no shampoo, another no bath mat. Nothing serious or "shop stopping" but not to the usual bullet proof service I've expected from Embassy Suites over the years that I have used this chain. All up, I'd stay here again and am happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: houston_aggie_11
Reviews.Content: Hi, My husband and I stayed at the Embassy on the Orlando International Drive from Dec19th through Dec 24th. We celebrated our 2nd wedding anniversary at the hotel. Zach at the front desk was an angel: he gave us a bottle of champagne and a lovely card upon our arrival. Not only is the service great, the location is perfect for couples/families that want to take a break from the Disney theme.There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are clean and spacious. would definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: paradisefound_11
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research and counseling with the family, a decision was made to book with The Embassy Suites on International Drive at The Convention Center. We were drawn to the indoor and outdoor pools and jacuzzis, the made to order breakfast, and the walking distance to restaurants and night life. My adult children were pleased with the manager's reception every evening. All of this worked perfectly, along with the shuttles to the parks.I didn't realize that I would end up needing one of the 4-5 laundry facilities in the hotel. The suite lay out provided a comfortable bed for each of us; I took the sofa bed for a few nights when I became aware that my snoring was keeping the kids awake. Even the sofa bed was comfortable! I am generally a very easy person to please. I read some of the reviews about the hotel being a little worn. I saw a little of what I read about but that was not my intention for coming to Orlando. None of these criticisms were enough to influence my stay at this hotel. If you need to find something to complain about, you will find it. If you keep yourself open to all of the wonderful people and options available to you, you will receive. We had a great time and would return again to this or any Embassy Suites Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel for the Disney Area”
Reviews.Author: Thegoodegg
Reviews.Content: This past week I stayed at this hotel with my husband and 2 young children (4.5 and 1.5 years old). We were also travelling with another family with same aged kids. The Embassy Suites served our purpose very well. We wanted to be in the Disney area without the big Disney prices and with flexibility to come and go on our own schedule with rental cars and to eat non-Disney food. What we really liked about this hotel: --Rooms are good sized, amenities like kitchenette were very handy. --Breakfast in the AM made the start to each day pretty darn easy --Pools were nice for our kids --Free parking --No resort fees --Clean and fairly comfortable --Quiet What we wished would be different: --Pack and Play (aka crib) was tiny and rickety. My son ended up sleeping with us which was not so nice but he simply did not fit in the pack and play and frankly it was in shameful condition. The hotel should invest in larger size pack and plays (they do come in different sizes) and they should be checked that they are not completely wobbly. This one even had an egg size hole in the mess on one size. Not nice at all. --Plumbing is lousy. The shower drain was slow and that was disgusting. Our friends reported the same thing. I asked housekeeping to fix it and they never attended to it. --Main bed was soft. I might be spoiled as we bought a top of the line bed at home, but even so, a hotel bed should not feel soft and rocky. this hotel could invest some money in firmer matresses and I bet everyone staying at this hotel would be happy. --Curtains in living room do not close in such as way as to give full privacy to the living room space. We had to push furniture up against the windows in an effort to have full privacy so my daughter sleeping on the pullout sofa could not be seen by passerby in the halls. --Sofa-bed was miserably uncomfortable. For a four year old it really does not matter but for an adult it is truly a punishment. This was a bony frame that would make any adult long for home and I am pretty sure that is not what a hotel wants its guests to feel. I say all this with a grain of salt. We were paying a quarter of what the Disney hotels were charging Christmas week. It is a quick drive to all attractions. The hotel in general is quite nice and a little shopworn, but then again every hotel in Orlando gets a big workout. Still, the Embassy Suites could have kept the drains clearer and the beds firmer and so on. You are, afterall, in the sorta luxury hotel business. We had a lot of fun in Orlando and would go back. BTW, if you want a nice dinner go to Bahama Breeze across the street and sit behind the reggae guy outside and your kids can run around, its not too loud and the food is quite good. Adults can eat like adults and the kids can eat well too. That's saying a lot in a tourist town.

Reviews.Title: “Not up To Embassy Suites Name”
Reviews.Author: ugafan33
Reviews.Content: To say this was the worst hotel experience I have had at a Hilton property or any property would be an understatement. I am a Diamond member at Hilton and stay at a Hilton property just about weekly. I spend usually 80 nights a year at hotels. From the second myself and my 8 year old got there it went down hill. We checked in at 4 oclock got the key from the desk clerk who barely said hello. I asked about getting a cart to get my luggage out of the car and he said to check with the person outside for one. I asked said person and the response I received was " I am too busy too help you right now if you can come back in 20 minutes you can have the cart" So needless to say I made several trips up and down to get our luggage. When we got in our room there was no remote for the TV, light bulbs were out. They sent Jose up to fix them,,he was super,,I didnt realize he and I would get to know each other on a first name basis. The room was by the elevator on the 6th floor and which was super noisy all week and one of the elevators was out of order for the first few days. The carpet in the bedroom under the sink had a 6 inch hole in it that really should be covered up with a $3 mat or something so as not to be an eyesore. The bathroom had rust around the bottom of the door frame which again, if touched up with paint would make the hotel not seem so run down. The shower to get hot water took like 10 minutes to get warm. The toilet every time you would flush it sounded like a sump pump then a shrill squeal at the end. I would not even flush in the middle of the night as I was afraid it would wake all the neighbors above and below me. That finally got fixed.The pull out sofa was sooo bad that my 8 year old son even complanied about the 2 inch mattress and the bars in his back that he refused to even sit on it. The managers reception was subpar to say the least. I stay at Embassy Suites all the time and generally it is cheese,crudite etc. The first night here was tortilla chips with ranch dressing, olives, banana peppers and some sort of cracker mix. The next night again ranch dressing popcorn and potato chips. The next night,,Horseradish ranch, animal crackers and pretzels. I could not think of more bizarre combinations if I tried. I went to the on site restaurant which is not affiliated with the hotel and that staff was super. I was telling my bartender about how horrible my experience was and she immeditaely got her Manager who asked about my stay, she apologized and said she would make sure the hotel manager knew. Which again I got to know Jose the maintanance person on a first name basis but not one word from management about my concerns. Jose gave my 8 year old a $25 ticket to spend in the shop downstairs and a fruit bowl showed up in my room. The outdoor pool is super small and again looks like it needs to be pressure washed as the bottom is black. The indooor pool was nice. And the breakfast was good. I have never, ever left a vacation a day early but I did this time and came back home, it was just that bad. I stayed the day before at the Hilton Grand Vacation club about a mile away and wish I had stayed there my whole vacation as it was awesome. It was only $98 night and worth every penny. I used 70,000 points plus $60 a night at this Embassy and it was def not worth that at all. How this is a category 5 Hilton property is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “Well-managed, great choice for OC Conv Center”
Reviews.Author: missalonghi
Reviews.Content: Traveling as a group of 6 women (!) we had a suite with 2 beds and pull-out sofa. Beds were extraordinarily comfortable. Room 326 (eastern exposure which I recommend) had microwave, good-sized dorm refrigerator with plenty of room for doggy bags/bottles of wine,etc. The granite wet bar with these amenities is a really nice touch. All countertops were granite and tv's were all good-sized flat screens. Where this hotel shines is in it's employees. Clearly they are well-managed and carefully chosen. Friendly, professional, and above all happy. No surly, curt employees here which is hugely refreshing in a touristy area. Location-wise you can't beat this for ease of strolling to many restaurants, as well as the Orange County Convention Center which is a 10-15 minute stroll along landscaped sidewalks and pathways. (Look out for the many pedi-cabs which work these pathways--they move quickly as they work only for tips. You need to move off the wide sidewalks to avoid them.) BTW, these pedi-cabs are a great choice when you leave the convention center and don't want to walk to hotel. Just go across the st. to the restaurants where they wait for patrons and pick one up there. Back to the hotel. Indoor and outdoor pools with hot tubs in each location. Great facilities include appropriate heat to enjoy all the water. The gym is well equipped with Precor ellipticals, treadmills, and a stationary bike. Exercise ball, etc. Breakfast is complimentary and was on par with some Royal Caribbean breakfast buffets we've had. Each morning offers plain bulk yogurt or little cups, two kinds of melon; oatmeal, cold cereals, toast, lackluster pastries (the weak link). Also on offer are delicious made to order omelettes and sides of bacon, sausage, homefries, pancakes. The cook is fast, don't be daunted by a short line. He really cranks out these omelettes in under a minute a piece. Complimentary happy hour is not to missed and also draws a small line. We enjoyed pina colado-esque mixed drinks, several type of cocktails to choose from, or draft Bud. Late night dinner for 8 - 10 in the hotel restaurant was disappointing for the slowness of the food to arrive. Our orders took well over 30 min to arrive and there were only 2 other tables. But my burger and homemade cole slaw were tasty once they arrived. Final thoughts: the hotel has been upgraded and is in generally very good condition. Especially nice place to spend time: on the outdoor poolside chaises-brand new Tropitones, gorgeous and comfortable. Nice outdoor lunch venue adjacent. Only drawback to this hotel: it backs up to I-4 so there is background noise of this freeway. Did it bother us, nope!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: broadsword02
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 2 nights at this hotel after a tour of florida all the way down to key west and back. First impressions were good, no problems checking in and staff were polite, helpful and friendly. The main atrim / center of hotel like a courtyard with a roof, this is where you have breakfast (which is very good) and also the Managers Reception (complimentary drinks) is a good relaxer before going out. The hotel Restaurant / bar offers a good range of food at reasonable prices. The rooms have a lounge with TV and double sofa bed, bathroom and bedreoom with 2 queen beds ( other options available). A large wardrobe and plenty of draws. There is also a sofa bed in the lounge which is an added bonus. There is a swimming pool, but we didn't use it. There is plenty of free parking and lots of Restaurants close by so you can enjoy a drink with your meal. We went to universal studios, which is only a 10 minute cab ride (black taxi from hotel $17, yellow cab back $10) or the hotel has free shuttle. The florida Mall is only a 10 min drive away as are 2 designer outlet stores within 10 minute drive as well. If i was to go back to orlando or indeed USA, i would definately look to stay at an Embassy suite.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Danny L
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel and free full breakfast friendly staff price is usually abit high but keep checking they usually drop if u book close to ur date i stay here everytime i visit orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A great time”
Reviews.Author: Desnem
Reviews.Content: I wanted to say a big thankyou to everyone at this lovely hotel, especially to Dee, Mark, Zachery, & from breakfast Johnny & Elsa, you made us feel very welcome. The hotel was clean & comfortable, & the rooms were very spacious, the pool had just been renovated & was great for my grandson who loved every minute in it. Plenty of choice at breakfast, would definitely recommend the cheese & mushroom omelets. Can't wait to go back there....

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: HellyMbro
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel about five times now. its not the most plush or stylish but it has everything you need. Bedrooms are spacious and the bed is huge and really comfy. Bathroom fine, lots of towels, strong shower. Separate living room is great, though bit dark, with a kitchen bar with fridge, microwave, coffee maker. Free breakfast is good - omlette/hot food is served from one counter. Coffee, pastries, fruit, juices and oatmeal/cereals are help yourself. The pool is small but not many people seem to use it and there are plenty of beds. It can be a bit noisy as noise from the central atrium seems to rise. also if you are in a lower numbered room you can get noise from the adjacent I4. Loction wise its very central on International drive. A block away is a Ponderosa and Tony Roma. There's a Friendlys next door. Pointe Orlando is just over the road up a bit. All in all I like this hotel as its so convenient and well appointed. Its well kept and the staff are friendly and helpful. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Mario V
Reviews.Content: What a friendly atmosphere!! Excellent service! We just wanted to go visit our ailing father who is staying with our oldest sister in Orlando. Little that we knew, our visit to Orlando would turn into a very pleasant and relaxing time at the Embassy Suites Hotel of Orlando. From the moment we set feet in the Hotel lobby, we felt very welcome. The receptionist (her names escapes me at this time) stroke a conversation with us, a former Long Island resident relocated to Orlando. It was fun conversing with her about weather, snow and coffee. Breakfast time and personnel was just awesome! Friendly people all around us. We really felt very welcome guests here. The thermal indoor pool was nice. Ah,,, and get this: because the outdoor pool was under repair, we were offered to taxied to the nearby Hilton Hotel, which as an amazing outdoor pool for the entire family. We did not have to drive. I just mentioned we would like to be use the outside pool, and everything was orchestrated for us. Four incredibly relaxing nights and days with my wife! A home away from Home! We just want to say:"Thank you everyone! You Rock! Mario and Candida Veras From New Jersey.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of amenities!”
Reviews.Author: VincenViv
Reviews.Content: A nice, clean hotel. They provide breakfast with many options.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Embassy in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: larryinga
Reviews.Content: Whether you are a tourist or a business person like myself, this is by far the best located family friendly Embassy in Orlando. I stay there a few days every month on business and take my family there when the kids are out of school because the hotel is located in the Center of International Drive and within walking distance of the best restaurants on I-Drive. Since I have been staying here since 2004 on a regular basis, the staff have become somewhat of a second family. All I have to do is email Miss Elizabeth the very gracious front desk supervisor that I am coming to Orlando and in most cases, even in high season, she tries to make sure I always have a room. All of the front desk personnel are very friendly and treat me great. This hotel also have a fantastic cooked to order breakfast and Carmen makes the absolute best omelette in Orlando and Miss Charlene fixes the best drinks during the managers reception everyday from 5:30 to 7:30 pm. Let me also mention Jose one of the engineers. When I bring my family he kindly surprises my kids with candies and soft drinks in the room as well as complimentary passses for the games on the television. The rooms were all remodeled a few years ago and they have great flat screen televisions in the living room and bedroom. I highly recommend this hotel to business people attending conventions and families traveling to Florida to visit the theme parks. It is absolutely the best and so are the people who work there.

Reviews.Title: “great property”
Reviews.Author: jsjkgoodell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for a convention in October, 2011. The location was great for the convention. I walked to the convention center , it took about 15 minutes. It was a nice walk. The real bargain is the trolley that runs right by the hotel and all aver the area. You can purchase a pass for $2.00 per day, we bought a 3 day pass for 6.00 and rode all over town! It even takes you to major attractions like sea world,and they tell you where to transfer for the other parks. The pick up fro it is right outside the hotel. The hotel also has a pretty good breakfast. Their managers reception is really just some chips in a bowl.....rooms were nice, there aren't any queen size beds though, just double or king. I slept on the sofa bed, and it was surprisingly comfortable! All is all, our stay was very comfortable and I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reneelac
Reviews.Content: we stay here whenever we travel to orlando they have a great breakfast, the rooms are a great size for families, Its not too far from parks /activities,theres great nightlife around the hotel, & the staff is the best !!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: Broadsword02_11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 2 nights at this hotel after a tour of florida all the way down to key west and back. First impressions were good, no problems checking in and staff were polite, helpful and friendly. The main atrim / center of hotel like a courtyard with a roof, this is where you have breakfast (which is very good) and also the Managers Reception (complimentary drinks) is a good relaxer before going out. The hotel Restaurant / bar offers a good range of food at reasonable prices. The rooms have a lounge with TV and double sofa bed, bathroom and bedreoom with 2 queen beds ( other options available). A large wardrobe and plenty of draws. There is a swimming pool, but we didn't use it. There is plenty of free parking and lots of Restaurants close by so you can enjoy a drink with your meal. We went to universal studios, which is only a 10 minute cab ride (black taxi from hotel $17, yellow cab back $10) or the hotel has free shuttle. The florida Mall is only a 10 min drive away as are 2 designer outlet stores within 10 minute drive as well. If i was to go back to orlando or indeed USA, i would definately look to stay at an Embassy suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, Pretty Good Hotel = Fantastic Deal”
Reviews.Author: RevDoc2014
Reviews.Content: Free parking on international drive helps that equation too. The cooks here are better than the nice Hilton on I drive by the way. Bfast was the best! Hotel itself is a pretty good. Staff is very nice. Rooms feel a little dated and beds werent the most comfy but the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for attending a convention”
Reviews.Author: reino66
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful except for one grumpy bartender woman at the managers reception.. Made you afraid to go back for another drink! The location is perfect for attending a convention. Plenty of restaurants. Easy to get to convention if you cant walk by trolly and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and attention to detail in all areas, particularly restaurant staff and front desk.”
Reviews.Author: montvalehouse
Reviews.Content: This was an unexpected gem! Suites were very comfortable and roomy, staff was extra friendly and accommodating. Quality of food, amenities and the location were all above expectation. I have been to Orlando many times this hotel far exceedes my past experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family hotel”
Reviews.Author: gordoclan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fortnights stay at this hotel. Location- excellent for some great nearby restaurants and well placed for Disney/universal/seaworld the hotel provides free shuttles or iride trolley tickets but you are less than $15 for a taxi from universal too if the shuttle times don't suit. Rooms- yes the rooms are not as modern as some we've stayed at but they are spacious and clean and let's face it you don't visit Florida to spend your days in your room! I don't think we even switched on one of the two flatscreen tvs that are in each suite. Food- breakfast was free and very nice, got a bit tiring for me after 2 weeks but my husband never complained in fact the chef would have his order cooked by the time he reached the front of the queue! We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, we had room service one night which was fast and ok value, the free managers reception was also good if we were back from the parks in time, the kids loved their Shirley temples! Staff- last but not least these guys made our stay great, the guys out front, marc, jay and dee were lovely, nothing was too much and they always made time to chat and the kids even got model balloons from jay! Reception staff were very helpful with our queries and helped us out a few times as did the guys on the concierge desk with tickets, shuttles etc. The staff at the evening reception were also v nice, alexa? I think that was her name was very chatty and gave us great advice about weather etc, and when one of our boys was ill the guys were great and even got him something to help settle his stomach. Overall a great hotel, large enough to provde great services but small enough to care about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for families with a very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Sheethal
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Embassy Suites and the staff at this hotel seemed more attentive than I've experienced in the past. Everyone from housekeeping to the staff at breakfast seemed to enjoy being there and were more than happy to stop and have a conversation with us. The breakfast is not the best Embassy Suites breakfast I've had simply because it seemed like they had fewer selections. I agree with one reviewer that if you ordered scrambled eggs, they were a bit dry, but the omelets were awesome. The business office was easy to use and all computers worked. Rooms were clean and comfortable - granted the furniture is a tad outdated but honestly it was a nice airy comfortable room. At the time we stayed they were renovating their pool so offered us use of a pool at a nearby hotel. I would stay here again if I traveled with family and kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jsidebo
Reviews.Content: The family stayed at the Embassy in Jan. 09 and again in October of this year. This is a great location at least off season with many restaurants and stores within walking distance. Itâ€™s an easy drive to all the Disney parks and Sea World as well as the outlet malls. The staff is very helpful and friendly from the front desk to the housekeeping and maintenance folks. Typically Embassy rooms with a sink in the bedroom which is nice. The bathroom is on the small side. The site we stayed in could use a little updating but nothing major and it was clean. One thing about this hotel, if you have anyone using the pullout in the living room you need to use furniture to pin the drapes to the door frame so the light doesnâ€™t get in. Thereâ€™s a definite gap so people waling down the hall can see in as well. Great breakfast with a variety of pastries and some fruit in addition to the omelets. The managers reception had really gone downhill since 09. Smaller drink sizes which I can understand since some people I know sit and drink for two hours. However, two nights they ran out of Chardonnay and it wasnâ€™t that busy. The snacks were disappointing. Not much selection and they werenâ€™t kept full. The week we stayed there were outstanding rates.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Embassy Suites in Orlando (Convention Center)”
Reviews.Author: Marinaks2007
Reviews.Content: We absolutely enjoyed the stay, the breakfast, the staff, and the management! The room was clean, well stocked, and everytime we left the room, there was another staff member asking if there was anything we needed. Management was awesome and helped us when we were going to Universal in the pouring rain...they helped us with a ride there and back. The breakfast was terrific, although waiting on the line was a bit of a bummer in the mornings. However, I saw management step in and serve breakfast just to get the line moving quickly. Coffee wasn't great...that's about the only thing I could say that is negative about this hotel. Manager's reception was terrific and the bartender (can't remember his name sadly) was so very kind to us....we were not wanting for the drinks or snacks. We are returning next week for a night to try to attend Halloween Horror nights again (the rain was so bad, no scare zones and it was simply uncomfortable). I cannot wait to enjoy the Embassy Suites Convention Center yet again.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Other Choices in Orlando, Keep Looking!!!”
Reviews.Author: jolv
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed at this Embassy Suites â€“ 8978 International Drive for three nights. We are Hilton Honors members and usually love Embassy Suites but we were so disappointed with this stay. A prior guest mentioned a problem with a pushy bellman. Apparently, this problem has not been remedied. When I told Richard, the bellman that his help wasnâ€™t necessary, he stated that â€œI have to push the cart.â€� When I again stated that we were fine, he snapped â€œI only have one cart and I canâ€™t let you have it. I donâ€™t know when you will bring it back down.â€� I replied we will unload the cart and bring it back down right away (which we did). He stated â€œas long as you bring it back down immediatelyâ€�, and he finally walked away. Aside from being extremely pushy and obnoxious, Richard was lying because I know the hotel has at least two luggage carts because we saw them at check in. This was our welcome to the hotel. The dÃ©cor of the rooms is circa 1970â€™s, the curtains, sofa and carpet desperately need to be replaced. However, the white bedding and flat screen televisions were appreciated. All the rooms are sprayed with a sickening sweet room deodorizer. Also, despite multiple visits from maintenance, the air conditioning was never adjusted properly and our bedroom was still extremely uncomfortable. The main reasons we stay at Embassy Suites are for the up-to-date spacious rooms and for the breakfast service. Unfortunately, this hotel is lacking in both. Anyone who would rate this breakfast highly has not stayed at other Embassy Suites or is just thrilled to have an all-you-can eat â€œfreeâ€� breakfast. The omelets were overcooked and dry; the bacon was very fatty and limp, not crispy; the scrambled eggs tasted like egg substitute; and the muffins were ice cold and gummy. Every morning we would try to find something edible, and every morning we were extremely disappointed. Regarding the managerâ€™s reception, we do not drink cocktails but did notice that the line was ridiculously long during the reception hours. Perhaps, additional employees should attend to the guests during this time. Also, we did not use the indoor pool because the chlorine smell was overpowering and the outdoor pool area was so small and crowded, it could not accommodate all the guests. To the hotel's credit, the General Manager adjusted our bill because of our miserable stay. However, since there are so many choices in Orlando, I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: lzk99
Reviews.Content: Clean and decent hotel. Was staying for a conference and everything was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “faultless in every way.”
Reviews.Author: steveorlando070
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at many hotels on international drive but this was our 1st visit to embassy suites. from the minute we walked in we were so impressed. the hotel looked attractive. the sort of place you'd want to spend time in. the rooms were very well equipt with everything you need. and also were kept spotless by housekeeping. the bathroom was plenty big enough to do everything you need to do in a bathroom. i think some people expect to be able to ballroom dance in their bathrooms. breakfast was as good as a breakfast you'd go out and pay for, lovely fresh food and more choice than you could wish for. hotel location was perfect for us. restaurants were very close. and pointe orlando was maybe a 5 - 10 minute stroll. as athers have said, i cant enphasise enough the friendliness of all staff. after staying in many hotels in the past, you can tell genuine friendliness from 'its my job to be friendly'. and the staff at the embassy suites were genuinely very friendly. they didnt talk to you because it was their job to. they did it because they wanted to. this is the most impressive hotel ive stayed at in a long long time and will definately return in future visits to orlando. why this hotel is rated 3 1/2 stars is beyond me. ive stayed at 4 star hotels that dont come close to embassy suites.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: bimlico1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Embassy Suites, Convention Center in late September for 12 nights, and the overall experience was very good. I'll break my review down into sections for easier reading. Location - Excellent. The suites are a short walk (and I mean very short) to many good restaurants and pubs. Olive Garden is next door and across the street you have Bahama Breeze, and Millers Ale House, both very good places to eat and drink. A short trip down the street is Pointe Orlando which contains a number of excellent eateries which are somewhat more expensive - Maggianos and the Capital Grille are in my opinion the two best. Accommodation - The accommodation in the Embassy suites comprises a large bedroom (we opted for a king size bed) and a reception room which is also very large. The bathroom however is small by American standards. The rooms are beginning to look a little dated but are spotlessly clean and there is a daily maid service which is excellent. Sheets are changed every 3 days and can be done more often if requested. The rooms are quiet (we were on the 6th floor) and very comfortable. Beds are excellent. The rooms however do not have a balcony which might put some people off. Food - Embassy Suites includes breakfast and I can tell you, it's a very good breakfast. Good quality juices, fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereals, tea, coffee etc.. They also have a cooking station where they will make up a full cooked breakfast to order. I even met a nice lady called Carmen who I asked to cook Huevos Rancheros (a Mexican dish) for my breakfast. She wasn't familiar with the dish but to my surprise she went and got the recipe later in the day and cooked it for me the following (and subsequent) mornings. Now that is top notch service. If you have the full breakfast you will have no need to eat lunch. Service - All staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Pool - Unfortunately, the outdoor pool was closed for refurbishment when we were there, but the management arranged for us to use the pool facilities at the Hilton Orlando (which was excellent) and they even paid for transportation there. In our case we drove but they paid our parking charges. They also gave us free wi-fi to make up for the inconvenience of not having the pool. That's very good customer service in my book. Manager's reception. Embassy suites also have a reception from 5:30 to 7:30 where they have a free bar. Beers, cocktails and spirits all free for two hours. That can't be bad. Summary - If you want comfortable accommodation in a good location at a price that won't break the bank, then you'll find it hard to beat this. Overall, very good value. Tip - The i-Ride bus stops outside Embassy suites and travels the length of International Drive. Buses arrive about every 15 minutes. Handy if you are going to dinner and don't want to drive. $17 buys unlimited travel for 2 weeks. Amazing value.

Reviews.Title: “Another great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jake5454
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Embassy Suites across the US and I think this is one of the better ones. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We did have so issues with our room, however it was rectified right away.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel very nice people 5 star from me.”
Reviews.Author: davewilson85
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for two weeks and i couldnt ask for more the room was very nice, big, sapcious and comfy.the room was always tidy and clean and the cleaners did a very good job. hotel staff were very friendly and nothing was a problem. i have to say jay stood out (car valet) he is a very nice person had a few chats with him and once again nothing was a problem. pools were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat dodgey upkeep, but great customer service”
Reviews.Author: mso65
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the quality of the upkeep of my hotel room, as evidenced by threadbare (literally) carpet, stained furniture, damaged sink, and ill-repaired shower fixtures (pictures of all attached). I brought this to the attention of the management, and to their credit, even though they could not move me to another room (they were full), they provided a significant discount to my stay. Furthermore, all of the hotel staff from the bartenders at the manager's reception to the housekeepers were extremely friendly and helpful. This went a long ways in terms of making me feel like they really cared about my experience, and went out of their way to assist me. Given that level of customer service, I'd give them another chance to prove themselves whenever I return to Orlando. On other fronts, the snacks at the manager's reception were weak (pretzels, chips and crackers), but the drinks were excellent. The breakfast fare was very good and the omlette chef extremely friendly and making a good product. Unfortunately, all of the hot items outside of oatmeal (including eggs, bacon, sausage, and pancakes) were behind the omlette counter and not out on a buffet. So consequently you had long lines waiting for the hot food, because the same person cooking the omlettes was dishing out items that could have easily been placed on a hot buffet.

Reviews.Title: “good times”
Reviews.Author: llacra
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Wonderful location. Love the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: toesinthesandAz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Orlando hotel during a recent conference at the Orange County Conference Center. We thought it was a good property and a very good value for the money. In addition to good sized suites, they also offer a manager's happy with free drinks (not top shelf liquor, but free!) and a very good breakfast buffet with a "cooked to order" egg station. The rooms were clean, the staff was courteous and it was close to the conference center. The pool was under repair when we were there, but we were too busy to have used it this trip anyway. We will be traveling to Orlando for business regularly now and this will be one of our first choices for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot be serious”
Reviews.Author: Justbeenhonest
Reviews.Content: This is what comes to mind when I read the reviews. We stayed in Disney for the first 5 nights before changing to this hotel. It is on the less hectic end of I drive and has ample free parking. The saving grace if I had to choose one is how friendly the bell hops and housekeeping were. Now to the experience that we endured. We arrived at 1pm and had lunch while the room was not ready, no problem as we were early. I helped the bell hop store our luggage in one of the boardrooms and he handed me the ticket stubs for our bags. We had lunch in the hotel bar that was fine. We were then given our key and we checked into our suite on the 6th floor. One of the lifts on our side was out of order and remained so for a number of days. We only had one bed in the room and had requested a double when we booked through our travel agent. When I called the desk to enquire about changing rooms I was told that I was on the transfer list and to call down in the morning. They explained the hotel was full and we could not be moved that day. I was then told that my travel agent had "forced through the booking" and that is why we had only one bed. I called the travel agent the next morning and was advised the room was booked in January and this was not the case that it was booked last minute. We rang reception twice before our luggage finally arrived and we were told that the reason for the delay was that the bags were put into a room with guests who had the same surname. This was hard to accept as I had handed the stubs for the luggage to the receptionist as I took the room key. The stubs were numbered so why was the name on the case used? More concerning was the fact we were told that the mistake was only noticed when the luggage was spotted outside the room where it was delivered. Thankfully nothing was missing from the cases. They were put in the wrong room where they could easily have been gone through. One of the chairs in the room was covered in stains and was a disgrace. How housekeeping had left this in the room is beyond me. The next morning I dropped down to reception to see about moving to a room with two beds. I was met by a girl who was in full flow of enjoying her first juicy fruit of the day. The packet was on the desk in front of her for all to see. She continued to chew the gum throughout the conversation I had with her. I asked about been moved and she advised they were completely full. I then had to push her to ask when would a room become available as we were there for 11 nights. She told me it would be on Sunday and this was now a Thursday morning. I thanked her for the time and agreed to move rooms on the Sunday. I walked past the same person later that day and she was still chewing away. I went back to my room and rang down to reception to meet with either the manager or the duty manager. I was told to come down to reception where I sat down with the duty manager and told him about my experience for the first 24 hours in the hotel. We came to an agreement in relation to the room that was appreciated and the chair was replaced. He also took away a sample of what was found around the sink in the upstairs. We were moved on the Sunday and the staff moved everything for us and even checked the wardrobe for items we did not pack. Again very helpful. What really disappointed me was no one ever came near us again to see if the new room was okay or even a note in the door to wish us a pleasant stay for the remainder of our time in the hotel. The breakfast was ordinary and Denny's provided our breakfast for most of the stay. One of the lifts on ourside of the hotel was out of order for 3-4 days at the busiest times while we were there. A sign was eventually placed on the lift that it was out of order and then when it was fixed the sign was dumped behind the elevator for a day or so before been picked up. The rooms were big but the air con was leaking through the roof of our first room, as it did beside the bar in the downstairs area one afternoon. The outdoor pool was disgusting as were the splash pools surrounding the main pool. Full of bugs etc. A rat was disposed off on one of the afternoons that I was outside. We used the pool once and that was it. It was pretty small also. Managers drinks was a great idea however from the 3 or 4 nights we were part took no management came to the table to say hello. There is a shop on the ground floor and the movies at managers drinks time was a good idea to let the adults relax outside the room were the movie was been shown. The lines to get to the bar were sometimes long when only one person was manning the bar. This was longer if you ordered two beers and a soft drink as the staff member would have to take the drink to the table as they were not allowed to be seen to serve more then two dinks per person, even soft drinks! There were free ices at the freezer in the reception, the security guard enjoyed these. Watched him make a few trips one evening. If you are going to stay then request a room overlooking the front of the hotel. As I said before the team of guys you had outside the hotel were fantastic and are a credit to you. Management could learn a thing or two from them. This is at most a 2-3 star hotel. I look forward to getting a response form the manager as I did not have the pleasure of meeting him in person during the 11 night stay we had, at least a message on the phone during the stay would have been nice John to acknowledge the problems we had. After reading all the reviews on trip advisor before we left I was sure we were going to be well looked after unfortunately this was not the case. Wished we had never moved from our first hotel as we ended up in faulty towers with Basil nowhere to be seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JohnsMom316
Reviews.Content: Our family and and friends stayed at this property in late August. Valet and front desk staff could not have more friendly and helpful. We live about an hour away but wanted to play tourist and enjoy International Drive. This hotel location made it so easy, as we walked to Dave & Busters, Bahama Breeze and the movie theatre at Point Orlando. Breakfast was good, quite busy, but enjoyable. We had a great time and could stay at any of the I Drive hotels, but we were very happy with our choice to stay here. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - as always!”
Reviews.Author: Jobbi1789
Reviews.Content: Had another amazing stay at the Embassy Suites, our third stay in three years. The rooms are lovely and spacious, with really comfortable beds. Excellent breakfast, and evening reception - the bar staff were really friendly and helpful. We initially had a minor issue with the location of our room, but this was rectified immediately, and reception staff couldn't have been more helpful in resolving this for us. We were always given a warm and friendly welcome by hotel staff, and won't even contemplate staying anywhere else in Orlando! Thanks again, and look forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jmcBirmingham
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and it was just as good as the first. The staff were all so lovely, friendly and helpful. We received a great welcome every time that we entered the building. The breakfast is great and the evening reception with free drinks and snacks is wonderful. We ate in the hotel restaurant twice and the meals were huge and good value for money. It was our daughters birthday during our stay and she was surprised with balloons, snacks and a lovely birthday cake - she was delighted! The rooms are clean and very spacious with plenty of storage space. If we return to Orlando in the future we would definately stay here again. Many thanks to everyone who works here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bombaysapphire_11
Reviews.Content: Big rooms that are clean and well maintained. Staff helpful. Courstey taxi to Universal and free ticket to use the bus that runs up and down international drive. Wide range of breakfast foods on a buffet system although eggs can be ordered. Breaksfast time is busy and at times it was difficult to find a clear table to take your breakfast to.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: billtayloruk
Reviews.Content: Well located for attractions with free coach service to Disney and Universal. Staff friendly and helpful. Room service great. Spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: Rhonstar
Reviews.Content: Room like a small apartment, beautiful lobby, extensive complimentary breakfast buffet, friendly staff. Loved the waterfall!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: MaxoBristol
Reviews.Content: Best hotel along with the Rosen Plaza I have stayed in on International Drive. The hotel dining area is internally decorated with a lush green jungle effect with ponds and palm trees. The rooms were spacious and the cleaning service was efficient. Most of all, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful especially two of the guys on the Concierge desk Jay and Mark. Fantastically located on International Drive and I'm already looking at going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheSinghFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11 nights at the Embassy Suites between July and August 2011. This was our second stay there (visited 3 years ago). Everything was great - particularly the location with shops and restaurants within walking distance and the courtesy shuttle to the theme parks as we had not hired a car. Breakfast was a big hit along with the manager's evening reception. The kids loved the outdoor pool - this was 4.5 feet at it's deepest which was brilliant for small kids, however, the outside jacuzzi was not working. The staff were polite and courteous and couldn't do enough for us. Our suite was on the 7th floor facing International Drive. We had a few problems with the room which were quickly resolved - we were compensated with vouchers for the restaurant, shop and a free movie. These problems were not entirely a surprise as the hotel is slightly dated and in need of modernisation. Our only issue was with the free shuttle to the theme parks - 3 years ago the driver was excellent (who may have retired now) - this time there were many drivers who insisted on knowing the time that you wanted to be picked up. Twice we had a problem in returning - once from Disney on an extremely hot day (97F) - we waited for over 30 minutes and the driver only turned up after we called and the second time from Universal when we had to come back with someone else as the shuttle was full. This needs to be addressed as it reflects on the hotel. Overall, our stay was excellent and we would have no problems in going again (if the hotel was modernised).

Reviews.Title: “Better than most on I drive”
Reviews.Author: Izatequilafan!
Reviews.Content: We used the hotel at the start and end of our fly drive holiday in June. We've used it on several occasions and it hasn't let us down. Clean rooms. Good breakfast included. Central to all the parks. Free bar from about 6-8pm,cocktails,beer etc. Friendly staff. Negatives,decor could do with sprucing up,that's it really!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: toomuchtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few days while attending a wedding. Although most of the family was staying a few blocks away at another hotel, I chose the Embassy Suites for the two-rooms, breakfast, and indoor pool. My family (wife and two young sons) was extremely satisfied with every aspect of the hotel. It was clean and everything you would expect from an Embassy Suites. I would stay here again on a future visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda B
Reviews.Content: Even though it's a bit pricey, it's well worth it. You get what you pay for. Suites are AMAZING. It's huge and you get two HDtvs, can be used to hook up Xbox/PS3/DVD/Computer etc if you're traveling with kids, or just gamers like myself! Staff is beyond friendly. Beds are very, very comfortable. It's a real treat, even room service was mind-blowing. It's about 106 per night but well worth it as I've said already. They have FREE shuttle to Universal/Disney/Sea World etc at specific times and FREE shuttle back to hotel at specific times. Complimentary breakfast until 9:30 M-F and until 10 on the weekends. Pool looks amazing, haven't gotten a chance yet to go in but will try to soon. One downside is you have to pay for wifi, and it's kind of slow. Be careful with the curtains as you enter the room because people can see in to your room and you can see out. Those two things are the only two things i would change. other than that, please STAY here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic agian.”
Reviews.Author: wolf7
