Reviews.Content: Hi We stayed at the Embassy suites the last two weeks of July this is the second time we have stayed there in 5 years and yet again had a great time,the staff from the cleaners to John the manager are very polite and always seem to be happy which then rubs off on to the guests,as previously said the breakfast is lovely on a morning especially the cooked to order omelets ,yes there may be a queue at the end of serving but its free so no problem,the mangers free drinks on a evening are great after a long day at the park just sit back and enjoy and the staff have allways got time to speak to you whilst enjoying the beer or cocktails.The rooms are fine and the double beds massive and my 17 year old son had the pull down bed in the lounge and never complained.The hotel is in a ideal postion on the drive for resturants and I Trolly if required overall a fantastic hotel. wolf7

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay !!”
Reviews.Author: DG1Middlesex
Reviews.Content: Apologies for the late review. The rooms were great. Very spacious with lots of space to store things. The extra wash basin in the bedroom was an added bonus. The bed was huge & very comfortable. Rooms were cleaned every day to a high standard. Towels & toiletries replaced every day. We had a room on the 8th floor overlooking the I-drive, but as the hotel is set back a bit from the road, it is extremely quiet, in fact we would recommend this end of International Drive as it is much quieter in general than the north end near Wet & Wild. There are also alot of restaurants next door/near by & a Walgreens about 5 mins walk away. The breakfast, especially the cooked to order omelettes were 'awesome' !! The I-ride & Lynx bus stops were right outside the hotel. The manager's reception in the evening was a very welcome bonus. All of the staff were extremely friendly & helpful & are a credit to your hotel. The atrium was lovely & was very relaxing to sit in at the end of the day whilst enjoying the free drinks. The only slight downside was the slowness of the lifts. But this is only a minor complaint. We didnt use the swimming pool, so cannot comment on this, only to say that it looked nice & clean. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Orlando & would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone else. Good luck to Dee with his Talent Nights. A special thank you to John the manager for organising a birthday cake for my other half. It was a very nice surprise for him. Thank you for a great stay !! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wow A Hidden Gem On International Drive!”
Reviews.Author: SandalsPrincess
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone We stayed at this amazing hotel for 5 nights in July 2011, our party consisted of 2 adults and 2 children. We had been staying at the Enclave on Carrier Drive for the first 5 nights and wanted the last 5 nights in a better hotel so had researched which hotel on Trip advisor back home before booking. The one thing I noticed that stood out was the Embassy Hotel Reviews were always replied to by the manager, which is rare! I read reviews all the time for different hotels I wish to stay at and look at travellers picture which help make my mind up on which hotel I would like to stay at. The icing on the cake was the manager responding all the time to good and bad reviews and always making sure people have a great stay. Once we had booked the hotel I emailed the hotel to see if it was possible to get a room overlooking International Drive, very promptly I got a response saying that wouldn't be a problem and my request would be met. We arrived at the hotel early as we were only 5 minutes away from the Enclave, as our room wasn't ready I had an excuse to go back to Mall at Millennia! (Got Jimmy Choo Uggs on sale!) When we came back our room was ready :o) My husband checked us in while I waited in the car with the kids, I had no experience with front desk, but they always seemed very welcoming and had a smile on there face. Another one of the reasons we booked the Embassy is that we had stayed at the one at Miami airport in 2009 and were impressed. So we knew the basics of what to expect by the "brand". We were on the 8th floor, on the floor was Laundry facilities and an ice machine. Our room overlooked International Drive, from the bedroom there was a balcony you could step out on. The living area is excellent, there was a large tv, dining table, chairs, sofa, foot stools, a sink with microwave, ice bucket, fridge and lots of cupboard space. From the living area is 2 doors, 1 to the bedroom the other to the bathroom. The bedroom had a very large bed! another sink, and lots of drawer space and a massive wardrobe! It was now time for the managers reception! This is not an Urban myth! its true! free drink for 2 hours! I have taken a few pictures of hat drink you can get. I would have Rose, my husband would have beer, but we did try vodka and the cocktails as well. It was a very relaxing atmosphere. When I had 1 drink, my son would watch a film in the cinema room, with other children, its a great idea as many parents would do the same, some nights the kids got carried away and there was a cushion fight! my son loved it! I think there was a popcorn fight another night (not my son!) The area was kept very clean for the children and always someone on hand to tidy up. The bartenders are very nice people, so we would give them $1 every time we would go to the bar, they were very thankful and would always say thank you for your appreciation. We would usually have a few drinks they head out to dinner. In the morning was breakfast time! Usually I would go get breakfast first and then my husband then the kids as I would go down to breakfast while everyone slept! There was loads to choose from, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, etc... Now I had never tried Omelette before, and I read the reviews and said im not gonna eat an omelette im not an omelette person, well I don't know what make me wait in line but I got my first omelette and it was with cheese, 1 word.... WOW.... I loved it! There was sodas to choose from and fresh orange apple. I did notice that a lady while we stayed there had empty water bottles in her bag and proceeded to fill the bottles up with fresh orange and apple juice, I was kinda annoyed as I was waiting for 1 apple juice, but she was filling up 3 bottles to then put in her bag, how mean! as if juice is so expensive to buy! After breakfast I went to the business centre to check my emails, it was mainly to see how my dad was keeping as he gets hospital treatment once a week and I was keen to hear how he has been getting on. I got in but no email so I would check later on that day. Once we had returned from our busy day the business centre was jammed packed of school kids from Brazil. Now i know kids are kids but I really wanted to check my email, turned out I couldn't as I would have been there for hours. My husband asked front desk if there was any solution, and they gave me a code to use the wifi at the hotel as we had our Ipad with us. It was a god send, as I could check my email and Internet from my room or anywhere in the hotel! Thanks Embassy Reception :o) On the way out one night I noticed a freezer at the entrance of the hotel, inside is ice poles for the kids! Great idea! Thanks Embassy :o) I used the indoor pool once with my 3 year old son and it was excellent, it ready gave him a lot of confidence in the water, my husband watched him while I tried the hot tub and the sauna. One day we returned from the parks there was an envelope through our door, we opened it as it just had the room number of the envelope, inside was a gift voucher for $25 for the shop, we could not understand why we had this as well as having someone else's name for our room. My husband took it back to reception and explained this is our room but not for our name, the gentleman at reception checked his records and couldn't explain it either and as a goodwill gesture told us to keep the voucher. Thanks again Embassy :o) One day we were sitting at the I ride bus stop a kind lady and her son who were also staying at the hotel gave us a free i ride pass each! she said the hotel gives them to you if your going to Seaworld. I think they do this as the hotel offers buses to Disney and Universal, they offer the pass for Seaworld, but you could use the iride to go other places as well, check out my picture and you will see what it looks like. Thanks again Embassy! Lastly the staff are so friendly! Everyone had a welcomed smile, whether in the lift or in the hallway, they always had time for guests, well done Embassy! As you can see all these little extras add up, free Internet, free breakfast, free drinks, free Iride, it makes the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Was Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: kingsatyrx
Reviews.Content: I have promised all of my fellow trip advisor users a fair review of this hotel. I decided after much consideration to use this hotel for my family's vacation to Walt Disney World at the begnning of July 2011. I have to say that I was favorably impressed. The level of customer service at this hotel is far above anything I expected. Zach at the front desk was always friendly and helpful when asking him for directions or restaurant advice. It was plainly clear that Mr. Parkinson values the dying art of customer service at this hotel. I am only sorry that I was unable to find him in to thank him in person. Yeah, the hotel could use some updates but it was always clean and the staff was very accomadating and friendly from the front desk, to the pool. I think this is an especially good location for anyone to stay, especially if you don't plan on going through the extra expense of renting a car. Everything is very convenient to this location; restaurants, shopping, etc.. They have a trolley like bus that runs up and down the street making it very easy to get around. A side note for a Orlando trip...nothing to do with the hotel, the taxi drivers in Orlando are not a very scrupulous bunch and will try to cheat you any way they can. Had one that refused to even run the meter...told me it was broke..I told him to stop that i wanted to get out..and then all of a sudden he turned the meter on...terrible. Anyway great hotel stay....kudos to Mr. Parkinson and his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites loyal not impressed”
Reviews.Author: 1tos
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at hotels of this brand many times. Always received excellent service, including at this hotel. Their personnel were very helpful. Although, I was not impressed with the hotel facilities. Hotel seemed old and not what I expected at the rate that I paid. Beds in double occupancy room are too small, especially if traveling with family who are going to share beds (read their dimensions). Room was also noisy from Interstate highway traffic. A couple of museums and several restaurants on South International Drive that we were too tired from Disney to visit. Would have not paid more than the lowest rate I would expect to pay at a comparable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for couples and families”
Reviews.Author: Kezza007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week before setting off to Miami on a cruise and what a brilliant start to our holiday. The hotel itself is beautiful inside and the coolness of the air con is very welcoming after walking around in the Florida sun. Parking was no problem and the reception staff were very helpful. Breakfast was really good and the free drinks and snacks at night were very nice before heading back out on the town. The 'ticket' ladies at the hotel were a bit pushy with the timeshare thing and wanted you to fill out their forms (how much you earned) etc but we just bought our theme park tickets and kindly declined although they did keep asking!!!! Our room was huge and gorgeous. We could have had a party in there. i-ride stop just outside and close to the Pirate Cove Golf which we went to a couple of nights. Maid service is great and nothing is too much trouble for any of the staff. If you want to eat out theres an abundance of choice just outside and we loved the Boston Lobster Feast. All in all a great base for and Orlando holiday.

Reviews.Title: “I will come back”
Reviews.Author: aidany
Reviews.Content: I must say at first I wanted to switch hotels I did not like my room but the service you get at this hotel will make you overlook the room. They do need to update rooms, room had a strong musty smell. Besides the room there is nothing negative to say about this place location is excellent service is the best service I've ever had and I travel a lot and most time i stay at 5 star properties and not even there have I gotten the excellent service that I've gotten here and just for that I would return they make you feel right at home and dee is the bell hop man he definetly makes the front a happy place so outgoing its been a pleasure talking to him he's the best sooooo friendly.by the way I stayed 9 days and even then I didn't want to leabe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great breakfast. Could use some updates.”
Reviews.Author: Chasetsr
Reviews.Content: Room configuration breakfast and staff were great. Outside pool is small. Rooms need new couch and some upgrades for instance shower ceiling had pipe sticking out. But good deal.

Reviews.Title: “"Awesome Stay.....Can't wait to visit again"”
Reviews.Author: shaw3111
Reviews.Content: It was a group of 43 of us who spent 4 days here. I would like to say "Thank You" to Katie of Group Services who had everything ready for us upon our arrival. The other Staff was helpful as well. The rooms was nice and comfortable, the cook-to-order breakfast was fabulous and the location was perfect. I would recommend this hotel and I will defintely stay here when I visit Florida again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was excellent, Service was Superb”
Reviews.Author: healingproducts
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent, but we always love Embassy Suites. Here is what set this hotel apart. I called to ask a question and mentioned we were coming for my daughters birthday. So we checked in and went to dinner. When we got back there was a birthday cake in the room and they gave us complimentary internet service! Top rate service!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be coming back”
Reviews.Author: Cappy-stain
Reviews.Content: Until recently, Embassy Suites has been my choice for hotel stays when on business or pleasure, but this stay was the last one! One of the elevators was broken for the entirety of our 4-night stay. These things happen, but 4 days? And they never hung a sign on the elevator as I suggested until the last day. Housekeeping was thorough but did not respond to my request for an early cleaning on one of the days (I only requested this once). rooms need serious updating, and the pool guy needs to pay a little more attention to detail. Charging for Internet service these days is the final proof that this hotel chain is out of touch. There's a cook to order breakfast, but lacks taste. Chips, popcorn and free drinks for a manager's reception, but no manager. This hotel might be a decent value at half the price, but way overpriced for what you get. Had we not prepaid, we would have checked out after the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Well impressed”
Reviews.Author: DurhamColin
Reviews.Content: stayed on first and last nights of our two week trip. Hotel ideally placed. The rooms have a living room and separate bed room - like being at home. The managers drinks for two hours everynight free of charge is unbelievable - dont know how they afford it. Breakfast - fresh omelettes, bacon, eggs - all cooked to order and free - they must run at a loss - they feed you and water you free of charge!!! Only gripe is that first room overlooked I-4 and was noisy - and its unavoidable on that stretch, We asked for a different room for our last night and got it - staf excellent - very accomodating. Location for walking to everything on the drive is first class - pointe orlando across the roas - restaurants and shops on the doorstep. would recommend it whole heartedly. Only downer - pillows in room - not the linen - smell of dirthy hair - through age. They are yellow too!! They all need binning and new ones buying. They let the hotel down. But all in all good value (TAKE YOUR OWN PILLOWS - or management please take heed.) Thanks for a fab time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Stays ever while traveling because of Embassy Suites!! We will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: tallone328
Reviews.Content: We had such a great experience with this Hotel!! We truy found the staff friendly, helpful and with great attitudes. We appreciate the great atmosphere, great service and a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Service was a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: tmls
Reviews.Content: Statement charges at checkout were wrong. Credit balance remaining on the room at checkout was applied to someone else's credit card. Never returned to me. Service over an item left in the room was also screwed up by hotel staff. While the hotel manager finally agreed they made an error, he did not do so voluntarily or promptly. Now refuses to correct or even compromise on the error expense. Watch out for the incompetence and if you insist on staying here, don't leave the hotel until you are satisfied with all charges. Will not return to such lack of integrity or accuracy.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for small children”
Reviews.Author: dana1382
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent, and the food fantastic, but we were on the 7th floor that had a glass sliding door. My daughter could reach the handles and open it no problem. She also figured out the front door rather quickly. Other than that problem, our stay was excellent. Friendly and hospitable, just like you would expect

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best experience with a hotel. I call here first when I am in Orlando again!”
Reviews.Author: lisakkane
Reviews.Content: The hotel atmosphere was very inviting the first we walked in. Every staff member we encountered was so polite and helpful and always smiling, and it was not put on either. We go to Orlando a few times a year and since we have found this hotel, we will not want to stay at another one. It was fantastic! I highly recommend it! Kane family

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: AussieBumsSydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on International Drive. Very handy to some great places to eat. Quick check-in which I like. Staff were great. Everyone said hello etc. Breakfast and evening drinks at the bar which is included in your room charges was excellent. Hotel rooms are large and well equiped. Two swimming pools. One indoor and one outdoor. Awsome gym to use as well. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: PLNOwen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2004 for two weeks with our then 11 year old daughter, we did not want a villa with there only being 3 of us. Also we were not sure about driving in USA so this was ideal as we had free Disney transfers from these suites (although we did get a car the second week). The food choice at breakfast could not be faulted and the staff very friendly. The pool was a small but we only used for an hour each time after a day at the parks so it was fine. Within walking distance to restaurants ,bars, mini golf and shops and transport. Our bed was massive and the sofa bed in lounge area comfy. We returned the following year we enjoyed our stay so much and for the price it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “well worth considering”
Reviews.Author: floridabill007
Reviews.Content: if you need to spend about five nights in orlando this hotel is worth considering. good position. clean friendly. excellant free breakfast. spacious.two medium size pools, one inside.free wifi.free parking.and for worn out parents, the bonus of a FREE bar between 5.30 pm and 7.30pm.you can spend at least 50$ a day/ person for these freebies elsewhere.paid $73/night for stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MikeS46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to major attractions and several area restaurants. The dinner menu in the hotel restaurant was somewhat limited, but the food was very good. When you consider the included cooked to order breakfast in the morning and the evening manager's reception, the hotel rates are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Charsouto
Reviews.Content: Where shall I start? What a brilliant hotel. On arrival we were made very welcome by the friendly reception staff. They can advise you on where the nearest tj max store is, or the best place to have steak:). They know everything.... The free made to order breakfast serves everything from toast to omelettes, it has an amazing and varied selection. Served from 7-9.30( I think it may vary on a weekend or bank holiday) The transportation was always punctual and it was great that the courtesy transport to epcot had a few departure times -we usually had an hour by the pool before catching the10.40 shuttle bus. There was lots of great restaurants within walking distance, ... Tony roma's, and millers were two of our favourites. Lots of restaurants accepted the 'children dine free cards' (purchased before you go). After a long day at the parks it was great to return to the hotel for the 'managers free reception hour' - 5.30 until 7.30. The kids loved the free popcorn and crisps too! If we were to return to Orlando, the only place we would stay is this hotel. Excellent location, brilliant accommodation, friendly staff and great value for money. Hopefully be back next year:) Thanks to michelle, charlene In the bar,and Josie.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: ddriverKent
Reviews.Content: Just spent 14 nights at the Embassy Suites and we had a brilliant time. From the cooked breakfast to the managers reception it was faultless. Pool area was never crowded and the only time we had queues at breakfast was over the memorial day holiday weekend when a large group arrived for a couple of days. The staff were all a pleasure to deal with and we will definately return. The room was spacious with a separate lounge and 2 double beds in the bedroom. The hotel gave us 4 free movies to watch during our stay and the wifi was free with a code from reception. We were in suite 701 and could see the disney and seaworld fireworks from our room. Loads of restaurants on your doorstep, Millers ale house was one of our favourites.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: NoleGirl0923
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a one night business trip. My experience was just ok. The rooms were large, which is obviously standard for embassy suites, but very outdated. The cleanliness was questionable. The carpet was pretty stained and the bathroom was a little dirty. I've seen cleaner, for sure. I think this hotel is just in need of a facelift. The staff was indifferent. Definitely not overly friendly. With so many options in the area, I'll skip this one on my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: cewilliams627
Reviews.Content: After four days in another hotel chain for a conference, I moved to finish my stay. I typically like Embassy Suites so I chose this one. What a great decision. The staff is wonderful and the room was great. The bed slept good and the pillow choices were perfect. I enjoyed a made-to order omelet, swam, read, and enjoyed the Manager's reception every day. I hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific customer service and great complimentary breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EuclidOH
Reviews.Content: My daughter recently got married at this venue. The wedding and reception was held there with over 110 guests from out of town. The staff, from the outside throughout were excellent. They were accommodating and friendly. The buffet breakfast is excellent. The rooms were clean. I had a problem one night when taking shower the water would not go down. I called the front desk. Within 10 minutes maintenance was at the door and immediately fixed the problem. Great service. The food at the reception was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was cheerful and helpful every minute of the day or night.”
Reviews.Author: Grammie011
Reviews.Content: I forgot my glasses in my room when I checked out of the hotel. When I called the hotel to report the "loss" my situation was handled with thoroughness and thoughtfulness. My glasses were returned within 24 hours. Thank you to the staff for a wonderful stay and for patiently correcting my mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch service”
Reviews.Author: Tennislvrmp2
Reviews.Content: It has been over a month since we stayed at this Embassy Suites but had to write about the wonderful service. We were on vacation for first time with an infant and he was sick. We had to buy special formula and we didn't have a can opener but the people in the bar were extremely helpful. They took the can to the kitchen, opened it, and then covered it with plastic wrap so that I could get back up to the room without spilling it. And they did this twice, while also waiting on customers at the bar. The bellhop, Richard, was very helpful and friendly (we tried to travel light but not really possible with an infant who was becoming increasingly mobile), but he handled all of stuff with ease. The front desk people, Stephanie S, Angela H, and Zach helped us with minor room issues, and I think it was Stephanie who provided info for an emergency clinic. We wound up not needing it but it was good know it was there and she was ready with directions, etc promptly. I should also add that the room was clean, spacious and inviting. It's perfect for families with small (or older) children. I appreciated the breakfast - made to order eggs, omelettes - pancakes, fruit, etc; saved us time and money. We used the Business Center, which had several computers and a printer; the wi-fi was free even though we didn't use it; and spent some realxing time by the pool. I can't say enough about the hotel and its staff! Kudos and many thanks. We are looking forward to next year already! The Pierces

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again....”
Reviews.Author: 4disneyfans
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites lived up to all of our expectations. Upon check in we were greeted immediately. All staff we encountered on our visit were very helpful and friendly. Room was very clean and had everything we needed. The managers happy hour was very nice. The breakfast the next morning did not let us down either. Pleased even my picky eater. It was nice to find a hotel with an indoor pool. It is hard to find in this area. It made my children very happy on a very rainy Florida afternoon. Normally we stay on property at Disney. However this visit we decided to try somewhere else and were very pleased. We would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: notgoodonboats
Reviews.Content: My family attended the Megacon event at the convention center and booked the room through the promoters of the event. First impression was great, the atrium and all areas were well maintained and pleasant to be surrounded by. Our room was very nice and the hotel staff VERY pleasant. They serve a cook to order breakfast (free) that had a variety of food. Also a "manager's reception" at night with free drinks for adults and kids. Had a wonderful meal at the in house restaurant (no waiting) great value. My only complaint is the lack of provided transportation to the convention center. They provide for other attractions but not there. You would think that if you had "convention center" in the title and description of the hotel name they would provide a means of getting there. You can take the trolley (BTW the trolley needs exact change) or walk or take a taxi. It is approx a mile away.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience...very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MCTMCO
Reviews.Content: I had the occasion to spend the night their on 2 separate occasions in March. I must admit it is an "older" property. The rooms are not pristine, but very comfortable. I had no problems at all. The breakfast was very good and it is close to the Convention Center. To me, it was the staff that made the difference. There is an obvious attention to be kind and helpful. Everyone, including the front desk, bell staff and breakfast staff were on cue for my satisfaction and happiness. It was refreshing. I actually was filling out the online survey from Hilton while there for my second stay. I made mention of it in my comments. John, the GM, immediately responded to that I was there then. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: oprylandgirl68
Reviews.Content: Wish we could have stayed longer. They had an awesome breakfast made to order. They had a wonderful cocktail period in the evening. The kids had shirly temples. They felt special and were treated like queens. The room did smell a little musty when we first went in but it was nothing that febreeze couldnt handle. The handle on the door between the two rooms was broken and we kept having to fix it. All in all it was an awesome stay. They have a shuttle to Disney World which saves $14 a day for parking. We got a voucher for two free movies in room. Not sure why we got these but the kids enjoyed that. One other thing i would do next time is ask for a lower floor. our room was very warm and we like cooler temps. The ac just couldnt get to our liking but again not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Musty room”
Reviews.Author: Anne9095
Reviews.Content: First thing we noticed when entering our room was a musty smell. In the morning, the sliding glass doors for the balcony were dripping with water. It was aweful for my daughter's allergies. Despite the complimentary breakfast and convenient location, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Griff_Linda
Reviews.Content: Had great holiday staying at this hotel. The only thing that would have made it slightly better would have been a room safe although no problem using the safety deposit box at reception.Fitness suite basic but used every other day in the morning no problems. Free drinks at manager reception a nice way to start the evening. Enjoyed the breakfast everyday great choice and plenty of it .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PostieCol
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 weeks at this hotel,what can I say. From the day we booked in till the day we left,the staff were brilliant and helpful.Special mention goes to Dee and Robbie who could not do enough to keep my 5 granddaughters amused. The rooms were clean and well kept the only problem was we were facing the I4 and traffic noise made it difficult to get to sleep. Breakfast was filling and kept us all going.You had to get there early or late to avoid the queue. And the cocktail hour every night was most welcome after a busy day walking round the parks. I will be staying there next time we go to Orlando in a couple of years time.The hotel was part of the holiday and was like a home from home

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: bleifuss
Reviews.Content: There is nothing I didn't like about this hotel--price was right, manager's reception and breakfast was excellent, good location, clean and very spacious rooms, friendly staff...I will definitely choose this hotel the next time I'm in Orlando! The shower's water pressure was almost whirlpool quality and zapped the shampoo right out of my hair--loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want a great base with easy access to everything”
Reviews.Author: Adz1968
Reviews.Content: Me my Wife and my 8/9 year old Boy stayed at the Embassy Suites from the 7th till the 17th Feb and I must admit I cannot Fault the Hotel or the Staff Yes there are bits that need updating or bits that need Sorting. But all Superficial and should not detract from the fact that this Hotel is Brilliant the Breakfast were Amazing we felt we had to partake in the Manager Complimentary Drinks in the Evening it would be rude not to!! The I Ride and the Lynx Bus stop Right outside so no need to drive even to Disney as the Free Shuttle goes to Epcot!! We Caught the Free Shuttle to Universal and it does not come back until 7 so a quick 15 Minutesâ€™ walk and you are at stop 8 on the I Ride. The Hotel Staff do their job well without being over the top and the room was cleaned every day ,the Pool was cleaned every morning and we used the WIFI which was Quick enough. It was my Little boys Birthday while there and they got him some sweets and a Birthday Cake Overall this Hotel is Superb for the Job you need when visiting International Drive thanks to everyone there and we will definatly be back and will recommend the hotel to everyone who is planning a visit to the area.

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: helsruss
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! What a holiday! The service at this hotel is second to none. Our travel agent made a mistake with our booking but John Parkinson the Hotel Manager went out of his way to make sure this got sorted. He did that little bit extra that alot of hotels wouldnt do for you. Fab location right opposite the best restaurants. Lovely swimming pools. Nice breakfast. Free shuttle which was always very punctual. Lovely homely rooms. Just over all extremely friendly and made our holiday to Florida one to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Josephine2
Reviews.Content: The friendliness of the staff was notable. We were enthusiastically welcomed by the concierge upon arrival, and were given coupons for Pizzeria Uno which was just a few blocks away. The room was a suite, and it was comfortable and clean. I was pleasantly surprised and grateful the lobby gift shop had very late hours and was able to purchase something I had forgotten at home. The breakfasts were terrific, and we were able to have omelets made to order each day. There was a free shuttle bus each morning to Epcot Center, Universal Studios or to Sea World. We definitely took advantage of this, as parking at these parks is $14 each day. We stayed over Super Bowl weekend, and there was a Super Bowl party in the lobby with complimentary chips, salsa, popcorn and drinks. Lots of fun! Unfortunately, we did not get a chance to enjoy the pool or exercise room since we were so tired from DisneyWorld and Universal. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay for Visiting Wizarding World”
Reviews.Author: JJTJBQ
Reviews.Content: I get less than 10 days off most years. Yes, that includes "weekends." So my husband & i wanted to visit Wizarding World & searched for a nearby hotel. We chose this Embassy Suites over the nearby one based on TripAdvisor reviews. We were leaning towards the Embassy Suites due to 2 sets of friends recent recommendations. We were not disappointed. The hotel is not new. That's a fact. But it is well maintained, the staff is excellent, and the location was great. The rooms were clean. Some public areas show a little wear. We arrived with just a few minutes left in the Happy Hour. The desk clerk mentioned this and gave us coupons for free drinks in the bar without us asking. The breakfast was amazing. The first morning I ate really light, I did not want much food in my stomach for the WW rides. The chef made me a one egg omelet and it was delicious. The second morning we ate hearty. At the first breakfast my husband wrote on a comment card that his preferred sweetener was not available. That night there was a small gift pack in our room, containing "his" sweetener and a note from the GM. We also took advantage of the indoor pool and sauna. They were nice. We stopped by the bar on the way back to our room and took advantage of the coupons. The bartender was nice and the right level of talkative. My husband used the Business Center, or tried to. The computer did not have the latest version of Internet Explorer, so he could not approve his payroll remotely. I'm not sure if he mentioned this to the staff. He was able to use my iPhone to pay his staff. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, service, location,rooms,food and drink”
Reviews.Author: helenpfareham
Reviews.Content: This is the forth year we have stayed at this hotel, nothing is to much trouble for the staff. If you have a problem it is sorted within minutes. The breakfast is so good and so much of it, and the chef,s cannot do enough for you. My mother had a disability scooter and as we could not use the complumentary coach a taxi was ordered to go to Disney at the hotels discretion.. To be honest when we go its like comming home we loveit, infact my now 8 year old son always cries when we leave. He has made really good friends with the concierge and cant wait to see them again. We love it thanks embassy suites your great. trying to book room at the moment looking for best rates

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: mp66
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for two reasons - its location and it was an all suite hotel and wanted the extra space this allowed. We were not disappointed on either level. Initial impressions were that the hotel was a little dated and was not quite as 'luxurious' as we had hoped. That said, we did find it comfortable and clean. The suites are very roomy and well appointed. The beds are comfortable and there's lots of drawer space (something my wife always comments on!). I would say the decor is a little dated and our bathroom was a bit shabby in places - though it was all clean. The staff were faultless, very polite and professional. Check-in and out a breeze. The buffet breakfast was great - a huge selection - though it does get busy at the most popular times. The managers complimentary cocktails each evening is ok, but the seating areas seemed to get a bit dirty with people not tidying up after themselves. Staff are around to clean up, but it just looks a bit of a mess in the meantime. The hotel pool (outdoor) is quite small for a hotel of this size, but it was quiet (December) and we didn't have a problem either using the pool or finding somewhere to sit around it. I guess you wouldn't spend too much time there anyway, but it's nice to have somewhere to relax on your less busy days. The location of the hotel is very good - just a few minutes walk from lots of restaurants, bars and shops (Pointe Orlando). We've stayed at lots of places along International Drive and I would say this is one of the best in terms of location. There's easy access to all local attractions - Sea World and Universal being the closest. Things we liked: Location, free self-parking, friendly staff, lots of room in the suites, breakfast. Things we didn't like: Having to pay for internet access, decor a bit tired. Overall we enjoyed our stay here and would return...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: faunty1021
Reviews.Content: recently spent a week at Embassy Suites - first time to Orlando. Hotel excellent - easily found despite not having been to Orlando before. complimentary breakfast every morning, despite busy was served quickly and efficiently and there was always plenty of places to sit. plentiful supply of coffee albeit the blueberry muffins ran out quickly. The hotel is in an excellent location with an easy five minutes to the I4 for access to other areas including Disney. plenty in the way of food outlets and restaurants within easy walking distance and the area felt safe (despite fears of crime etc). the room was clean and functional (the room was starting to weather a little, but given we spent most of the time out at the parks or out and about this was not a problem). the suite was spacious enough to accomodate three of us with conflicting TV not being a problem. The cleaning staff were great and the staff in general were genuinely polite, friendly and helpful (none of the false smiles to be found here). Overall I was very impressed by the service, the staff and the hotel itself the managers cocktail hour was a great perk and a cool beer at the end of the day by the pool was something to look forward to. My family and I will be returning and would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: tynglefamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. All the good restaurants are on the same street. Two outlet malls are within 10 miles. The staff at this hotel are so friendly. Everyone that works at this hotel goes out of their way to be so nice. Someone is doing a great job at hiring! Very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: ChaseandCruisesMom
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews but felt compelled to write this one as soon as we returned from our trip. I am a Hilton Honors member and stay in Hilton hotels regularly. I booked this hotel using points and am extremely disappointed in the cleanliness of the room. This hotel needs to be updated significantly and should not be compared to other Embassy Suites. The room we stayed in, on the 6th floor, had crumbs on the floor, and the trim in the bathroom had quite alot of water damage. The pull out sofa bed had alot of cigarette burns in the sheets and blankets on it (this was a non-smoking room) and the mattress was so thin that you could feel the coils and it was very uncomfortable for the kids. The tv remote did not have batteries that worked, so we requested more. This was fine, but was just another annoying thing. the elevators we used were very outdated and had crumbs all in the floors. Others have left decent reviews about this hotel, so it may just be that our room was nasty. But, in my opinion and given the location of this hotel, there is no reason that it is not updated and immaculate. Especially, given that it takes 35,000 points to stay there and is supposed to be an upper-level hotel. We decided that the hotel probably puts most of their money into the lobby area, which was pretty and they breakfast that was served to guests is really pretty good. But, if you would like to pay for a clean room and expect to get what you pay for (even though we used points), I don't recommend this hotel. Our family is very disappointed and I plan on complaining to Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Blakelake
Reviews.Content: Stay for four nights while attending conference at the Orlando Convention Center. Very nice hotel, staff was very friendly and attentive. Location to shops and restaurants was excellent, however, I little bit of a hike to the Convention Center. Morning breakfast was excellent and not crowded. Only downside was the pool was badly in need of cleaning. Note: (Not a hotel issue) If using taxi's in this area, be aware the rates can be very inconsistent. At end of out stay we were going to a Disney World hotel for couple of days. Were quoted rates from $45 to $60 from the local taxi drivers. Called a local cab company and arranged a pickup time and given a $30 flat rate.

Reviews.Title: “There can be no better value....”
Reviews.Author: Bedandbreakfastfan43
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, I would not hesitate to sty here again. About 10 minutes frim Universal Studios and they provide Free shuttle service to guests. Breakfast buffet is wonderful with hot grill, Pancakes, omelets, sausage bcaon, fresh fruit (oranges of course!). It is in a perfect location with stores, restaurants nearby(just be careful when crossing as drivers slow down for NO ONE. I want to thank one of the managers, Mark, who was there for us everytime we needed something. The man is truly dedicated to his job. Again, this is the place to stay in Orlando if you are looking for clean, locations and people who love what they are doing!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Anon727
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times, and I have never had a room that didn't smell musty. Maybe it is the chiller air conditioning system that they use that doesn't dehumidify enough (essential in Florida!). This time, I was in two rooms (I was moved from the first one because it had a strange mechanical noise nearby) and both were musty. The second room ended up having water dripping from the bathroom ceiling from the air conditioning. The staff was doing their best, but if this hotel had a multi-million dollar renovation in the past few years, it doesn't show very much. I guess I keep coming back because of the free breakfast (though, it's nothing special), the happy hour, but most of all, the location being an easy walk to several restaurants. I just wish the rooms were fresher.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: n756tk
Reviews.Content: The room was okay, noisy from the interstate. The staff was okay. The extras that Embassy offers were not okay. It was if Embassy can charge a lot, but offer little in its amenities such as their evening offerings. Can not compare to the Drury chain which costs less money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vacation Come True”
Reviews.Author: hilt0ntraveler
Reviews.Content: My family and my sister's family stayed for a week. We were first impressed by the warm, professional staff who greeted and welcomed us. The kids were speechless over the TWO pools they could swim in. The breakfast rivaled the best restaurants except Embassy's staff outshined and outserved any restaurant I've tried (and I eat out a LOT)! You will not be disappointed to stay in this beautiful hotel. It's location couldn't be better - within walking distance of shopping, restaurants and other entertainment fit for all ages. Include this hotel when planning your next Orlando vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: PATJORDAN
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to stay here. We were delighted to see so many familiar faces from last year. Any staff we encountered were very friendly indeed, nothing is too much trouble. Rob, who checked us in was very helpful, and Zachary & Teresa at the from desk never fail to welcome us back, even if only after a short trip away from the hotel. These are the touches which make the difference. Our suite on the 8th floor is very nice and bright, we noticed an improvement in the bathrooms since last year too: nothing drastic but tastefully improved baths and tiling. The house keeping staff use towels to make swans and baby elephants: there are so nice it is a shame to use the towels!! The breakfast is as good as ever, good range of fruits, cereals, pastries and cooked items. The manager's reception is always a nice touch in Embassy suites, and we particularly enjoy a glass of wine at the poolside in the evening sun. We have a couple of weeks's left to enjoy here, and where better to enjoy the delights of Orlando than the Embassy Suites I-Drive south. Well done all.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with embassy suites”
Reviews.Author: littlestlittle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. We reserved three rooms with king size beds and all were supposed to be on the same floor. Upon check-in we were told that our rooms were not on the same floor. We went up to our room (after riding an incredibly slow that took forever to arrive and close) and the door to the room was open - as if someone was already staying there. We then went back downstairs via the slow elevator and were advised that the manager had left the door open after confirming it was clean. We entered the room and observed a big white object on the ottoman and on the floor. We called down and by the time someone answered the phone (10-15 rings) a maintenance guy came in and advised it was the shower curtain and hung it up. We then noticed that the room had double beds. We called again and advised we were supposed to be a king size bed. They moved us. \After this unnecessary ordeal I went to take a shower. I got in the shower and noticed water not draining, and when my husband checked to see what was wrong black stuff got in the water which was now up to my calves. We called downstairs again and they sent another maintenance guy to fix it. It was fixed. This guy was quick, friendly and the best part of the stay. The ceiling of the bathroom looked like it had cystic acne. I don't know what could make the ceiling look like this - water leaks? Let's talk about the climate control in the room. Apparently there was something broken with the system that prevented it from delivering heat. That was fine with me, but it bothered other members of our party who were cold the entire trip. But whether you wanted hot or cold air, everytime the system turned off (hit the temperature set on the thermostat) there would be a loud bang from the ceiling. I'm not talking about the normal clicking sound that old climate control systems make - I'm talking about someone banging a drum or slamming a door - everytime the system turned off. This woke up almost every member of our party during the night. Suddenly ----BANG, you've never heard a noise like this come out of a climate control system. The odd thing about this hotel is that I really wanted to like it, especially after reading the reviews on this website prior to our stay. What a disappointment. I hope that the Embassy Suites chain inspects this property soon and demands that they get some new management and refurbish the basic elements of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but beware the 30 day cancellation period!”
Reviews.Author: lindzcarol
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Embassy Suites, but thought it was pricey for an Embassy Suites. However, i think the cost was in line with other hotels in the area. I arrived early - around 1:00 - and had to either take a smoking room or wait until 4:00, so I would have preferred an entirely smoke-free hotel. The smoke smell was overpowering and left all my belongings smelling like smoke. the continental breakfast was wonderful, and all the staff I encountered were very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Travel197299
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel for four nights. Extremely friendly staff. They go out of their way to assist you. I looked forward to returning to the hotel and hearing the bellman say , Welcome home each evening. Breakfast was good with made to order omeletes. I attened the Manager's evening reception two nights which was lovely. One day the house keeper left animals make out of wash cloths on my night stands. I thought this only happened on curises. My only problem was, the bed sheets were not changed after my request (left card on pillow per hotel's policy). Different house Keeper worked my last two nights. When I discoved that the bed had not been change it was late and I was leaving the next day. The hotel is located in the heart of everything. I walked to the Convention Center several days. Many restaurants and Walgreens were within a short walking distant. I did not need to rent a car. A special Thank you goes out to Jose, engineering dept. and Zachary and Theresa at the front desk. They were more than helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “No interest in staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: hlief07
Reviews.Content: I'm here for a convention with my company and would switch hotels if I had the choice. I've stayed at other Embassy Suites and this one is definitely not on my list of 'visit again'. My room is dingy, despite the attemps to make appear updated and lighter. For example the light fixtures are newer but the curtains are from 1980. The bathroom vanity tops are updated but the paint on the walls is chipping, cracked, and puffing out. The cable covers running along the wall are rusted and the sofa has stains that make me not want to sit on it. My pillow and towels had crap on it, whether dirt, stain, or something else...you just feel like its not all up to hilton standards. My bathroom is for little people. I'm short and I find the bathroom to be short. The shower head is super low. Perhaps I'm picky but the pictures on the website are much better than the hotel itself is. Would I come here with my spouse and baby daughter. No. My colleagues agree and I'm embarassed to say that one of our guests traveling with us found a roach in his room. Yes I appreciate them having free breakfast and happy hour but i'd rather pay my own beer and feel comfortable in my room.

Reviews.Title: “WOW GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: steveclark_10
Reviews.Content: what a fab hotel, stayed for two weeks in sept for anniversary, they could not do a thing wrong, champagne on arrival, choc strawberries, great, staff ever so helpful, always polite with smiles on face, great location away from the main strip on i drive. the only little niggle i had was a few more parasols around the pool area, but hey who wants to spend time around pool ,when you have universal up the rd, aquatica......etc,etc. just going back to the staff, they were great ,!!!!!.. free beer aswell from 5.30pm-7.30pm ,what away to start your evening,, i will be useing this hotel again. !!!!!!! fab

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel made a Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: CFBLUES
Reviews.Content: My wife & I recently stayed at this hotel (10 - 26 September 2010) and had a fantastic time. Firstly I would like to say the staff are outstanding, all were friendly and very helpful. The cooked to order breakfast was great and the free cocktail hour in the evening is a good way of getting to know other guests. I also like the fact they have transportation to both Disney & Universal. For us the location is perfect for restaraunts, all within walking distance. We will definitely be returning next year. A big thank you to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Embassy Suites' standards”
Reviews.Author: Czarmax18
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the Embassy Suites franchise, but this one was not up to their normal standards. The first room we were given smelled like marijuana. The last thing you want to do after a long day of traveling is go back down to the front desk and ask to switch rooms. We went down and they quickly moved us to another room without any other problems. They also gave us a certificate for the restaurant for our trouble. This was an extremely nice gesture, but it came after we had already left for supper. The common areas need updating. We were not impressed with the way the hotel looked on the inside. We did like the Embassy Suites typical waterfall area. Breakfast is set up horribly. In order to get any hot food you have to wait in a long line. The serving area is in the corner of the breakfast area that is not set up for quick or smooth serving. We did not wait in line for the hot food, so we were unsure of the quality. We did use our restaurant gift certificate the next day for lunch at the restaurant, and the food there was good. All of the staff that we dealt with were FANTASTIC!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Deb046
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 17 night stay at this hotel and loved every minute of it. The staff were brilliant, especially Courtney, Dee, Hugo, Nicole and Kathleen, they made our stay so welcoming......if we were to return to Florida we would definitely stay here again, it is in a wonderful location, close to everything you need....thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “"Great staff,Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: GAZSKYBenfleet
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from staying at this hotel and have nothing but good things to say about my stay.The staff are very friendly and helpful, the hotel is clean and tidy. I stayed on 22nd July 2010 for two weeks, the hotel has a free cocktail and drinks happy hour every day from 5.30 pm which was great.The free breakfast was fantastic and a great variety of stuff. This hotel is in the best position on I drive if you wish to walk to restaraunts and not have to drive,also close to the pointe orlando. I have stayed before and it will be first choice when i go back for my next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff at any hotel we have stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: DAH72
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 21 nights at this hotel - our first in the USA. Could not be faulted - especially the staff who were very polite and helpful at all times. Great breakfast, great free shuttle service with hospitable drivers. Free drinks every night and lots of restaurants near by. Taxis from Universal are cheap - only $10. More expensive from Disney as it is further away. Bahama Breeze and The Olive Garden were two of our favourite restaurants within a 1 minute walk of the front door. Location is far better in this part of IDrive - the northern part towards Wet n wild and Universal is a bit more 'Blackpoolish'. The southern end towards Premium Mall is a bit sparse of restaurants. This hotel is set on a palm tree lined, grassed part of IDrive which we thought was the nicest. We didn't have a car for three weeks which I thought might be a problem but the Taxis, free shuttles and I Trolley Bus meant that this was not a problem. Would recommend this hotel and will return if ever in Florida. Special thanks must go to Dee, Cesar, Courtney, and Tiffany as well as Mo, Hami and Vijay the shuttle drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Would be fab if some of the "behind the scenes" staff didn't disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: Bowtell
Reviews.Content: There are so many positive things to say about this hotel.The front staff are delightful and very helpful (big shout out to Jay at the valet point and his magical drawer of vouchers). The Manager's Reception drinks were delicious and served with a smile. The breakfast was delicious and readily available. the bed was the comfist I've ever slept on and the atrium is gorgeous. You cannot fault the location! Bad stuff (and it pains me to add it). Room 422. On entering our room, we were hit by a musty damp smell that it turned out came from the wardrobe. We aren't fussy people so didn't bother to complain but I'm shocked that the cleaning staff hadn't mentioned it to management as it was very evident. The shower head was loose from the wall and with the shower on, the tap would still run regardless. Again, very trival and it didn't really bother us as the pressure and temp were lovely but I'm surprised that this room had been let out. The maids were inconsistant with bin emptying and towel replenishment but the worst, very worst, was this. Two days into a 10 night stay, my husband lost his PJ bottoms. We found them the day before we left muddled in the bottom of the eiderdown. The linen had obviously not been changed in over a week. I would add that ever other aspect of our stay was a real treat and if I could be sure I would get a well maintained room, I would stay there every vacation ever!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic loved it”
Reviews.Author: ciara1
Reviews.Content: Location perfect. on international drive opposite restaurants. I trolley stop right outside. taxi available at no notice to take 5 of us - taxis very cheap. the staff here are amazing, like no hotel we have stayed in before, they go out of their way to help you. The free breakfast is brilliant, so much choice. The drinks reception great, hotel rooms so clean. I would def recommend to anyone - total value for money. fantastic time

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: sueleb18
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from two weeks in Florida and were moved to the Embassy Suites by our tour company as our first choice of hotel was too far out with no car. Were very impressed by the friendlyness of all the staff we had contact with especially the bell hops who always greated us when we returned to the hotel at night. Loved the atrium with the large palms and other exoctic plants and the water fall. We wish we had booked this hotel in the first place and found it so centrally placed for eating and entertainment, also free shuttle service was ideal with two different times available to Epcot which ment we didn't have to get up too early everyday. The rooms were very spacious and clean although the bathroom seemed a bit tired looking and there were a couple of stains on the carpets which didn't look too good. Another annoying thing was the curtains which would not close far enough over the door which didn't give a lot of privacy to any one sleeping on the sofa bed in the seating area, also didn't realise how noisy it was at the back of the hotel where our room was due to the i4 but as we were very tired most nights we soon got used to it, but it ment we couldn't have our windows open at all . We found our whole holiday experience very good and nothing was too much trouble. A great comfort when you are travelling on your own with two teenage children. We will be going back again and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: love2travelww
Reviews.Content: The first day of our experience here wasn't the best. We were put in a room that had no tub (for handicaps) because the hotel was booked. so when we got showers the bathroom basically flooded. However, the front desk noted this and we were put in a room wtih a tub the next day. We stayed here for a week. We got a great rate on this on hotwire (car rental included, if you do'nt know when you book a hotel and car on hotwire you are able to see the hotel). This hotel has free parking, and even better...free breakfast buffet. Hot good food. Some which is made to order (omlettes etc). There's a room with 4 computers with free internet that came in handy During the week, there's happy hour from 5 to 7...drinks are free! can't get any better than this. There's an Olive Garden right next door and even more restaurants along I-Drive. The movie theathre (at the Pointe) is about a 3-5 min walk away. BB King Blues club is nearby too ...good food and good live entertainment...must go check it out! There's also a helicopter ride nearby (we're going to try it next time). Along with many other things to do on I-Drive there's a club across the street that has a part of it that's made of ice. The outlet mall is just at the end of I-Drive with alot of great stores with good deals. this hotel is situated sort of in the middle closer to the south end of I-Drive but near everything. Always recommend to rent a car in Orlando because you really do have to drive or catch public transportation to get to places. Aside from the first night here the hotel was a nice place to stay. The gym isn't huge but there's enough machines to do something.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base”
Reviews.Author: capejoy
Reviews.Content: Well located on International Drive. The 8 floors of rooms are positioned around a large central glass covered atrium where a complimentary breakfast with a lot of choices is served. The suites have a large sitting room with dining area and large television. There is a compact bathroom and small kitchenette with full fridge and microwave. The bedroom is large, we had 2 queen sized beds in ours and there was still plenty of room for a built in wash hand basin, wardrobe, drawers and another large television. If you can get a suite on the top floor you get brilliant views of the area. Both the outdoor and indoor pools are small considering the size of the hotel but I guess people donâ€™t travel to Orlando to laze by a pool. There is a small complimentary business centre with free internet access. The Reception staff were efficient and helpful and it was a pleasure to arrive here after the long journey from UK. We also used this hotel for our final night before returning to the UK and they allowed us to keep our room until 3pm without extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: eightonesix
Reviews.Content: Although the facilities are clearly dated, the staff makes this hotel one I would recommend. I was there on business, and I like Embassy because I can set up an area to work in the front room and still have the back bedroom for getting away from the computer. The room was clean, although the hotel is rough around the edges. The staff and location of the hotel really make this one a gem. I like being able to walk to have dinner and drinks, and the staff was very courteous and seemed to be genuinely interested in my stay -- and my safe return home.

Reviews.Title: “If you are booking this hotel becuase of "free shuttle bus to Universal Studio and Disney". Think twice.”
Reviews.Author: Cindy2010_10
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel with free shutle bus to Universal Studio and Disneyhotel on-line and was thrilled to find this one with decent review on tripadvisor. However, after I booked and hotel and emailed the hotel to request shuttle bus schedule, I was told there is only one bus going to universal studio at 9:10am. So if you missed the bus or you would like to go early, you would have to pay for alternate transportaion.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: LindaTWoodstock_GA
Reviews.Content: We had the priviledge of staying at the Embassy Suites for a retreat this past June. What an awesome place! I can't tell you how helpful all of the employees were, especially Wendy and Mileidy. If you ever need to book a conference, I would highly recommend this hotel. Fortunately, we get to go back in September for another meeting. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: JSTn29306
Reviews.Content: I spent four evenings at this location in early June 2010. Check in was smooth, although I did request a room change due to lack of balcony and limited view. Front desk was helpful and accommodated my request (thank you!). Vallet parking is available, but ample free parking is also provided. Overall impression -- although this hotel is showing age in places, it is well maintained. The bathroom was small, but all was in working order and clean. Beds are comfortable and flat screen TVs are of good quality with good channel line-up. Room was cozy and clean. Cooked to order breakfast is convenient start the day. Grill cooks were efficient and very friendly. Manager's reception was also nice touch for pre-dinner coctails. I took dinner in the hotel restuarant, Fisheye Grill, 2 evenings. Food was well above average and good value. Bar staff was friendly and provided excellent service. Fitness room has good variety of cario equipment. Did not use the pools, but they did appear clean and maintained (and well used by the families). Location is excellent -- within walking distance of many attractions, shopping and and dining venues.

Reviews.Title: “Service that goes above and beyond - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: middlchild2000
Reviews.Content: I can not speak to many of the aspects of the hotel, such as the rooms or value since I did not actually stay in the hotel, but I would like to comment on the customer service and hospitality. While I was not even a guest at this hotel, I was treated with the utmost respect and consideration. While staying at another local hotel, I ran into a problem that my hotel was not willing to correct or even attempt to remedy. They had promised me a crib for my toddler and when we arrived tired in the middle of the night, they informed us that they couldn't find one. Desperate and in tears, I showed up a total mess to Embassy Suites at 1:30 in the morning and was kindly greeted by the front desk manager who went far above and beyond to help. He loaned me a pack and play from their hotel even though I was not a customer. I was extremely impressed by the professionalism and respect I was shown. I would certainly consider staying at this hotel if I return to the Orlando area! I'm sure it is more expensive that the Econolodge where we stayed, but I guess sometimes you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marie427
Reviews.Content: Our overall experience here was terrible! When we first pulled up to the hotel, I got out to get a luggage cart while my husband parked the car. However, to my dismay, the bellhop told me that guests weren't allowed to have a cart, he said he and the car were a "package deal" and he would have to take everything personally to my room for me. I felt this he was trying to force me to obtain his services for a tip so I asked the desk clerk for a cart but she directed me right back to the same bellhop who was holding the luggage carts hostage. When we got to our room, judging by all the random pubic hairs around the toilet and in the tub, you would have thought they were holding a bikini contest in the hotel. When we asked the front desk to send someone upstairs to clean it up and bring us some toilet tissue, which was not in the room, no one ever came. The room also stunk of mold and some other odd smell, which would not go away even after we open the balcony door. The furniture was dated and the refrigerator stunk, although nothing was in it. The list of things wrong with this location just goes on and on but the kicker was when we checked out and discovered they charged both me and my mother's credit cards for the stay; my mother was only supposed to pay for one night and I was to pay for the additional nights. When he tried to explain this to the hotel manger, Angela, she constantly talked over us and told us that we just needed to listen to her. Then when I try to interject and explain again, she rolled her eyes and turned to my mother and talked louder to over talk me. No apologizes were ever offered and Angela constantly slapped her hands over the head everytime I talked to appear as if I had a mental block. From my arrival to my departure, this was the worst Embassy Suites I've ever stayed at!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, kind service”
Reviews.Author: ferdinandcomteb
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites has comfortable and spacious family suites for very reasonable prices. Breakfast is generous and with a large variety of food. The staff is helpful and friendly. The location of the Embassy Suites at International Drive is super! It is close to the shopping malls, outlets and there are many restaurants in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “safe and secure”
Reviews.Author: DANGLASGOW
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit to the Embassy Suites at Easter as we stayed there last year at the same time. We had already experienced all of the same as cypruslover 2008 reveiew which we recommend you read who were the couple we met this year. [ friends for ever ] We returned as we felt safe, secure and welcomed by all of the staff and we enjoy the brilliant breakfast and manager's reception in the evening, also the quiet location. This time we were extended 9 days due to the volcanic ash cloud and we were made to feel more like we were family as opposed to guests. The hotel had a pizza party for all stranded guests which made us feel that they cared but we already knew this as it was our 2nd visit. We have recommended this hotel to family, friends and work colleagues and we would like to thank Cody and Angela the duty manager's. Robert at front desk who is a real gentleman straight out of the movies, Dee for his dancing and wonderful smile, Patrick and Christine for their bar service, Tiffany and Teresa at front desk, Alyssa and all the staff at breakfast especially staff who make the omlettes, also room service staff. We look forward to visiting the Embassy Suites for the 3rd time next year. Thanks again Danny & Elizabeth Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service by all staff - outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationmakers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the embassy suites with my husband and 2 children aged 20yrs and 7yrs in april 2010 celebrating our silver wedding anniversay. We experienced outstanding service in all areas of the hotel with no exceptions. The staff we friendly helpful and the hotel was spotlessly cleaned and had a wonderful ambience. The managers cocktails were provided daily in the beautifuIl atrium. We were stranded in Florida for an extra 10days due to the hurricane. The staff were truly wonderful, and I think that it is a true test of service when things do not go to plan. The staff booked us into the hotel for an extra 10days and really looked after us. We were offered a discount in the restaurant lunch and dinner, and even provided the stranded guests with a pizza party one evening. I cannot extend my gratitude to you enough as this could have turned out so different if it had not been for your hospitality and kindness. There were many other ways in which the management helped us out and we are extremely grateful. We had a truly memorable silver wedding anniversay - and look forward to our next visit to Florida and the Embassy Suites Thanks to everyone you are doing a wonderful job in looking after your guests.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: tazmania76
Reviews.Content: really good service we where really happy it's a very quiet hotel where you can rest and relax

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest Hotel Family Stay Vacation”
Reviews.Author: gemita12
Reviews.Content: Great Service, Location, All the staff was kind and helpful Hotel room was great with all the needs possible attention of room service excellent

Reviews.Title: “AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE!!!”
Reviews.Author: aries7656
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites Hotel Orlando is a very nice place to stay, my husband and I had a wonderful time, what we enjoyed the most was the breakfast, which was great every single day, the way we were treated by all the staff in the hotel was great, we also aprecciate the fact that there are free rides to the theme parks, that was a great plus due to the fact that we went to Orlando just to visit them, besides it was a great thing that we were able to buy the tickets to the theme parks right there . It was an amazing experience and we hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was nice ... but the facilities need improvement”
Reviews.Author: Wyatt1970
Reviews.Content: At first, the hotel seems really nice. It has an indoor plaza with plenty of tables and lots of plants. The staff is friendly and responsive, from the waiters in the restaurants to the bell hops. The rooms are also well furnished and clean. However, there are some design flaws with the rooms. For example, the entrance to the room has a tall window on each side of the door. That seems like a nice touch until you come inside and realize that it's very easy for people walking by to look into your room. They have curtains on both windows, but the curtains still leave a gap along the edge of the door. If you like to lounge around in your underwear, you better do it in the bedroom. See my photos to see what I'm talking about. Another problem is the shower. I am 6 feet tall. Not short, but not super tall either. The shower head is at my chest level. If you are tall and have any kind of back problems, you may have a hard time taking a shower in these rooms. Don't bother with the free breakfast. The eggs I had were watery and the potatoes were not much better. There wasn't much variety in their selection of fruits and cereals either. You have a Friendly's and a Denny's about 1 minute away and even an IHOP just past the convention center. Go there instead. On the plus side, you are not too far from some excellent restaurants for lunch and dinner. I highly recommend the Funky Monkey Wine Bar, which is about a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. The convention center is about 20 minutes walk time. Overall, it's not a bad hotel, but it's not great either. if you can live with it's flaws, it's not a bad deal. But there are lots of other hotels nearby that I would choose over this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and rooms but the service was exemplary.”
Reviews.Author: erinbeth
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Orlando for a convention in late April/early May 2010. The convention hotels were booked up so I got a good deal with Embassy Suites. The rooms were clean and comfortable and quiet. I am a very light sleeper and was a little concerned when I was above the pool but there was no problem since it closes and they are good at enforcing this rule. The bed was extremely comfortable, not too hard or soft, and it's nice to have the living room between you and the hotel hallway because it reduces the noise. It was nice to be able to grab breakfast on the way to the convention and though it was nothing special it had a good variety (omelettes, bagels, oatmeal, fruit, yogurt). I agree with the previous reviews that it is annoying to have to pay for internet and that would be my one recommendation to the Embassy Suites is just because other hotels do it doesn't make it right. The location is great. Walking distance to convention center and very wide selection from restaurants in the area with the I-ride trolley stop right outside the hotel. This is a very pleasant hotel but the thing that makes it stand out was the service. From the moment you walked in I was impressed. From the attentive check in to their helping me w/ my key to get in to the fitness room as well as the manager's reception. I have stayed in all kinds of hotels and have always felt a hotel is a hotel but one w/ good service is what makes it stand out.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is awesome, can't wait to return one day”
Reviews.Author: cypruslover2008
Reviews.Content: This is the most friendly hotel we have stayed in, it is a gem in the heart of Orlando. My review will not go anywhere close enough to do it justice. Even before our stay, I was amazed by the response to emails I had sent to the hotel asking about a few items such as shuttle times etc and a few personal requests. You really get the feeling that everyone will do all they can to accommodate the guests and make the trip as enjoyable and special as possible. And that your individual stay is exceptionally important to them. We had initially booked a 14 night stay at this hotel but due to the Air Traffic problems linked with the Icelandic Volcano, our visit ended us being extended by a further 9 days. This gave us even more time to appreciate the facilities of the Hotel but also time to be further amazed by the friendliness, kindness and the exceptional way the staff go above and beyond to ensure their guests enjoy their stay. I will talk of this later in my review. Approaching the Hotel it looks proud and welcoming stood in the quieter and in my opinion, more refined location at the southern end of International Drive. As mentioned before in other reviews, there is the I-Ride stop number 22 just outside the hotel and also a Lynx stop. Nearby restaurants all within very easy walking distance include the delicious and exceptionally friendly Olive Garden, Tony Romaâ€™s, Sizzlers, Pizza Hut, Subway, Bahama Breeze, Cattlemans Steakhouse, Ponderosa, TGI Fridayâ€™s, Boston Lobster Feat, Friendlyâ€™s, Houlihan and not too far away, Ming Court. As soon as you walk towards to entrance of the hotel you are greeted by cheery faces from whatever member of staff is one duty at that particular time. You walk in the entrance lobby/reception area and the WOW factor kicks in, the atrium further in to the hotel invites you to wander further in to complete the first impression experience. The Reception staff greet you with a smile and deal with your check-in in a speedy and professional manner, offering any additional information that may be necessary to ensure you feel at home and acquainted with the surrounding of the Hotel immediately. We found all other occasions when we either went to the Reception desk with a query or just passed by on our way in or out of the Hotel there was a smiley face and cheerful greeting.
