Our room (number 218) was delightful, it was a corner room, facing the I4 Interstate but we never found the sound of passing vehicles a nuisance, this was great, as in our own home we live in a rural area with no sounds at all, so we found ourselves pleasantly surprised to not be bothered by the sounds of passing traffic. In fact it is a point to note that the whole hotel seems extremely well soundproofed and we never noticed noise form rooms above or to the side of us even though we knew they were occupied. The living area of the suite appeared huge and we made use of the Double sofa bed for one of the members of our party for the duration of the holiday and most days left the bed in situ rather than pack it away each day, we still had plenty of space to move about in the living area, and didnâ€™t feel too cluttered. We had a full size under the counter fridge, with small ice box (the icebox didnâ€™t tend to freeze items though unless they were flat against the surface, but this didnâ€™t pose a problem for us). We also had a microwave and coffee maker. (The coffee maker didnâ€™t appear to boil the water to a temperature good enough to make a decent cup of tea, again this wasnâ€™t a problem but if you are a tea drinker, it might be worth taking a travel kettle or asking to see if Reception have a kettle you could make use of). Everyday the stock of complimentary toiletries was replenished, these items consisted of mini shampoo, conditioner, soap and body lotion. A couple of days we returned to our room to find swans or elephants made out of towels on the beds. This was a great treat and a nice touch. The main bedroom had large patio doors with a narrow balcony, it had net curtains as well as fully lined black out curtains so your room remained private to people walking past outside. Our room had leafy trees outside the windows so this also gave a degree of additional privacy but without appearing to block out any sunlight. We had two double beds which were very comfortable. There is also a large flat screen tv in both the living room and the bedroom. The wardrobe was a brilliant size to hang all our holiday clothes and the sideboard was huge with plentiful drawer space to pack everything away. There was a hairdryer and Iron and Ironing board in the room. On every even numbered floor there is a laundry corner with a washing machine, tumble drier and soap powder vending machine. There are plentiful selections of Ice Machine which you can take the Ice Bucket from your room to fill up for free. There are also food and drink vending machines dotted all around the hotel if you fancy some munchies or are thirsty and donâ€™t want to wander down to the shop. The shop is fairly small but sells everything you could possibly need from toiletries, clothes, food and drink to souvenirs. The gentleman there seemed a little shy but once he got to know us we had great chats. The Managers Reception was a lovely added extra to the stay and it was so brilliant to be given something for free these days, I thoroughly enjoyed trying the different cocktails on offer whilst my husband chilled with a beer and his daughter quenched her thirst on soft drinks. The snacks they provided were lovely and plentiful, the salsa dip and ranch dressing were especially nice and to think this was all laid on for free. I was surprised at how many guests seemed to forget to offer tips to the ever friendly and jovial bar staff. This daily event provided us with a great opportunity to mingle with other guests and was the thing that helped us to make friends with people and through this we have created a great friendship with another couple from the UK who ordinarily we may never had sat and chatted with as we would have just been guests that passed each other by during our stay. But because of these free drinks/snacks one or other of the couples would grab a spot ready for our evening catch-ups and our daily laughs. What a brilliant way to end each evening. The shuttles laid on for free went at times we felt were suitable to enable you to visit the parks and we even managed to stay to the firework display at Disney Hollywood Studios and still get the shuttle back. The outside swimming pool was never crowded and most of our stay the inside pool was empty so we felt like we had our own private sauna, hot tub Jacuzzi and pool when we visited it. Both pools had plenty enough chairs and loungers to chill on when we didnâ€™t fancy a dip. There was piped music which we felt was an added touch, it was not too loud but enough to unwind and relax to. Outside there were little lizards sometimes popping out of the undergrowth but these never became a nuisance or bothered us as they scupper out of your way if you go towards them. I normally hate all reptiles but I found them really cute and fascinating. There was always a plentiful stock of fluffy white towels to use in either of the pools. The Business Centre was great as we could use the internet for free and had use of the printer etc which proved a great help in our holiday, there was also a space where we could take our laptop and use that there, thereby allowing us access to all our own files and documents etc. The breakfast buffet was always fresh and the area kept spotlessly clean and hygienic. The selection was brilliant, from memory there were good quality yogurts, apples, oranges, bananas muffins, bagels, mini Danish pastries, bread and a toaster to put it through yourself, jams, Philadelphia cheese portions, butters, four different selections of cereals, from memory, raisin bran, fruit loops, cornflakes and cherries, also grits and porridge with a selection of different granola sprinkle to add if you so wish. The cooked selection was eggs, scrambled or fried to your own specific request. The choice of omelettes was mind blowing but extremely fresh and tasty. There was crispy bacon, sausages, corned beef hash, breakfast potato chunks, French toast and pancakes. There was also little extras such as chocolate sauce, maple syrup and salsa portions. There were fruit juice and iced tea/soda vending machines to help yourself from and hot drinks machines also providing hot water for cups of tea or hot chocolate. The Atrium where the seating is for the dining area was nice and bright and airy and the seating area didnâ€™t feel to cluttered so you felt you had space around you whilst you were eating. It was lovely to sit amongst leafy lush plants and rockeries with gentle waterfalls. The staff where very quick to clean crockery etc away but never in an overbearing manner, two members of staff shone out for us and they were Elene and Alyssa I think. I never ate in the Fisheye grill restaurant so canâ€™t comment on that but the seating area was tastefully decorated and looked really nice. The Concierge area seemed to have a lot of information and the chap on the desk â€“ Robbie I think his name was is very friendly and appeared to be very helpful to those needing assistance. Other people who we feel need an extra special mention are Robert who genuinely seemed sad to see us leave when we finally got the call to go home, Teresa, Cody, Alvera, Tiffany, Ken and we have saved the best till last, Dee. Well what can we say about Dee, for us he was the highlight of the hols with his cheery face and greeting everytime we saw him, he always seems so pleased to see us and always made the time to stop and chat with us, like we were VIP Guests. He made my step-daughters day by showing us his spiderman skills by performing his back flips and acrobatics. He also came and personally brought her a leaving gift on the day we eventually set off for home. Talking of going home, as mentioned previously, we were some of the Brits who found themselves stranded across the Atlantic when we couldnâ€™t get flights home to the UK. The hotel was amazing and made the situation as painless as possible by always making sure we had our places in our rooms extended each time we heard that the possibility of going home had been further delayed. We luckily never felt we were going to be booted out of our rooms like other guests in other hotels nearby. As soon as the situation regarding being stranded happened the hotel immediately offered all UK guests stranded 50% off any bill in the Fisheye Grill Restaurant. They also allowed us to make some emergency and important calls from the reception desk free of charge. We also were provided with and amazing offer for Internet Access in our room (donâ€™t want to shout what it was just in case someone shouldnâ€™t have done so and donâ€™t want any person to get in trouble, but if staff read these reviews, thanks to whoever it was). But finally the thing that touched us most once we were stranded was the fact that the hotel organised and provided us with a free Pizza Party put on just especially for all the stranded brits in their hotel. It showed us all how cared for and important we were as guests. We found special invites put under our doors and when the evening came around we all could not believe the amount of effort and thought that had gone into the party, the volumes of free food laid on for us all was astounding, I think we all only just managed to finish the food before we all rolled off happily to our rooms. It was a really happy evening full of laughter amidst all the trauma and stress and uncertainty of being stranded abroad. For anyone unsure whether to book this hotel, go for it you will not be disappointed. For anyone who has booked and is just checking out the reviews before your hols, you are in for a real treat. Finally, for all the staff at the Embassy Suites, thank you for making our stay so memorable, watch out, one day we will be back. You are stars.

Reviews.Title: “does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Thomassons080
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a basic suite which has 2 'rooms and therefore by European standards is large. It was clean and comfortable with flat screen TVs, kitchenette which comprised of sink, tea/coffee maker and fridge which is very useful. The inclusive breakfast was good with eggs/omlettes etc cooked to order to supplement the buffet. If you want to walk to bars and restaurants in the evening then Embassy suites is ideally placed with plenty of places easily accessible and as it's on the more 'sophisticated' end of I.drive walking is a pleasant experience. The interstate I4 is behind the hotel, but unless you have the windows open there is no noise. and the 'sitting room' buffers any noise from the hotel corridors. The managers welcome drinks between 5.30 and 7.30 evey night are free, but unfortunately this seemed to be the only time when the bar was open. The hotel does have a restaurant, but we did not try it and midweek it looked very empty. Overall the hotel manages the balance bewteen business and leisure visitors well. Like most - location and breakfast. Like least - having to pay for internet access

Reviews.Title: “not the best”
Reviews.Author: Lp28
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this was not the best hotel we stayed in( of the 4 on our recent trip). Upon entering you are greeted with a distinct 'musty' smell. It is a large hotel with a large atrium including waterfall (probably the source of the smell as it seemed a little old). Our room smelt very musty or moldy as soon as you entered also. The room was clean enough and reasonably spacious and our bed was very comfortable (one of the best we had on these travels). However we backed onto a highway which was extremely noisy 24 hours a day. The noise was too great to have the sliding door open, plus we got the smells from the kitchen below when we opened it in the morning. Breakfast was terrible, seemed like a lot of choice, but very poor quality. The young male concierge was helpful, however on the Sunday the female was of no help and had trouble answering basic questions. I ended up looking things up myself on the internet. House keeping do origami like towel folding which was very novel.

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely visit”
Reviews.Author: FrankW16
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Embassy Suites International Drive, we have usually stayed at the Quality Inn Plaza just up the road, but now would stay nowhere else but the Embassy Suites. Having had a good room last year we requested this one again this year and got it with no problems. The suite was nice and large, the bedroom having 2 double beds and the lounge having a pull out sleeper sofa are more than adequate for our needs. The rooms are nice and clean, housekeeping calls in daily, the towels and bathroom are alway sorted and the beds made (although they didn't make the beds on a couple of days), The suite overlooks I4 and but the noise isn't too bad and quickly just becomes a background hum when the balcony doors are closed. You also get a view of all the Disney firework displays. It was my birthday as we arrived, and the first thing house keeping did was bring up a cake, which not only was a lovely gesture it tasted nice too, then on the next day there was also balloons and chocolates. These were all lovely touches and although I left a card for John Parkinson the General Manager to say thank you, I would also like to say thank you to him now so that other people know how good he and the hotel staff are. Robert on the Front Desk was lovely and very helpful and Jose the Handyman was always on hand if anyone had a problem. In general all the staff were very friendly and a cheery good morning/evening was given by everyone. Although the hotel was full, there was never a line for breakfast and we always got a good table in the Atrium, the breakfast was always nice and the managers cocktails in the evening are always welcome when you return from the days adventures. There are plenty of very nice restaurants within easy walking distance and Pointe is just a few minutes walk away. We enjoy the Emabassy Suites so much we booked them for our trip to Canada and will be using this hotel again on our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but I don't understand all the positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: saxorob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in March. Location is great, with many great restaurants around. But when I got in the shower, I kept feeling dripping ice water on my head. It took me a few minutes to figure out that there was a PVC dripline coming right out of the center of the bathtub ceiling. Thinking it was a release from a bathroom leak above me, I went down to the front desk who told me that all bathrooms had this, and that it was the condensation drip from the a/c in the room. The lady told me the only way to avoid ice water from dripping on my head was to turn off the a/c for 30 minutes before your shower, and to keep it off until after you stepped out of the tub. This is really bizarre, and I'm surprised that A) the builders would have allowed this in the design of the rooms and B) other TripAdvisors haven't mentioned it yet. If management is listening, why does the a/c drip into the center of the bathtub, and is it really this way in every bathroom? Other that that, the rooms are dated and tired but clean. There were several members of our group that complained of moldy and musty smells in their rooms. My other complaint was the $10 daily charge for wireless internet - nobody charges for wireless internet anymore. Trying to be funny with the nice girl at the front desk about paying for wireless internet, I also asked her if the hotel also provided banks of payphones for guest use - she didn't understand my joke and pointed my way to where there actually were payphones. Positives about the hotel are the friendliness of the staff, and the value of the overall product with the larger rooms, free cocktails, and free breakfast. I don't particularly care for the school cafeteria style of serving breakfast, but if I were here with my wife and kids on a family vacation (like it seems this hotel is designed for), I'd probably appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for the price anywhere in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: FRESTER
Reviews.Content: I will make this brief because there are plenty of reviews on here for you look through.We stayed here in December 09 for three weeks and could not fault the hotel in anyway.. The free transport to both Disney and Universal was great as is the free breakfast and free evening snacks and cocktails. All the staff were great at there respective jobs and very friendly and helpfull but there were two who stood out from the crowd,Robby who sold the theme park tickets was very helpfull even though we didn't need to buy any tickets during our stay.He was happy to chat and give us some handy tips for each day.Robby is so good at his job we feel he is going to waste selling tickets and could be a huge asset to the hotel in another roll.The other stand out member of staff was Dee who was at the front door parking cars and greeting people,You could't ask for a better welcome to the hotel or a more friendly guy.My kids thought he was great always having a bit of fun with them when we were on our way out to the parks etc.He reminded us of Eddie Murphy!Great guy! The only thing I would say is bewere the hotel taxi service very expensive compered to the yellow cabs even putting extra money on the price once when we were on the way out of the car park.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, however be prepared for musty, moldy smell throughout the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelbou
Reviews.Content: Our family, myself, my husband and our two teenaged sons recently spent four nights at the Embassy Suites on International Drive in Orlando. The hotel, with the help of the trusty GPS is very easy to find, and the location is great. Near many resturants, attractions and shopping. Upon entering the lobby the first thing that hits you is the smell. While not disgusting, it is a rather strong musty/moldy smell. Check in was very efficient, and the requested rolling bed was delivered to our suite in a timely fashion. The suite itself is well appointed with a small to average size living area consisting of a double size pull out couch, a flat screen t.v. and a small kitchen area. No stove, but a bar fridge, a microwave and a sink. The bedroom was roomy with its own sink and vanity area. Lots of storage space for clothing. The bathroom was a big disappointment. It is old and in dyer need of updating. My tall sons commented that the shower was made for little people. I am 5' 6" and even I found that I had to bend over to wash my hair. The tiling was cracked and broken in several places. The breakfast in the morning is very good. Made to order eggs, and a large variety of other breakfast foods and beverages. During the evening managers reception drinks and snacks are free. Overall, we all thought that this hotel was a great value and we throroughly enjoyed our stay. It is old and in need of updating but if you are looking for great value this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Refuge”
Reviews.Author: Micklefielder
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel after checking out of another nearby in order to escape the hordes of football shirt wearing British holidaymakers, who seem to have completely taken over International Drive these days. Compared to where we'd been, it was like paradise. I was impressed with the whole layout of the place and the suites themselves were fantastic, beautifully clean and very spacious. Ideal for adults with families and who want a bit of privacy. There are two swimming pools, one of which is indoor, and at the time that we were there, both were very quiet. Not a British newspaper or Premier League shirt to be seen. What I found incredible, considering the standard of the place and the facilities, were the rates. Very reasonable indeed. I have paid far more for hotels of a much lesser standard. The breakfasts were very good and inexpensive with a wide variety of fruit, cereals etc and omelettes are made to order while you wait. Meals in the retaurant were very good too. Pleasant and helpful staff and good service all round. The only downside was the noise from outside. We had a room that faced onto I 4 and the traffic noise was bad, even during the night. Also, from a safety point of view, children do need to be supervisd at all times on the higher floors. The balconies from which the rooms are accessed are open plan and the safety railings are only relatively low. From the higher floors, there is a very considerable drop. Other than that, a beautifully peaceful place to find refuge and remember that you have actually travelled over four thousand miles to the United States.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Zahrobsky
Reviews.Content: I hate to give away my biggest secret in Orlando, but its so hard not to smile after a stay at the Embassy Suites International Drive Orlando. Perfect location, perfect service, and perfert accomodates makes this a trifecta of happiness! BESIDES getting the Embassy Suites standard of 2-room suites, cooked-to-order breakfast in the morning, lucious indoor atrium, and 2-hour happy-hour at night, this specific Embassy goes above an beyond to make sure that business and family travelers are well taken care of. While Disney and Unviersal may give all the excitement during the day, this is a fun place to stay were you can feel right at home. The service and staff are supreme and we couldn't find anything wrong. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lila1985
Reviews.Content: staff friendly especially the breakfast staff and doormen!!!! rooms were spotlessly cean at all times. laundry service very expensive 165 dollars for 2 small bags of laundry. drinks reception in the evening was good. this hotel wouldnt be the best suited for children as most guests seemed to be of an older age and i got the impression kids were getting in the way!!! overall a good location and no major negative issues. Charlene in drinks reception was kind of rude at times we tried to make conversation a few times but she was kind of stand offish! maybe she doesnt like the irish although when we gave her a tip she was nice as pie. also when you say thanks to her she says ah ha!! petty i know but seemed kind of mannerless!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel .. Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sara2709
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in January 2010.. It was nice and clean.. we arrived at the hotel after a 12 hour drive and found that they gave us a wrong room with double beds when we reserved a king size bed it was late and we were tired and they said there was no other room available that night without even an apology for their mistake instead the reception staff talked with an attitude as if it was not their problem.. it was frustrating having to stay in the wrong room and having to move our stuff again the next day.. and on top of that the internet is 10 dollars a day for each laptop .. which is too much considering some hotels offer internet for free.. I would not go there again..

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, courteous, helpful and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: HomeyNHope
Reviews.Content: Entire staff went out of their way to be helpful. Even when lines formed for the complementary breakfast, servers, cooks and cleaning staff had smiles and moved like they had a purpose in life...to make my stay a pleasure. They succeeded.

Reviews.Title: “Very 'Ordinary' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: This wasn't the greatest Embassy I've stayed at, it wasn't the worst...Somewhere unremarkably in the middle. The room was clean, the beds were okay, our room's bathroom needed a paint job pretty badly. Both TVs (parlor and bedroom) were flat-sceens, which was nice, and they had a nice selection of channels (I was there for business, so wanted to relax in the room most evenings). They offer both an indoor and an outdoor pool. The breakfast was among the better ones I've had at ES, although when they say it ends at 10:30, don't try walking up for seconds at 10:31, everything is taken away. The location is great for business travelers, just a few blocks from the Convention Center, and a TON of restaurants nearby. I wouldn't totally discount this hotel when I return to Orlando, but might look at other Hilton Family properties in the area first.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: FulanodeTal7
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites is in an excellent location on one of Orlando's busy strips. It includes both an indoor and outdoor pool which is great during the winter. There are many places to go, and they're all in walking distance of the hotel. The service was great as well because when I forgot my toothbrush they immediately sent one up with toothpaste and mouthwash! The Happy Hour everyday was very relaxing, especially with a bartender named Patrick Parkes who made the drinks quick and spectacular; made my stay worthwhile. If you get a chance to be there ask for that guy. Overall my stay was great! The service was excellent from check in to check out. As I said earlier room service waited on me hand and foot. The food at the restaurant was very good. Whether it was great seafood or excellent steaks it had it all for a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “The food and beverage team is fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: DakotaPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: The made to order breakfast every morning is unbelievable. I don't know how the F & B team is able to pull it off day after day. It is organized so well, the food is very good, and the staff amazingly accommodating. In the omelet line one morning the guy in front of me ordered 6 omelets at once!! Kudos for a job extremely well done. I was in the hotel over the Xmas holidays when everyone would probably like to be with their families. Yet this team never stopped tendng to the customer. I even noticed the Managers (I think that's is what they were because they were not in uniforms like the other employees) clearing tables, greeting guests, and filling chafing dishes. You are very lucky to have such a good team. The same behavior was shown at the Manager's Reception @ night. These folks should be cherished. They really understand what customer service is.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty beyond belief.....shocking for a Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gcsmith
Reviews.Content: We booked our 6 night stay at the Embassy suites on International Drive thru expedia.ca therefore we never really know what your getting into until its too late. We arrived about 9 PM on Sunday night after a long drawn out flight from San Juan PR to Orlando. The room was ready on the 3rd floor,,right accross from the elevator as well, rom 303! The curtains inside the room do not close all the way to the door so theres about a 7" gap on either side so that people caould see in the room when they walk along the hallway. Anyway at first glance the room was clean and we were so tired so we hit the sack right away. Breakfast in the AM is acceptable for a Hotel breakie,,,more cafeteria style but it did the trick. Eat beofre 7 30 AM or be inundated with kids and pushy people who think that theres no tomorrow for food! unbelievable rudeness in some people! When we went back to the room, refreshed and more aware,,we noticed there was a wine glass that had been put behind the end table and appeared to have been there for some time as there was mold on the rim and on the wine left in it. By the way the dust behind the table on the floor was a 1/2 " thick... no lie! We decided to leave the glass and see if the room attendents picked it up,,,,,we left on Saturday morning and it was still there......we are going to start a blog on the internet to see if anyone else that stays in this room finds the same glass stilll there,,,it should make for some interesting blogging! We had no toliet paper for one whole day,,,we asked repeatedly and finally after one of us going to the desk with the empty roll got some action from a snotty young girl, who if she worked for my company would be fired in a second. We then soon found out that your room isn't cleaned until 4 PM ish,,,thats great when you come back from a day out and want to chill to sit around while you get your room cleaned or go back out and come back later! unreal! We travel extensivley and have stayed at many hotel guest houses condo's all over the world, so we are not your average complainers,,,but the dirt in this room was so bad. We pulled the mattress back because it smelled so bad in the bedroom...there was so much hair and dirt behind there,,,it had never been vacummed for years I am sure. We left a note to the room attendent to please clean this up...it never got some and the sheets we requested be changed also never got done! On the 2nd to last night there...my wife woke up being eaten alive,,,we thought it might have been no see'ums getting in the open window. There was tiny blood spots where her legs were, from bites obviously,,,so we tore the bed apart looking for bed bugs.. After doing some research on the internet, which by the way wasn't free,,,an outragoue 9.95 US a day for that is a joke!, the smeel we thought was dirt could have been caused by bed bugs. On the morning we left ( 2 30 AM) early flight,,I awoke with bites to my side,,maybe 6 large whelts. We attribute it to who knows what,,,, We are home now and will keep this updated if we find out it was indeed bed bugs this hotel should be sued! It takes a week we found out to see if they travelled home with you... I have never stayed in such a dirty room,,,Hilton should be red faced.....this Hotel has great potential,,,,,but it all comes from the top as you know,,,likely bad management and it all comes down the pipe! I will do more reserach next time I book rooms on expedia for sure. As for the Embassy Suites on International Drive....we'l make sure to give it a wide berth and never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndyFL
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been spending our Xmas and New Year holidays at this Hotel for over 10 years. The staff is always wonderful and willing to help with whatever is requested. The pools and workout rooms are always great. We stay at a lot of Hilton properties during the year, but this is by and large our favorite. The breakfast is always fantastic and the wait staff very attentive. The General manager is always available and often stops and ask about our stay and if there is anything that he can do. I recommend this hotel to all of my friends visiting Orlando. It is near everyting, reasonable price and most important in Orlando, KID friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Higgys0
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 week stay at this hotel and i can honestly say that i have not found 1 thing to complain about. From the guys at the front of the hotel to the speedy check in, housekeeping and the complementary breakfast everything was 1st class. The room was clean and the beds were so big and comfy we slept really well. It was also reassuring that the rooms all opened into the hotel rather than onto the outside. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: blpeter
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at this property during the week of 11/18/2009. It was a business/leisure trip. I found the property a little dated but well maintained. The room was clean and well maintained. They had flat screen TVs in each room, and furniture looked to be recently replaced. Our maid was very nice and did not come to clean the room and some ungodly time. The evening reception was nice and enjoyable. The only thing that could be improved upon would be timing of the snacks provided. The hotel staff did not get them placed until way after the 5:30 pm time and then was very discourteous when asked about them. It could have been that my stay was also during the Florida Classic between Bethune Cookman and FAMU. The cook to order breakfast was great. Just as I've come to expect from this chain. There was a turn down service during the week and the maid even hand fashioned a swan out of a towel for us. We were given coupons to local restaurants (Boston Lobster Feast (stay away from)) and recommendations for others. I later found out that they hotel staff is given free meals for recommendations. Overall, this property is located in a good place which allows for walking to nearby restaurants, businesses. Note: A couple of the young ladies at the front desk could be a little more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Den19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed ay this hotel for a two week holiday for my 40th birthday and this was our fourth trip to Orlando. Check in was speedy but we were not given any information on the hotel ie breakfast times or location of hotel facilities, we had to work that out for ourselves. Our room did smell a little musty on arrival but that soon wore off (or maybe we just got used to it). Housekeeping was a little hit and miss......our room was not hoovered for the whole two weeks, we know this because it became a joke between us about the same bits left on the floor. The milk and coffee was not topped up every day but the bathroom was left very clean and the bed changed regularly. The hotel is in an excellent location, we have stayed in other hotels at the same end of I-Drive but this the was best for it's location. We felt quite secure as the rooms all open out onto the central atrium rather than the outside. Breakfast was excellent, food was kept topped up even during the very busy weekend of our second week. The transport provided to the parks was adequate but very busy even in November and we had to stand for the journey a couple of times. The service from staff was good although the receptionist did not bother to wish me a 'Happy Birthday' despite seeing the badge I was wearing. The hotel had been advised of my birthday but I was a little disappointed that it was not acknowledged in any way by the hotel. I did feel that at times the staff tended to concentrate their attentions on conference attendees rather than holidaymakers but as a conference hotel I guess this is understandable. Overall we enjoyed our stay and we would recomment the hotel to friends and family, mainly based on its location and security. Just a few minor changes would make this a truly excellent base for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and well maintained with excellent friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: MoJo777
Reviews.Content: Kid's loved the combination of an indoor and an outdoor pool and it was great to come back to the hotel and relax by the pool after a long day at the theme parks. Many great resturants are within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL REALLY DELIVERS THE ''WOW'' FACTOR”
Reviews.Author: WINTERDEVEREUX
Reviews.Content: Our family visits ORLANDO twice every year March and Oct, so you can imagine how many hotels we have stayed in over the last 19 years. We stayed at the Hard Rock at Universal last visit and we missed the Embassy Suites soo much, we vowed never to stay at any other hotel. WHAT WE LIKED From checking in to having our luggage escorted to our suite,the customer service we received at this hotel is simply outstanding.Charlene who runs the bar at the popular managers cocktail reception always has a smile for us and remebers our names including our son.little personal touches like this make all the difference to a hotel stay. t HE MANAGEMENT TEAM always make us feel welcome and that nothing is too much trouble for their team to help us whatever our requirements. The concierge service offered for golfing excursions was hassle free and first class. Breakfast is complimentary but hey there are no cutbacks here,you can choose from all toasts 'pastries cooked breakfast with eggs freshly cooked to order,but the most suprising and welcome part is the bespoke ''omelette station'' including an amazing variety of fillings.i loved the grape juice as it made a refreshing change from the ordinary breakfast juices.We had a free newspaper delivered to our suite daily too. The pools both indoor and outdoor are heated and the gym although small has a really good array of contemporary fitness equiptment . We had one tiny problem and when I mentioned it to the desk it was done and we recieved a card and goodie basket from the management But for us the very best thing was the hotel remembered it was our wedding anniversary and left a plate of chocolate covered strawberries in our suite with a congrats card. The suites are 2 roomed so if travelling with kids you still get your adult privacy yet you are still all together.The location is across from ''THE POINTE'' orlando and very near to the conference center.BOOK THIS HOTEL TODAY I GUARENTEE YOU WON'T BE DISSAPOINTED !

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tjmcgraw
Reviews.Content: Close to retaurants and transportation. Free parking. Good breakfast. Loved the rooms, clean and lots of space. It had a seperate room for sitting / watching tv. Very much enjoyed the stay. The outdoor pool / hottub could use a little upgrading however. We used the indoor hottub and enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, great value.”
Reviews.Author: DLfan74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 10/03 through 10/10. It was a very convenient location, lots of restaurants within walking distance. We ate at the Crab House once. We were the only people there due to the time of year. They have a happy hour from noon until 7:00 PM with 5.00 drinks and appetizers. The hotel rooms need a little updating. By that I mean that the "wood" furniture is starting to chip and the shower head needs to be moved up about 6 inches. I am 5'11" and the shower head come up to my chin. I had to bend over at the waist to wash my hair. Room was still great though. All rooms consist of a living room with a sink, fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Separate bedroom with sink vanity. Bed was a little firm for me, but perfect for hubby. Both TVs are LCD (awesome picture!). The one thing I did not like is that there are windows on either side of the door (all rooms surround the atrium). Even though there are curtains there, the curtains leave a gap where people can see in. I think if the curtain rods curved towards the wall that would fix the problem. We had to push the chair up against the curtain to keep in closed. Very annoying and I felt exposed. That's why I docked one star from the rating. The restaurant, Fisheye Grill, was a bit pricy. It was 60.00 with tip for 2 sodas, 2 appetizers (chicken tenders) and 2 "meals" (quesadilla with nothing on the side, no fries, nothing). Food was great, but definitely not budget friendly. It would have been a reasonable price if the quesadilla actually had fries or something with it. I would consider it an appetizer, not a meal. Free breakfast was great. All hot foods were kept behind the grill counter. Omelets are cooked very quickly so we never waited more than a minute or two. Hot foods were eggs/omelets cooked to order, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, home fries and pancakes. Other foods were biscuits, english muffins, pastry, cereal and fruit. Soda, coffee, juice and milk machines. Also, every night there is a manager's reception from 5:30-7:30. Free drinks (you can take two at a time) with chips/salsa and popcorn. Self-parking was free and we never had a problem finding a spot. Valet parking was 10.00 a day. Not worth it considering we found a parking spot within the same walking distance as the valet spaces which is about 50 feet from the front door. Might be worth it during the busy season. It was a great stay and I would stay there again. Just need to buy double sided tape to keep those curtains closed. :)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: balloch2406
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks and would hghly recommend it to friends. The hotel is clean and the staff are extremly helpful and nice. My son celebrated his 9th birthday while we were there and he was really suprised to come home from the parks to a birthday cake and balloons from the hotel it made his day.The breakfasts are great and the managers cocktails are a great way to end a busy day from walking round the parks or shopping. Will defo be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: SweetHomeChicago415
Reviews.Content: Accommodations were superb; location was very convenient to parks and various attractions; great breakfast not only saved us time but money as well.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Isabel G
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Orlando especially if on a budget. Rooms are spacious, well designed; storage space is plentiful. Not only was everything clean, smelled very fresh and airy, and everything was in almost new condition. The staff were smiling, warm, very welcoming, and ready to handle all requests and needs. The breakfast was great (we indulged in the custom omelets) the coffee was always available, and basically we wished that we had more time in the area. We will repeat our visit often.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at Embassy - International”
Reviews.Author: shopper35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on International Drive in order to go to Universal Studios the next day after going to Disney. I think we used everything that this hotel has to offer. We used the computers with free internet, manager's reception, breakfast and fitness center. This hotel was comfortable and clean. We love having two TV's and a separate room. The rooms have been remodeled within the past few years and it was a good hotel. I would stay here again when in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: biggazz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 21 nights stay at this hotel, having previously staying at a couple of the TA top ten I honestly cannot understand why it is not ranked much higher. As well as the quality of the amenities and services this hotel provides a couple of unexpected kindnesses provided by the management and staff added significantly to our holiday. The suites are comfortable and clean and the maid service was excellent. The breakfast, particularly the made to order items gave us all a great start to every day and the managers reception each evening made a return from the parks a very relaxing experience, the fact that both of these can be taken in a lovely atrium with palm trees and waterfalls added greatly. Only used the shuttles on a couple of occasions but they where bang on time and very efficient. As non drivers, the location of this hotel was also perfect having both a Lynx and I-Ride stop directly outside and being within easy walking distance of all of our favourite I Drive restaurants. Cannot really express our delight with everything about this hotel in words but would just like to extend our sincere thanks to all of the management and staff for helping to make our stay thoroughly enjoyable. We look forward to staying in this lovely hotel many times in the future Gary

Reviews.Title: “A Warm welcome awaits”
Reviews.Author: PATJORDAN
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay in this Embassy Suites and initial impressions were good: one of the most efficient check-ins ever. The first night we were exhausted from jet lag but were unable to sleep due to the noisy air conditioning. As soon as I mentioned it at reception, Tiffany (the duty went out of her way to make sure we were moved (to a superb 8th floor room) and couldn't do enough to make sure that everything was ok for us. Every member of staff we encountered was very friendly. The complimentary breakfast included cooked to order eggs & omlettes as well as bacon, sausage ,scrambled egg, potatoes, pancakes....a veritable feasy. Also very pleasant was the managers reception each evening. My sole gripe about this is the limited range of cold snacks. The choice of (complimentary) cocktails was very good too. Location was excellent , many bars & restaurants are within walking distance and driving to & from the hotel is easy. One other issue is the lack of in-room safes, though safety deposit boxes are available at reception. One particularly nice touch was the General Manager making it his business to call us to make sure we were happy. Not somethng you see very often, and is a testament to the service on offer. Well done all.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: SevagP
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Embassy Suites for 10 days from September 7 to 17. Service was good and staff very helpful. Roby, the person in charge in selling the tickets of the theme parks was great! He provided too much help in selecting the parks and providing advice and other details. Also, the lady servicing on the bar for drinks during managers reception everyday at 5:30 was remarkably polite and caring to remember always that one of my kids wants to drink his everyday pineapple juice without ice. Location of the hotel was good too. there was a I Ride stop just in front of the hotel. Close to many restaurants and at the same time in a quiet area. If you are looking to a more crowded area you have to go up north for about a mile or more. I suggest for some rennovations in the hotel. It feels somehow old. Also I think internet service must be complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Well-equipped hotel near Convention Center.”
Reviews.Author: MythosRestaurant
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close enough to the Convention Center that I didn't need to rely on the city shuttle. The Manager's reception (held after work hours during the week) is a nice way to relax and unwind after a long day. The pop-corn is freshly made. The salsa for the nachos needs work, but the free drinks make up for it. The rooms are spacious, which either allows you to spread out or comfortably accommodate your family. The made-to-order omelette for breakfast was a treat. Noise and activity level was high because we were in town on business over a weekend and had to put up with lots of families and teen groups that might not have been there during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites - A true American style reception”
Reviews.Author: roqueAJ
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we have visited the USA, and were pleasantly surprised by the very helpful and attentive staff who not only did all the basics extremely well, (i.e smooth check in and helping with luggage) but they also acknowledged us when walking around the hotel which helped us feel very much at home. The staff, on the whole, greeted you with a smile and were very hospitable. Upon entrance the hotel boasts a spectacular lobby with ornamental fountains and foliage. The room was comfortable and cleaned daily, with the maids also leaving towels in the shapes of swans on the bed, an appreciated touch. The breakfast was substantial with omelettes cooked to order along with other hot and cold buffet style items. The only disappointment, which I do not blame the hotel for, was the coffee which left a lot to be desired in terms of taste, which is probably not an american strong point. A decent cappuccino would not have gone amiss. However, this was a minor blemish considering that there were delicious pancakes, (this certainly is an american strong point!) with fresh fruit, pastries, cereals and unlimited juices and soft drinks. The happy hour was a welcome feature considering that it was free. The cocktails were a pre-prepared variety, but nevertheless. I repeat, this was complimentary and I simply cannot have any complaints. The drinks were accompanied with nachos served with a freshly prepared salsa, along with popcorn and pretzels which we snacked on each evening. A special thanks goes to the concierge Robby, who was always helpful in providing information even though we never actually purchased any tickets from him. He even gave us his own personal suggestions on his favourite restaurants and attractions, and was always happy to chat and to share his experiences. He deserves credit from the hotel. Furthermore, on our first night the gentleman at the check in desk was also kind enough to provide us with a free 24 hours of internet connection for our laptop so we could try it out, which usually is 9.95 for 24 hours. To conclude our stay the gentleman who saw us out with our luggage provided a performance of his karate and acrobatic skills, doing impressive backflips as we waited for our car to come round. He practically loaded all the luggage himself with a smile, and waved us off enthusiastically and performed another backflip for good measure! Overall this hotel is very well appointed with the focal point being its staff, who ensured that our first stay in America was very memorable indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location on I-Drive, Huge Rooms, But Needs a Makeover!”
Reviews.Author: ozelite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July '09, for exploring I-Drive and visiting the Disney parks! The hotel is in an excellent location, right in the middle of the action on I-drive with great cheap pubs and eateries, bars and activities all within short distance. Positioned right next to an I-Trolley stop for easy access to the rest of I-Drive including all the great outlet stores! Rooms are very big and nice, but the rooms as well as the whole place looks like it was built in the 80's and the decor is pretty old and worn. The cocktail hour is a complete joke with 0.00002% cordial mixes and plastic cups of cheap beer being given out along with popcorn and plain nachos with tomato sauce (no meat) .. thats literally all on thats on offer, so we lasted about 2 minutes on the first night before giving it a big miss. The service from the counter was very good, although another big complaint was the lack of buses servicing the Disney parks. The reception told us they were mainly a corporate/business hotel and so didn't cater much to parks. You had to basically catch the 8am bus which was always full meaning you could stand up for 25 min drive or miss out and then you would have to connect from Magic Kingdom to other parks. Coming back from the parks was even worse with very very limited choices of shuttles to return on, and a taxi costing $30USD+ from one of the parks! A good base, but perhaps not the best choice for Disney park goers and definitely needs a makeover to bring it into the 21st century!

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service I Have Ever Encountered”
Reviews.Author: bk308
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at your establishment Embassy Suites on International Drive Orlando, FL. from August 24-28, 2009. On the evening of the 27th, I had decided to find a store within walking distance from the hotel where I could purchase a couple of movies for the trip home. I went down to the front desk to find out where the closest location would be. At the front desk I met Stephanie. I told her my plans and she spent several minutes trying to think of locations and even researching possibilities online. When we had eliminated all other possibilities, we decided Wal-Mart would be my best bet. Stephanie proceeded to draw me a map, but explained it would be a fairly long walk. She then made an offer that completely took me by surprise. She said if I told her what movie I wanted she could drive to Wal-Mart on her break, pick it up, and bring it back to me. I was speechless. This gesture is by far the most above and beyond effort I have ever experienced from any type of customer service driven establishment anywhere. The fact that she was willing to do this utilizing her own time, using her own vehicle, with nothing to personally gain, all for a complete stranger speaks volumes as to the kind of personnel this organization employs. This entire experience left a sizable impression on me, and I truly hope Stephanie is recognized for her exemplary display of customer service at its finest.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value”
Reviews.Author: VMcKinnon
Reviews.Content: This is the first time my husband and I had visited Florida with our young daughter. We had specifically waited until she was four years old so that she could really enjoy all there is to offer. We did debate on whether we should get a villa but this was an ideal compromise. A suite with two very spacious rooms so our daughter could go to sleep in one and we could sit up a little longer without disturbing her. The accomodation was clean, spacious and included everything needed for a small family. There was a large sofa bed and dining table in one room with a small kitchen too. Loosely termed kitchen as it consisted of a full size fridge, microwave, coffee machine and sink. The other room had two queen sized beds and a wash basin area. Each room has two large flat screen tv's. What was even better about this hotel was the free (yes free) breakfasts. This meant you could have your breakfast without having to go out to a restaurant. There was everything you could want for breakfast, perhaps not as extensive as the all you can eats buffets elsewhere but more than enough for us Brits and did I say it was free! the omelette station meant fresh cooked to order omelettes every morning. And as a second bonus, free (yes free) drinks in the hotel every night for two hours between 5.30/7.30pm. This was very popular because it wasnt just beer or wine but also included cocktails and some nibbles. Dont forget to tip the barman a $1 for each round...he really is a busy chap for 2hrs and a few dollars is nothing compared to what you are saving on the drinks! Location wise the hotel is at the nicer end of International Drive. There are loads of really nice restaurants within easy walking distance, which is again ideal if you have just had a free cocktail or two and dont want to drive. All the arttractions are easy to get to with the obligatory car. We have always hired and cant comment on the hotels bus service. The people in the hotel were friendly and helpful. When one night our air conditioning went off they offered to move us but we declined as it was late. Next day it was fixed straightaway and we got $75 for the 'inconvieniance' and a chocolate spanner! A nice touch we just wouldnt see at home. We'd highly recommend this hotel and would certainly say to anyone with a young small family that this is your better alternative to a villa.

Reviews.Title: “talk about "gettin it all" on a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: esisthebest
Reviews.Content: A Saturday night getaway gave us more than we ever expected. To start we get to the hotel and already a savings as parking was complimentary. Then we were warmly greeted by the front desk and checked in. We entered a beautifully appointed suite (granite wet bar, micro,frig,etc) and headed down to the pool. After enjoying a relaxing afternoon we did plan on heading over to Pleasure Island but first.. some great service by our bartender Patrick at the managers reception. Now I don't always count pennies but come on!-we had 4 cocktails total and in todays world that equals at a minimum $20. Upon our return to hotel we had enjoyed the rest of the evening before turning in for the night and then we wake up to a fabulous breakfast buffet. So we did have it all !!! Lois and Frank

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Orlando family holiday”
Reviews.Author: NickMBerkshire
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the breakfast staff and cooks. My wife had her birthday on first day and was touched to enter the room and find cards, balloons, cake and (strangely) a little disney piglet. Negatives (all minor): the rooms were a bit dated, occasional stain on carpets, behind bathroom door. Odd having windows to corridor allowing others to look in on lounge and kids bed area, needed some ingenuity with curtains and coat hangers each evening to get privacy. Fridge temperature varied. No towel racks for bath towels, despite notices to use racks to avoid replacing towels daily! Positives: Complimentary breakfast was a great start to each day. Rooms were large and regular cleaning good. 2 large TVs. Service could not be faulted. 2 pools which were quiet during our stay, hotel quiet at night, ideally placed for I-Drive restaurants, Airport, roads to other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: wilmadog
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites was a decent enough place with a good location, a nice breakfast and happy hour. The staff was helpful as well. That being said, I wouldn't return here as a business traveler. It's just too geared toward tourists - which is okay if you are a tourist. A decent spot for families with kids though. BTW, the mini crabcakes in the Restaurant are excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: Jenlm
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy. Much easier than if you go with a Disney Hotel! Disney Hotels are great, don't get me wrong, but staying off property has its benefits, too. Since I was there for business at the convention center, it was a no brainer to stay off property. However, getting to Disney was easy, on our days free. They have great shuttles. We shuttled to Disney and another day, took the city trolley to a mall. Both were pleasant and easy to figure out. The food at the hotel was great, although some days were really crowded. The people were really pleasant and helpful. Had a great trip. Not one complaint about the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGirl101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located within easy walking distance of numerous shops and restaurants and also offers great dining options at the hotel as well. The complimentary breakfast is wonderful and a great cost savings. The staff continually went above and beyond to make certain our stay was enjoyable. The rooms are exceptionally clean and comfortable and appear to be recently updated. I would certainly recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “An unfair review”
Reviews.Author: JAJORI
Reviews.Content: In the beginning, I do not belong to the right target group of the hotel. Especially during the summer breaks. I stayed in the hotel for five night with my son (16 yrs). The purpose of my trip was a conference, and my son accompanied me. The location is good, the suites ok. Nothing fancy, but spacious and comfortable enough. Hotel services seemed to be good, the friendlyness of the staff average except the bell boys or valets who were much friendlier and had a personal touch compared to the rest. The hotel was quite fully booked that caused a lot of queing in the breakfast, director's cocktail and for the elevators. The computers of the business lounge were also very busy. Anyhow, I do appreciate the complimentary breakfast and manager's cocktail in the Embassy Suites, but this time a made a wrong choice.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of false advertising”
Reviews.Author: cyndikab
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights with my 3 children. I had read many wonderful reviews and I had certain expectations. Some were on the mark - the breakfast was good, but could get very crowded. The room was nice and the staff was accomodating. However, a few things on their website should have been clearer. They advertise "free transportation to the parks". This is true - but VERY limited. There were 4 times you could leave from the hotel & 4 times you could get back from Magic Kingdom & Epcot. There was only ONE time for all of the other parks. None of the times were appealing, and most of them would have caused you to miss some of the coolest things in the park - like the Electric Parade and the Laser Show. We ended up driving ourselves and paying for parking. Also, one of my biggest complaints - they advertise "Hotel-wide internet access and free business center". The internet access in the rooms is $10 PER DAY and the business center (where you could access the internet for free) was 3 computers that were always in use. I had brought my laptop to upload vacation pictures to my Facebook, and once I finally was able to get to an open computer, Facebook was blocked. Overall, it was a nice hotel. However, for the price, I think they could have done better on the "free transportation" and the internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lots of restaurants and night life within walking distance.”
Reviews.Author: rbraccoon
Reviews.Content: This was not one of the nicest Embassy's we have stayed at but it was a great location with plenty of options for food,drink and activity. Univeral, Sea World and Disney World were all within 10-15 minutes away. We did have a rental car but noticed plenty of bus pickups at every block. We love the Embassy for their incredible breakfast and free manager's reception. AKA-happy hours!! The rooms are very nice, love the bedding and very spacious. You really can't go wrong. You MUST go eat at Maggiano's!!! (Across the street) The only downfall is the onsite restaraurant--just not that good. But tons of options around you.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: batmanGothamCity
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay. free cooked to order breakfast and nightly reception from 5pm-7pm. spacious rooms. staff were very helpful. good location on south of int. drive. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: p1ers
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated at the southern end of International Drive within walking distance of several good restaurants, definately the quieter & more relaxed end relatively speaking. Its a good location for driving to Disney as you can avoid the worst of the traffic & still convient for both Sea World & Universal. The hotel suites have plenty of room for the average family & are fairly well equipped although the bathrooms needed updating & the curtains shielding the living area from the atrium need improving. As has been mentioned by other reviews there is a gap at the sides which allows people to see in when walking past your room. Recommended restaurants within walking distance are: 1) The Olive Garden - Right next door, good Italian food excellent service/value. 2) Bahama Breeze - Opposite hotel 3) Orlando Ale House - 5 min walk, sports bar style (TV's everywhere) excellent atmosphere/service good choice of food & great drink offers 4) Ming Court - 5 min walk, expensive but good chinese 5) Cafe Tu Tu Tango - 5 min walk, Spanish (tapas) style with a Bohemian feel Breakfast had reasonable choice & free evening drinks between 5pm & 7pm were very welcome after a hard day at the parks. Hotel did become quiet after 7pm which could be seen as positive or negative, it didn't effect us as we had food out every night. Overall a good hotel, friendly staff & a great location. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and service!”
Reviews.Author: ThePotters06
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels but have never stayed at a hotel with such wonderful staff and service before. We stayed for 2 weeks for my 40th birthday and thanks to this hotel it will be one I'll always remember. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with smiles and the valets and concierge were so friendly with lots of good tips and advice. The reception was very helpful. It has been said on here that the breakfast is very samey but I'm not sure what people expect for breakfast? They had everything 'breakfasty' you could possibly want. They have a little shop and again I'm repeating myself but all the ladies working in the shop were so friendly. The rooms can be a little bit noisy but the location of the hotel is great for getting around. On my 40th I returned to our room and was greeted with a basketful of goodies and balloons from housekeeping. I'd like to say thank you again to all at the Embassy Suites for the best holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for conventions”
Reviews.Author: andru_nl
Reviews.Content: The complementary breakfast was excellent - made to order omlete - yum! The juices and yoghurt were fresh and tasty. I did not really try amything else. Rooms are quite spacious - it's a suites after all, have 2 big LCDs - and there are a LOT of HD channels in the states! So if you have to be in the room, you will always have something on the background - would it be news or a movie. Location was fine - especially for a convention center. It's basically a walkable distance - a taxy would cost 6-8$. But what's more important - it's located right in the middle of all bars/restaurants on the international drive - so if you wander out in the evening, you will find yourself right in the middle of very busy bars/live music/dancing/etc. Pretty nice. Room service was great - with swans, elefants made every day out of towels (i guess tipping helps :) Cons: - stains on a carpet in some places; bed linnen was not clean (the part which i pulled out from under the matrass had a stain) - shower design - it splashes a lot, and there is no separate regulation for the hot/cold and stream power - the curtains to the corridor do not close completely - so I used a chair to hold them - otherwise anyone can look into the room - no safe in the room - highway noice is mild but noticeable Even with all these cons, I still would definetly prefer this hotel to any else on the I-drive. It's so much better the twice expensive Rosen centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: maleekataher
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in the perfect location for us in the middle of I.Drive,room clean tidy spacious but could do with updating. Bed comfortable,shower had good pressure. Free breakfast included a first for us- normally never see this in the States saves a few dollars. Outdoor pool very small so is indoor but managed to get an uncomfortable lounger for a while. Shuttle to theme parks (which we never used as we wanted to beat the crowd's and got up early on most day's)We used the I- Ride which is not as frequent as was told sometimes waiting for 45mins.Taking the number 8 and then a 50 lynx bus to Disney was far more faster-but you must have the correct money to board. We hired a car the second week which was great, the sat nav was worth paying the extra as became invaluable for our first drivig holiday in the States we used Dollar which after looking around were the most reasonably priced.Free parking at Hotel. A restaurant rec would be Charley's Steakhouse on I.Drive fab tasting steak,High Tide Harry's (fish) & Millers Alehouse has good value drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: focussed77
Reviews.Content: I am not one for writing reviews, but when you get excellent service on multiple occasions it must be commended. The staff at Embassy Suites is easily one of the friendliest and most accomodating staff's I've ever seen in the industry. Not only are you given a FREE great breakfast (eggs cooked to order, pancakes and fresh waffles just to name a few) but managment consistently walks through each mourning greeting all those in the dining area with genuine conversation. The most impressive part for me and my family, who I've recommended this location to many times is that the actual General Manager of the hotel John Parkinson goes above ane beyond to make everyone feel welcomed at his hotel. My aunt recently stood there and had a slight issue with her refrigerator and he not only offered to move her to another room, he offered her an adjustment on her rate. Who does that now a days? I also wanted information on local area golf and he seemed to know everything. He not only gave me information, he set a tee time for me (at Metrowest Golf Course I recommend them as well) and was able to get me a discount on the round of golf. The Embassy Suites staff as a whole is top notch. I now look to stay in Embassy Suites whenever I travel.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaysfan21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Prior to our arrival the hotel contacted my dad and offered to combine both reservations into one and give us a 2 bedroom presidential suite because they were expecting a sellout. The room was very spacious and offered the privacy of two separate rooms. The complimentary cocktail hour was good drink and service wise. The snacks left little to be desired (stale tortilla chips & pretzels and salsa that seemed to be pizza sauce with peppers in it). The complementary breakfast in the morning was very good. Both food and service were great. The hotel features 2 pools, one outdoor and one indoor. We had our six month old daughter so we decided to stay out of the sun and go indoors. Both pools seemed to be taken care of properly and had plenty of towels. Self parking was easy and plentiful as it seemed that most of the guests (conventioneers) took ground transportation to the hotel. Overall this hotel was great. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ItsTheTruth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in April 2009. I would have no problem staying again at this hotel. The beds, pillows, and were extremely plush and comfortable with high thread counts on the lines. The rooms were well soundproofed and I received a full night of sleep each night. The breakfast, as usual, was perfect with cooked to order eggs, meats, fruits, juices, tasty coffee, danishes, etc. The rooms were very clean and "as modern" as other Embassy Suites in this price category. The location is one of the beauties of this hotel: 10 minutes to either Universal & Sea world, or around 15-20 minutes to the Disney parks. For the price, you'll want to put this hotel on the short list. The area in which the hotel is located seems very safe and family-oriented, which is important me. In case you are not familiar with this section of International Drive, there are literally dozens of restaurants, shops, and entertainment options within walking distance. Putt-Putt is across the street. The indoor pool and hot tubs were nicely heated. Although we did not use the outdoor pool, many other guests appeared to be enjoying the facilities. They also have a nice exercise facility with treadmills, weights, tv's on the treadmills, etc. They are thinly staffed in the bellstand and front desk positions, so please don't expect the same level of 4-5 star services like you get at a J W Marriott. But keep in mind, for the price, the services and facilities provided by this hotel certainly met me expectations. Compared to my stay 2 years ago, this hotel seemed more stingy on toiletries and towels..........but for the sake of conservation, I can appreciate. Again, I would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away”
Reviews.Author: ankwill
Reviews.Content: My husband and two teenagers enjoyed a spring break get away. The hotel check-in was the fastest service ever. The lobby of the hotel was a tranquil retreat from the harsh Indiana weather. The outdoor pool is beautiful with palm trees and nice sitting area. The indoor pool and hot tub were great after walking through the attractions all day. We were able to walk to dinner and shopping in the evening. The business center was very user friendly. The kids enjoyed the hotel pools and breakfast. The hotel staff was very eager to help us when we had rental car trouble. The hotel is centrally located between the major attractions. This hotel is a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “It was a FANTASTIC experience!”
Reviews.Author: amous
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was courteous and always willing to help in any way. The location of the hotel is within walking distance to many shopping areas and restaurants, which was great for my family of 4. The breakfast and happy hour is always great at the Embassy, and is something my family looks forward to when we travel for vacations. Our room was in great shape and it was big enough to where we did not feel that we were â€œon-topâ€� of one another. The bell-hop is great and does amazing flips for the kids. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to travel to Orlando for business or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: LynnYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed the first 2 weeks in March, have stayed in other Orlando hotels over the years, but none have been a patch on this hotel. From check-in to check-out the staff were helpful and always friendly. The atrium is a lovely setting for the complimentary breakfasts and evening drinks. The room we had was on the top floor overlooking I-4, but this wasn't a disadvantage, as if we were in the room at the right times we had lovely sunsets and had great views of the finreworks at EPCOT and Magic Kingdom. Our room was very spacious and spotlessly clean, I couldn't fault it. The complimentary breakfasts were very nice, the omelette station was lovely and very efficient, and the buffets were plentiful and fresh. The complimentary drinks each evening were a nice added bonus, pleasant just to have a drink or two before we set out for dinner. The queues were never long and the bar staff very friendly and efficient. The location couldn't be faulted, at the better end of International Drive and within easy walking distance of ample restaurants. The choice of pools and hot tubs was nice with ample towels and loungers, never too crowded. Didn't get to use the Fitness Room, as we just didn't have the time. We did however make use of the Business Centre. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Riverwalk_lover
Reviews.Content: I had made reservations for a room with a balcony since I really enjoy sitting on a balcony in the evenings. However upon my arrival I was givin a room without a balcony. They put me on the second floor with a small window and the view was looking at the roof of the kitchen. When I asked for a different room they said no more rooms were available. They had the window bolted shut so you couldnt even get any fresh air. the Maid only showed up one day out of the 4 days we were there. By the time we left we had 3 extra bags a trash laying around. The price for a room like this was very pricy. Charging me $220.00 a night. The High Speed internet is very slow. Then they charge you 9.95 a day for the service. Then when we left I asked the bellHop to call a cab for us. He said he They have thier own taxi service. I seen the cab driver giving money to the bellHop then the driver charged me $45.00 for a 8 mile ride to the airport! I suggest you call for your own Taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mainieri
Reviews.Content: While I am an Orlando resident, I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Hotel Orlando, as I was spending the evening enjoy the attractions on International Drive. I have stayed at this location before, and was always incredibly impressed. The rooms are spacious and a great value; and the staff members are all friendly and attentive. I will definitely return to the hotel and recommend it to anyone that is traveling to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A staff that went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaKay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites International Drive for Christmas break with our grandkids ages 7 and 9 and had such a good time. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. My husband sprained his ankle two days into our trip and the front desk helped us rent a motorized wheel chair during our stay that was delivered right to us! They also sent a nice get well basket to our room with goodies for our family; they went above and beyond to make our vacation memorable. You could tell the staff really cares about the people who stay there. Not to mention the wonderful free breakfast! We will be returning next Christmas and wouldnâ€™t stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “great stay but few flaws”
Reviews.Author: scot-cypriot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas and New year for 15 nights. The best thing about this property is the location, it is very close to lots of great restaurants and well located to get out and about without a car. The area is great and lovely for walking around . We used the lynx bus service and the I-ride lots and found this to be fine. Breakfast at the hotel was mayhem most mornings and became very repetative. Managers reception offered free drinks and nibbles for two hours every night, we dropped by a few times but the lines for service were a bit much (one bar person only) would have been better if they had more bar tenders at this busy time of year. We ate only once in the Fisheye grill and found the food to be very good and reasonably priced. Overall the hotel served it's purpose for us and it was great to have the extra space with the suite instead of just a hotel room. Reception staff were friendly most of the time and so were the entire hotel staff. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveToTravel7173
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our 3rd two week stay in Sept/Oct 2008. Previously we stayed here in April 2006 and Dec/Jan 2008. The staff always provide excellent service, are helpful and approachable. The rooms are good sizes, breakfast is typically American â€“ great selection and portions! The location is ideal for theme parks, shopping (Florida Mall, Mall Of Millennia, and Outlet stores) and main highways to Miami / NASA etc. Varied and quality restaurants minutes away and having the Olive Garden next door is a must for dining on the first night. The location is much better than others on International Drive. We will always continue to stay at this hotel whenever we visit Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, quality hotel in good location for parks”
Reviews.Author: Nicola B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, good value and above average. The rooms are large and we were given a room on the top floor so nice views with the lights. The breakfast was decent with variety and good coffee. The hotel was pretty full but we managed to get breakfast quickly and found a table. Pretty civialised. Hotel was walking distance to Olive Garden Restaurant and Bahamas Breeze restaurant and bar - good cheap cocktails. 15 minute walking to cinema but wasnt impressed with the shops. We went to Prime Shopping outlet - good shopping. Hotel is definatley in the better area of International Drive and is a great location to Universal and Disney etc etc

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JackieWestmeath
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for christmas 2008.we were in a 1 bedroom suite with our 2 kids (10 & 13).the check-in was quick and there was no wait.the staff were very helpful. the kids were supposed to share the sofa bed but they decided to fight over who had more room,blankets etc and I mentioned this at reception the next morning and they had a rollaway sent to the room.the hotel provide a complimentry cooked breakfast with omelettes,cooked breakfast,fruit & cereal etc.they also had a managers sundowner reception every evening between 5.30pm abd 7.30pm.they had free cocktails,alcohol and soda for the kids. they also had a few non-alcoholic cocktails for the kids.there were snacks also.chips and dips,pretzels and a popcorn machine.the pool was lovely but small.It was a 10 minute drive to the Disney Parks and it was surrounded by many restaraunts.Overall I would highly reccomend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kennyboyEngland
