Reviews.Content: just got back from a two weeks stay with the wife daughter son in law and two grand children the suites were exellent the food also the staff were out of this world nothing to much trouble and the managers free bar put the icing on the cake indoor and outdoor pools superb cant waite for 2009 to return keep up the exellent work reguards k and d henson and family

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoseyP
Reviews.Content: Myself and family stayed in this hotel for 16 nights and I cannot fault it at all. It is a nice hotel to look at and is very clean and comfortable. The staff that we came in contact with were all very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast buffet had something for everyone and the free drinks/snack's for a couple of hours each evening were an added bonus. If I had a complaint it would be that the swimming pool was freezing and although checked over by the helpful maintenance man no problem was found even though he agreed it shouldn't have been that temperature! That aside I would stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trips27
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a three night stay at the Embassy Suites. It was wonderful. I had read ALL the reviews regarding the hotel and almost all of the positive reviews are true! The hotel is easy to find and located near everything. TGIF, Bahama Breeze, Walgreens, a movie theater, stores, Friendly's, Tony Rama's, and many other eateries are nearby and within walking distance. We never took the Trolley so Iâ€™m not sure about that but I did see a large bus every morning and evening outside the hotel for Disney/Universal transport. Now onto details regarding the hotel: The outside is currently in the process of being re-painted into a pretty yellow/gold color, which I must say is much more appealing than the blue and white theme they previously had going on. The outside looks great with the new paint! When you first walk in the hotel the staff is eager and friendly to greet you and the decoration is pretty. The atrium is nice and kept very clean and despite being Thanksgiving weekend, it was never too crowded or loud. The hotel has 8 floors and we stayed on the 5th with a room facing the front. Our view and room were great. It was nice and clean and things looked recently renovated. The master bedroom has a flat screen TV as well as the Living room. All and all I would rate the rooms a 4, the only reason I would not rate a 5 is because 1- the bathroom could be a bit bigger, and 2- the curtains in the living room could be a bit longer to prevent outsiders from looking in. Other than that no complaints, we enjoyed our stay. As for the breakfast there was pancakes, sausage, bacon, eggs, omelets, hash browns, grits, potatoes, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, and juice; and the food was very good. The staff kept the food coming out hot and there were not a bunch of kids running around spilling things. There are ample places to sit also. As for the managers reception there were free drinks, popcorn, chips and salsa. Regarding the staff everyone was very helpful especially the concierge, both of the guys who worked there were willing to go above and beyond, they were the best people we met there. The bartenders could use a little work, but I think because they were so swamped each evening that contributed to their cranky demeanor. The outdoor pool is very very small but the inside pool is nice. The fitness center also has treadmills with individual TV's on them! Well I think that's everything, if you need somewhere to stay in Orlando definitely choose this hotel over the one on Jamaican Court. We went over there to check it out and it looked over crowded, full of kids, dated and worn! Stick with this one!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable.....”
Reviews.Author: C4G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few nights and had a wonderful staff experience. Our room was on the 7th floor, (I recommend a higher room for the view of downtown Orlando) and it had apparently been redone very recently. The LCD was nice and so were the granite bar-countertops. We certainly enjoyed the happy hour, free and the breakfast buffet which was one of the best i have ever had, free. We even got a late check out so that we could go across the street to the Pointe Orlando and watch a 3D-movie and have some drinks. Clearly we enjoyed ourselves but surprisingly spent more time in our room then normal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Book it!”
Reviews.Author: tan-monster
Reviews.Content: Booked for four nights prior to a cruise and one night post cruise. Everything was really fine and I am suprised the hotel is not rated higher on this web-site? Suites are really spacious clean and modern with "two" flat screen televisons in each room! Central for all locations and no need for a car at night as you can safely walk to bars and restaurents. The "managers special" of two hours of free drinks between 5.30pm & 7.30pm is a fantastic way to get your evenings off to a really great start We must offer a special mention to "Roddy" on the information desk who help plan our travel route each day "what a star" use him! Also try the Embassy Suites at Deerfield just outide Fort Lauderdale if you are doing a cruise as this was another good hotel (on the beach)

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Experience”
Reviews.Author: jobymaloby
Reviews.Content: First the positive: the hotel is in a great location. The rest of the experience was dire. The check-in staff were rude and insolent, even though I was staying as an Hilton frequent stayer. The girl could hardly be bothered to communicate with me and I'm sure she never looked at me. She was the perfect excuse to install automated check-in desks, as the experience would have made me feel more welcome. The rooms, as a few other reviewers have said, are really tired and in serious need of refurbishment, in fact the whole hotel is. The breakfast was a typical basic breakfast that you would get from a far cheaper hotel. If you are just looking for somewhere to sleep and spend the minimum f time in, then I suppose it is OK, as you can walk out to restaurants etc, but you can from many other hotels on I Drive too. I definitely would not recommend this hotel - there are far better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Facilities”
Reviews.Author: sh55
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally situated within easy walking distance of quite a selection of restaurants. Free transport to all parks provided, but, if you need it Bus stop & IDRIVE Trolley stop immediately outside hotel. Hotel staff extremely friendly, and breakfast buffet & Managers reception were excellent. Swimming pools clean and well maintained. Would recommend Hotel to anyone and would certainly go there again..

Reviews.Title: “Not a big fan”
Reviews.Author: nautwerks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy for 1 night before a business conference at the Convention Center. The staff was very friendly, check in was quick and efficient and the looby was very nice. That is pretty much where the "nice" part of the hotel ended. My room was right across from the elevator doors which made for a pretty noisy night. Couple that with the fact that the front door has 2 large windows on either side made privacy pretty much non-existant. I on several occaisions looked up to see people peeking in around the blinds into my room. The room was very dark and smelled like a basement...damp and moldy. I have no allergies whatsoever and this room had me stuffed up like I had a bad cold! I finally turned off the A/C, opened the window and let in the 90 degree humid air just to get some fresh air circulating. The TV was a joke...I think it was about a 14" model from the mid 1980's. The bed was very comfortable! No complaints there. Breakfast was actually pretty good, fresh and pretty tasty. The bell staff got me a cab which turned out to b just be some guy with a towncar and dollars in his eyes. I took the cab to the convention center which is only a few miles for which I was charged $20. I finally got him down to $10 but only after threatening to call the transit authority. When I got back Imentioned this to the manager who didnt seem to be too concerned. If you are looking for a no-frills place to sleep then this is your place...just bring your decongestant.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: floridafans99
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holiday and it was brilliant We have stayed in Orlando before, but never at the Embassy Suites, so this was a first and everything was perfect. The suite was clean, the free breakfast was really great and the managers free cocktails every night was the icing on the cake. The staff were polite and helpful and nothing was too much bother. We were so impressed that we have just booked again for next year and thoroughly recommend it to eveyone.

Reviews.Title: “Some drawbacks, but not a bad place overall”
Reviews.Author: geniph
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference in June of 2008. I chose it specifically because I've always liked the Embassy Suites hotels; I like the hot breakfast and the full suites. I arrived after a grueling 8-hour flight and an over 2-hour wait for a shuttle to the hotel (there were 14,000 people in the area for the conference), and made it just barely in time to catch the last five minutes of the manager's reception. I took my glass of wine with me up to the room before I even dropped off my bags. ;-) I caught that manager's reception every night, and the bartender was great; by the second night, she was pouring my wine as soon as she saw me, and was unfailingly friendly and efficient. I was a little taken aback by the room; it was very dim and smelled extremely musty (I later found out this is pretty common for Orlando; everything is humid and rather mildewy owing to the climate). I was also disappointed to get a third-floor room DIRECTLY over the HVAC units when I'd specifically requested a high floor. The rooms have no windows, just a tiny little balcony (it's actually too narrow to stand on), and my balcony overlooked the aforementioned giant (LOUD) HVAC units and the freeway. Not exactly scenic. The rooms are peculiar; to admit some light to the living room, they have floor-to-ceiling windows on either side of the front door which look out onto the hallway. Given that people are going up and down the hall right outside those windows, it's not as if you can leave the curtains open. The layout otherwise is nice; the bedroom especially was quite spacious. Lighting over the desk/table was somewhat inadequate, and the hotel charged $10/day to use their wi-fi, which seems excessive to me. Power outlets were adequate. The bedding was quite comfortable and there were ample lamps and lights in the bedroom. I can't comment on the TVs, as I never turned them on, nor the pools, as I never used them. The elevators were slower than molasses. I really appreciated the mini-fridge and microwave, since I was there for a week. It would have been nice to have a real coffeemaker, not a miniature one. I very much disliked the air conditioning; the filters obviously badly needing changing, as the a/c was causing me horrible allergy issues. I tried turning it off and opening the balcony slider, but between the heat and humidity, the bugs (there's no screen on the slider, which I find extremely peculiar), and the exhaust fumes from the HVAC and the freeway, that wasn't practical as an option. As other reviewers have mentioned, there's a constant white noise from the A/C. Probably not a bad thing, since the plumbing is quite loud; you hear every nearby shower and toilet flush. Weirdly, the wastebaskets in the suite were never emptied during my week-long stay, even though housekeeping had clearly been in to make the bed and replace linens. Since I quite often have dinner in my room (and thus have food waste to dispose of), that was a distressing oversight. I also came back to my room twice after housekeeping had been in and found the door wasn't all the way closed, which was unnerving. Anyone could have simply pushed it open. Hotel staff were very helpful, when I did have occasion to deal with them. I needed to print a boarding pass on the last day of my stay, but the printers in the business center were both malfunctioning. The desk clerk was kind enough to print it for me. The valets out front were especially helpful and friendly. The lines for the hot breakfast were horrifically long each morning, so I ended up giving up on it. I never did have a made-to-order breakfast during my stay. The coffee at breakfast was AWFUL. I know I'm a coffee snob, but that stuff was paint remover. The location is quite convenient - far enough off I-Drive to not get too much noise, but right there for all the restaurants, shops, etc. Don't count on using the I-Drive Trolley to get around, though - I had three of them pass me up one night before I gave up on that as a form of transportation. Overall, this wasn't an unpleasant stay, but I think the Jamaican Court Embassy Suites is a slightly nicer hotel, and there are options much closer to the convention center (it's within walking distance, presuming you don't pass out from the heat and humidity) if you want to avoid having to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, nasty staff”
Reviews.Author: Beatrice01
Reviews.Content: The female staff at the desk were very condescending, but the men were much nicer. The women didn't feel like answering questions and made that clear. The room (after my fight with one of these women) was clean, spacious,and well appointed. Overall, the hotel was good, but we were disappointed in the shuttle service and its limited schedule. The website implies that the shuttle goes to all of the parks, but you have to transfer at the transportation center. The breakfast was disappointing, and the lines for the Manager's Special were always way too long. I've stayed at other Embassy Suites that were much better.

Reviews.Title: “NOT Impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: varthur
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our vacation today. I was quite dissapointed with the rooms.They were very humid and musky. The A/C was very loud. The floor was damp. The rooms need to be updated.The bathroom sink was broken and the paint was chipped on the wall and door. The first day we arrived we had breakfast. It was so awful that we decided to eat out the remainder of the trip. I have stayed at many Embassy Suites and never experienced anything like this before. I certainly wont do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: emolloy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 12 nights in June 2008. We wanted to go to the theme parks and also to relax by the pool on a couple of days and this hotel was just perfect for what we wanted. Firstly, the hotel staff were so accomodating. The concierge were really friendly and helpful, as were the reception staff. The reception staff took some postcards from me that I needed to mail and they didnt charge, its nice to get something for nothing now and again!! The staff in the breakfast were very friendly aswell. Every morning we had the same experience, staff coming over asking us was the breakfast ok and did we need anything else. Breakfast was lovely. Omelettes and Pancakes cant be beaten and they have a good range of juices/cereals/fruit too. The outdoor pool is small, but there are plenty of sun loungers there and it is very quiet during the day as most of the people are out at the parks. The indoor pool is lovely and relaxing aswell. My husband used the gym and, while it was small, he said the equipment that was there was good. Also, we used the business centre which has complimentary internet access. This was good for checking flights and banks etc. In relation to the theme parks - perfect location! There is a free bus that goes from directly outside the hotel entrance. It only comes and goes at certain times though (you can get a timetable from reception). But if you find that you are finished in the parks before/after the bus leaves, the local bus service goes past the hotel aswell. The hotel is closer to Universal Studios (about 10mins) than it is to disney (about 20mins), but its not too far whatever way you look at it!! The location of the hotel is very close to lots of restaurants. There is a really nice steakhouse (Charleys) just about 10 minute walk up International Drive and if you want to wander a bit further, there is a fantastic Seafood restaurant. About 5 minute walk down the other end of Int Drive, there is a really nice Chinese restaurant (ming court) and I would higly recommend all of these restaurants. There is also a good bar across from the hotel and a supermarket just down the street too. Our accomodation was good. Seperate bedroom and living area. There was a fridge, microwave, coffee facilities, sink in the living area along with work desk and tv. bathroom had bath/shower and the bedroom had a tv aswell. Overall, I really cant fault any aspect of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Checked out”
Reviews.Author: jasonrollin
Reviews.Content: We make the quick trip to Orlando a lot and always stay at the Embassy. We love the location; there's a ton of places to eat in walking distance, attractions, a mall and a movie plaza. They have a great staff and breakfast each morning. There are 3 of us, so the extra space is great. They should paint the building through, but the atrium is very lush. Try Oeanair and Roys is you like Seafood. We love them!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Siobs05
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, but the only downfall was getting transport to Disney, NOTE: You will have to hire a car, lucky for us we got a nice convertible, it is such an easy place to drive around once you have the sat nav! Hotel very clean and safe, downfall was the breakfast but we got over that. Overall enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for business”
Reviews.Author: TWTraveler
Reviews.Content: This one's for the business travelers looking for a place to stay near the convention center. First, it's not too far to walk to the convention center if the weather isn't too hot. With the heat and humidity it could be too far, especially in a suit. The wireless internet was good--it was nice to be able to use it out in the atrium, and it was better in parts of my room vs. others. The hotel as a whole was pretty quiet, even with families and non-business vacationers there. You really didn't get noise from other rooms, either. One thing I loved is that they had plenty of outlets for chargers. I hate having to hunt around behind tables just to plug in my cell phone. The restaurant downstairs was pretty nice for grabbing something quick, and there are a ton of places around the hotel for food, too. It was also nice having a Walgreens so close. Two things I didn't like as a business traveler: no safes in the rooms, and with the windows on the front of the rooms people walking by could see into the front room! I couldn't for the life of me figure out a way to rig the curtains to get them to not gap so people couldn't see in. As far as general things for the hotel, the beds were comfy, it was nice having the counter and mirror in the bedroom to spread out (which I bet would be very convenient with two or more people in a room), the cleaners always did a great job, although I never used the pool it never seemed too crowded and it looked pretty nice, and the staff were always friendly and helpful. As far as the mustiness others mentioned, I cranked up the AC in the room my first night and that either took care of it or I got used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare On I Drive”
Reviews.Author: EsotericDallasMan
Reviews.Content: I was moved to three rooms in 1 night. AC died in the first room. Engineering fixed it and left me with a system that was actually producing heat. It was hotter in the room then it was outdoors. I was move to a second room. The water didn't work. They moved me to a third room. Upon entering I discovered that I lost my reserved king bed and was now on the highway side of the building and was able to enjoy the sounds of traffic on my full size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: VAfinche
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip yesterday from this hotel. It is in a great location on International Drive. There is an Olive Garden next door, a Denny's, Bahama Breeze and a few other restaurants across the street. It is less than 15 minutes to Disney World Parks and much less to Universal Studios and Wet n Wild. The only minor problem we had with this hotel is that the room we stayed in faced I-4 highway and we could hear the traffic passing by at night. Most nights we were so exhausted from our days at the parks we didn't notice the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: walkek
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights from May 15th-17th. When we first arrived, the hotel room was clean and cool. It was a bit musty and a little humid but nothing too bad. There was a sitting area with a couch, TV, table and bar area with a sink and refrigerator. The Bathroom was clean and the shower had great pressure. The bedroom was separate with a dresser, TV and large closet. There is also a vanity area in the bedroom as well which make it nice for two people getting ready in the morning. Because the room was a bit humid the bed felt a little damp. The lobby area is nice as is the bar at the hotel restaurant. We didnâ€™t visit the pool but it looked decent. It is very close to many attractions and restaurants on International Drive. Be sure to visit the Caribbean Breeze across the street for some good food, music and cocktails. Overall was a good experience, and I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: LegoJoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2008 for 4 nights. Upon check-in they gave us a room (220) which was right next to the elevator motors. The noise was unbearable and unending, so we requested another room. In addition, we recommend asking for a room on the front side of the hotel away from I-4 which can be heard from inside your room especially in the evenings. This is true for most hotels on International Drive. The hotel restaurant service was very good--the restaurant delivered my lunch right out to me at the pool (even thought it's not a restaurant at the pool). Also, they opened up the restaurant a little early just to get me a cup of coffee, which was going above and beyond. And, you can't beat Embassy Suites free breakfast and evening manager's receptions. The pool chairs had towels on them awaiting our arrival. The pool is very small, but quiet and relaxing. If you are looking for a more action packed pool for kids, try Radisson Resort Celebration in Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kizzlexy
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed in this location. I was attending a seminar and wanted something close by. The first time I stayed the price was about $105, I felt that was a really good deal. This time I guess because of the season it was $198. for that price, I would say stay somewhere else. Although the location is good Embassy is could stand for some improvements. For $198 you could stay at a Westin or hotel with a heavenly bed. Embassy has pretty good beds but those old fashion cheesy bed covers, rooms not up to par with other hotels at that rate. I guess I'm picky. I'm rating it above average because they have a great breakfast with Omelets etc...Good happy hour with excellent Pina Colada's and friendly staff. Across from some great restaurants- Bahama Breeze is excellent. All in all was a good experience, I would stay there again but at a lower rate. For $198 I'm looking for a different hotel. All in all was a good experiance, I would stay there again but at a lower rate. For $198 I'm looking for a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice Embassy Suite”
Reviews.Author: Mark333
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days while attending a convention. Hotel is very convenient to the convention center, which was perfect for us. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. Easy access to hotel from I-4 via Sand Lake. Hotel staff was perfect and very helpful from check in thru helping us find different restaurants to eat at. Room was very quiet and comfortable , could not hear anyone in the rooms on either side of us, above or below us. You could sometimes hear room doors being closed, but this was not annoying. Morning cooked to order breakfast was always good and the evening managers reception was very nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: JackieGarrard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for a week in December and really enjoyed it. The staff were extremely friendly from the receptionists (who gave my son a little present and posted a christmas card for us) to the concierge (who kindly organised a town car to take us to Port Canaveral). The cleaning staff were also very friendly and kept our room very clean and tidy. The 1 bed suite was great. The only issue we had with the room is that it smelt a little musty when you first walked in but you soon got used to it. The room was a good size, a huge king sized bed and a comfortable sleeper sofa in the lounge that my son slept in. There was a fridge which was handy to store drinks and a microwave but we found it strange that they didn't have any plates or cutlery in the room. Whilst we didn't do any cooking it would be a struggle to eat anything in the room without any cutlery. Apart from that we couldn't fault it. Also, the windows kept the noise of the I4 out of the room so we weren't waken up by the traffic noise. We didn't really use the hotel pools as we tended to be out from dawn till dusk. My husband and son went for an early morning swim in the indoor pool one day and enjoyed it. My husband used the fitness room most days and whilst it wasn't huge it was satisfactory enough to burn off some calories from the huge portion sizes at dinner!! The inclusive breakfast was great and there was plenty of choice. It was sometimes busy but we always managed to find somewhere to sit. We really liked the free cocktail reception at night from 5.30 - 7.30 where you could drink free beer and wine. Obviously there was a limited selection but the choice was not as restrictive as I thought it would be. They also offered litlle snacks like nachos. Hurricanes lounge was closed for refurbishment when we visited so didn't eat at the hotel. However who would want to when you've got so many great restaurants right on your doorstep. The location of the hotel was perfect for walking out at night. The restaurants we went to in the area which we really enjoyed were Cafe Tu Tu Tango (tapas food), Opa (greek restaurant at Pointe Orlando - great fun), Don Pablos (mexican) and Kobe (Japanese Teppinyaki). All in all the hotel was perfect for us. We would have no hesitation in recommending to others and will definitely stay there again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: easygoingeezer
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at a hotel with more stars, but on this occaision we were taking my 8 year old nephew so wanted a more child friendly hotel with rooms that had doors inside the building rather than facing on to grounds or carparks. We were very pleasantly suprised when we arrived, very very friendly and polite staff in every department, non of the usual "whatever" expressions we have experienced in previous years especially at the Wyndham Orlando down the road. The room/suite was newley refurbished, fresh and clean and had lots of room. The little one had the lounge area and found the pull out double bed comfy and loved having his own TV. Not normally one for breakfasts we were actually quite impressed with what was on offer, some reports suggest that its a bit stodgy and not much choice, but there was fry up, fruit, porridge, cereals, bagels, toast, jam and pastries on offer so i can't think why anyone could be dissatisfied. the managers invitation to a couple of free drinks was much appreciated and with it being low season there wasn't a scrum for drinks, very civilised actually, can't say I have been anywhere that offers a total of 4 long island iced teas for free thats $40 worth anywhere else. the food available in the restaurant was more than acceptable especially the baby back ribs, apparantly the restaurant is due for a complete renovation soon. If you are a family and want a safe/clean place to stay surrounded by staff that actually give you the impression your a welcome and appreciated guest this is the place. I hope some staff read this report they certainly deserve recognition. thanks Chris sunley

Reviews.Title: “Great quick trip”
Reviews.Author: USArmy14
Reviews.Content: We live about 40 min outside of Orlando and often make weekend trips to Disney. I've stayed here before and have anyways been happy. We tried to cancel, but were within 3 days of arrival so would have received a 1 night penalty. We changed our other plans and still made the trip. We had a great time. I knew they were renovating, becuase it was a little loud on my last stay. Looks like they are done now and the rooms are very nice and they have a great staff. We have stopped staying in the big resort hotels, in a medium hotel like this; you get great service and most of the sercives of the big ones. They had a big Army group in which was cool because I am in the Army. Overall, great suite, very clean and great new renovation! Looking forward to our next trip here!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy suites fantastic”
Reviews.Author: KevBlackwell
Reviews.Content: Staff were excellent, room clean and spacious. Breakfast was very good with lots of choice. Swimming pool a little small but o.k.It was a very pleasant two weeks holiday and would go back again. Great for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: NeedM0reH0lidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April for seven nights, and really enjoyed our stay. We were on holiday with our two year old daughter and needed somewhere with a bit more space, so the suite we stayed in was ideal. The rooms were well furnished and well equipped, and were kept spotlessly clean all the time we were there. There was a spacious lounge and dining area with mini kitchenette, a nice bathroom and large bedroom with comfortable king size bed. There was plenty of space for clothes etc in the bedroom, with large wardrobes and drawers provided. The service we received from all staff we encountered could not be faulted, everyone was very friendly and eager to please. The complimentary breakfast, although not the best meal we've ever eaten, was more than adequate, with a reasonable selection. We didn't eat at the hotel every morning but when we did we all enjoyed what we had. The location of the hotel was also fantastic. It was at what we thought was the nicer end of International Drive, down towards Sea World. If you turned right out of the hotel you were less than five minutes walk to Pointe Orlando, and if you turned left out of the hotel you were five minutes away fom the Mercardo Centre, both contained some lovely restaurants, bars and shops. We were travelling as part of a large group and were the only ones staying at the Embassy Suites, and when our families came to look at our room and the rest of the hotel, everyone said that they would stay at this hotel next time they came to Orlando. All in all, a very nice stay. Well located for all the attractions and theme parks, easy walking distance to a lot of nice restaurants and bars, and very comfortable and spacious accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Not Embassy Suites Standard”
Reviews.Author: drsmarty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and in need of renovation. The free deluxe breakfast was anything but. It had a school cafeteria feel and there were only a few ingredients for the omelets (not to mention the ingredients were buffet style, yes buffet style, so everyone gets to breathe on and touch them. The room did smell musty, but I saw no mold. We reserved the room for a week, but checked out after one night. The hotel staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very old”
Reviews.Author: June6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not ok for the price. Our room was so old and musty, it smelt horrible like old mildew. It also had a very damp feel to it. The suite was smaller than pictures. It was not clean, the shower rings that were supposed to be silver were totally covered in rust. The room was very very old and I would not recommend this hotel. The only thing good about the hotel was the check in staff and the breakfast. I would not have stayed there more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bocaballroom
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during Memorial Day weekend. We were greeted upon arrival by the friendliest and most entertaining vale/ bellman. They did acrobatics, smiled, and interacted with the children. The hotel was attractive, yet older and a little worn, but still it was clean. We loved having a suite- plenty of sinks and spaces for adults and children. Kids loved the beautiful courtyard lobby and fountains. I would recommentd this hotel to budget minded travelers. By the way the free hot breakfast was definitely institution style food. It filled us up, but not delicious by any means. Having said that- the front desk was very accomodating with an early check-in. also good location for restaurants and Sea World. A positive experience in all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaBolton
Reviews.Content: Back in Manchester UK today after 2 weeks in Florida (and yes it's raining here!). Our first 3 nights were spent at the Embassy Suite Convention Centre and what a great hotel this was, nothing was too much trouble, the staff were fabulous and extremely polite and helpful. It was our Silver Wedding Anniversary and not only did they give us a voucher for a free meal in the restaurant, but when my boss rang the hotel to organise a bottle of Champagne, the HouseKeeper personally went to the local store for him and bought an Anniversary Card to go with it ! Suites were big , nice comfy bed plus a large fridge to allow you to bring and store own drinks/food if required but as others have said between 5.30 and 7.30 every evening it's Managers hospitality time and drinks are free with no restrictions on what you can have - plus crisps and dips. The barman in the Hurricane Bar was excellent, really helpful with directions/tips on where to go etc and breakfast whilst limited choice was very good (and included in cost) Being a 'weight watcher' they make omelettes to order and I had no probs having healthy option of egg white omelette with spinach and mushrooms (trust me it's tasty) . Would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone and would def go back when next in Orlando - it's not the cheapest but you get what you pay for and there's an awful lot of flea pits on I Drive . Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Never Knew you could use a towel like that!”
Reviews.Author: sombochris
Reviews.Content: At first I thought this holiday was going to be a disaster. The coach left us to the embassy suites at "Jamaican Court", rather than the "convention address". The guy on the desk was totally un helpful . I was really glad when we were able to identify the mistake and quickly escape being treated very badly (I could not begin to imagine what 2 weeks of his abrupt unsurley treatment would have been like). Fortunately a very short taxi ride sorted the problem. On entering The 'Convention suites' it was blatantly apparrent they were offering far superior treatment to guests. The staff were all, without exception extremely pleasant and helpful. The maid created a different towel oragimi each day, swans, elephants, bears etc. The kids looked forward to opening the suite each day we returned from the theme parks to see her latest creation. Free drinks evey evening for two hours, with popcorn and chrisps for the kids. This proved very handy as you could get a pager from the local restaurants, enjoy free cocktails and then quickly skip the queue when paged. Local restaurants include the Bahama breeze- try their Bahama Rita cocktail, the olive garden and TGIFs. The Trolley stop is right outside the hotel so you can sail up and down International Drive at Your Leisure(the hotel sells tickets). There is also a free coach to Disney and the courtesy coach to Bushe Gardens is close by. The out door swimming pool is heated and can be enjoyed even in the rain. The indoor pool is cold, but great on a hot day. Breakfast time is very busy and sometimes you have to wait a long time on a lift. Not many Healthy options available at breakfast, but then again if you want to eat healthy international drive proably isn't the best place for you (I put on 1/2 stone in 2 weeks- Great!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by all”
Reviews.Author: pug1309
Reviews.Content: Just returned to Scotland after staying 17 great nights at the ES. We travelled with another family , both families consisting of 2 Adults & 2 children , neither family could fault this hotel in any shape or form. The high points were the breakfast that catered for everyone's taste and the the managers drink reception was enjoyable, during our stay which included the Wireless convention, Spring break & Easter holidays ( very busy to say the least) we never had to wait long for breakfast or a free drink. Some people on previous reviews complained they had to wait up to 30 minutes for a free drink, but if they were that desperate for a drink they could have nipped to the Hurricane bar in the hotel and bought one, simple as. With regards to the up keep of the hotel , again i have no complaints, the maid we had on level 5 was polite, very friendly and carried out her duties to a very high standard, this included some great towel designs. All staff could not be faulted on any fronts, from the ladies on reception, bar staff and porters all were polite and curtious beyond the call of duty. It seemed genuine and not an act , unlike some other hotels that i have stayed at. Indoor pool was great for early morning wake up swim and out door pool small but the kids loved it. Location is great for I Drive and all its eating and entertainment. Bus times for parks where a little odd either to late or to early , but free is always a good price and you accept what you cannot change. We did use taxis more than we used the shuttle bus, but that was to suit our requirments. Would return here again with no hesistaion and will reccomend this hotel without any worries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to be near attractions and away from kids”
Reviews.Author: kaeagan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here to be near Sea World, Discovery Cove and Universal Studios (this location is smack dab in the middle of those, all 2 miles apart). Across the street are tons of restaruants and they are building a mall and movie theatre, but it isn't finished yet. Good news about this hotel is it is clean and not many kids. Only bad news about this hotel is that hotel bar is pretty boring and outdated and happy hour line is long (but you can't really complain since that part is complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are quite dated; breakfast same every day”
Reviews.Author: pandyVancouver
Reviews.Content: We booked the Embassy because we have two kids and thought the suites would give us extra space. Actually the 'suite' is probably smaller than other regular hotel rooms we've stayed in. The living room fits barely the TV, dining table, and sofabed. Everything felt like a tight squeeze the whole time we were there. We were also disappointed that the bathroom fixtures and room furniture/decor were so dated. Hot water was inconsistent from day to day. Hotel staff was very friendly and it was a plus to have both an indoor and an outdoor pool. As for food, we were surprised that the breakfast menu was exactly the same every morning. We were there for 9 nights... it would have been nice for them to alternate between pancakes, french toast, waffles, etc.
